Hebrew: דִּבְרֵ֥י נְחֶמְיָ֖ה בֶּן־חֲכַלְיָ֑ה וַיְהִ֤י בְחֹֽדֶשׁ־כִּסְלֵו֙ שְׁנַ֣ת עֶשְׂרִ֔ים וַאֲנִ֥י הָיִ֖יתִי בְּשׁוּשַׁ֥ן הַבִּירָֽה׃
Translated:
The narrative of Nehemiah son of Hacaliah:
In the month of Kislev of the twentieth year, when I was in the fortress of Shushan,
Transliteration: diverey nechemeyah ven-chakhaleyah vayehiy vechodesh-khiselev shenat esheriym vaaniy hayiytiy veshushan haviyrah

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֨א חֲנָ֜נִי אֶחָ֧ד מֵאַחַ֛י ה֥וּא וַאֲנָשִׁ֖ים מִֽיהוּדָ֑ה וָאֶשְׁאָלֵ֞ם עַל־הַיְּהוּדִ֧ים הַפְּלֵיטָ֛ה אֲשֶֽׁר־נִשְׁאֲר֥וּ מִן־הַשֶּׁ֖בִי וְעַל־יְרוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃
Translated: Hanani, one of my brothers, together with some men of Judah, arrived, and I asked them about the Jews, the remnant who had survived the captivity, and about Jerusalem.
Transliteration: vayavo chananiy echad meachay hu vaanashiym miyhudah vaeshealem al-hayehudiym hafeleytah asher-nishearu min-hasheviy veal-yerushala͏im

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמְרוּ֮ לִי֒ הַֽנִּשְׁאָרִ֞ים אֲשֶֽׁר־נִשְׁאֲר֤וּ מִן־הַשְּׁבִי֙ שָׁ֣ם בַּמְּדִינָ֔ה בְּרָעָ֥ה גְדֹלָ֖ה וּבְחֶרְפָּ֑ה וְחוֹמַ֤ת יְרוּשָׁלַ֙͏ִם֙ מְפֹרָ֔צֶת וּשְׁעָרֶ֖יהָ נִצְּת֥וּ בָאֵֽשׁ׃
Translated: They replied, “The survivors who have survived the captivity there in the province are in dire trouble and disgrace; Jerusalem’s wall is full of breaches, and its gates have been destroyed by fire.”
Transliteration: vayomeru liy hanisheariym asher-nishearu min-hasheviy sham vamediynah veraah gedolah uvecherefah vechvomat yerushala͏im meforatset usheareyha nitsetu vaesh

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֞י כְּשׇׁמְעִ֣י ׀ אֶת־הַדְּבָרִ֣ים הָאֵ֗לֶּה יָשַׁ֙בְתִּי֙ וָֽאֶבְכֶּ֔ה וָאֶתְאַבְּלָ֖ה יָמִ֑ים וָֽאֱהִ֥י צָם֙ וּמִתְפַּלֵּ֔ל לִפְנֵ֖י אֱלֹהֵ֥י הַשָּׁמָֽיִם׃
Translated: When I heard that, I sat and wept, and was in mourning for days, fasting and praying to the God of Heaven.
Transliteration: vayehiy kheshׇmeiy et-hadevariym haeleh yashavetiy vaevekheh vaeteavelah yamiym vaehiy tsam umitefalel lifeney elohey hashamayiim

Hebrew: וָאֹמַ֗ר אָֽנָּ֤א יְהֹוָה֙ אֱלֹהֵ֣י הַשָּׁמַ֔יִם הָאֵ֥ל הַגָּד֖וֹל וְהַנּוֹרָ֑א שֹׁמֵ֤ר הַבְּרִית֙ וָחֶ֔סֶד לְאֹהֲבָ֖יו וּלְשֹׁמְרֵ֥י מִצְוֺתָֽיו׃
Translated: I said, “O L<small>ORD</small>, God of Heaven, great and awesome God, who stays faithful to His covenant with those who love Him and keep His commandments!
Transliteration: vaomar ana yehovah elohey hashamayiim hael hagadvol vehanvora shomer haveriyt vachesed leohavayv uleshomerey mitsevotayv

Hebrew: תְּהִ֣י נָ֣א אׇזְנְךָֽ־קַשֶּׁ֣בֶת וְֽעֵינֶ֪יךָ פְתוּח֟וֹת לִשְׁמֹ֣עַ אֶל־תְּפִלַּ֣ת עַבְדְּךָ֡ אֲשֶׁ֣ר אָנֹכִי֩ מִתְפַּלֵּ֨ל לְפָנֶ֤יךָ הַיּוֹם֙ יוֹמָ֣ם וָלַ֔יְלָה עַל־בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל עֲבָדֶ֑יךָ וּמִתְוַדֶּ֗ה עַל־חַטֹּ֤אות בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר חָטָ֣אנוּ לָ֔ךְ וַאֲנִ֥י וּבֵית־אָבִ֖י חָטָֽאנוּ׃
Translated: Let Your ear be attentive and Your eyes open to receive the prayer of Your servant that I am praying to You now, day and night, on behalf of the Israelites, Your servants, confessing the sins that we Israelites have committed against You, sins that I and my father’s house have committed.
Transliteration: tehiy na ׇzenekha-kashevet veeyneykha fetuchvot lishemoa el-tefilat avedekha asher anokhiy mitefalel lefaneykha hayyvom yvomam valayelah al-veney yisherael avadeykha umitevadeh al-chatovt veney-yisherael asher chatanu lakhe vaaniy uveyt-aviy chatanu

Hebrew: חֲבֹ֖ל חָבַ֣לְנוּ לָ֑ךְ וְלֹא־שָׁמַ֣רְנוּ אֶת־הַמִּצְוֺ֗ת וְאֶת־הַֽחֻקִּים֙ וְאֶת־הַמִּשְׁפָּטִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר צִוִּ֖יתָ אֶת־מֹשֶׁ֥ה עַבְדֶּֽךָ׃
Translated: We have offended You by not keeping the commandments, the laws, and the rules that You gave to Your servant Moses.
Transliteration: chavol chavalenu lakhe velo-shamarenu et-hamitsevot veet-hachukiym veet-hamishefatiym asher tsiviyta et-mosheh avedekha

Hebrew: זְכׇר־נָא֙ אֶת־הַדָּבָ֔ר אֲשֶׁ֥ר צִוִּ֛יתָ אֶת־מֹשֶׁ֥ה עַבְדְּךָ֖ לֵאמֹ֑ר אַתֶּ֣ם תִּמְעָ֔לוּ אֲנִ֕י אָפִ֥יץ אֶתְכֶ֖ם בָּעַמִּֽים׃
Translated: Be mindful of the promise You gave to Your servant Moses: ‘If you are unfaithful, I will scatter you among the peoples;
Transliteration: zekhׇr-na et-hadavar asher tsiviyta et-mosheh avedekha lemor atem timealu aniy afiyts etekhem vaamiym

Hebrew: וְשַׁבְתֶּ֣ם אֵלַ֔י וּשְׁמַרְתֶּם֙ מִצְוֺתַ֔י וַעֲשִׂיתֶ֖ם אֹתָ֑ם אִם־יִהְיֶ֨ה נִֽדַּחֲכֶ֜ם בִּקְצֵ֤ה הַשָּׁמַ֙יִם֙ מִשָּׁ֣ם אֲקַבְּצֵ֔ם (והבואתים) [וַהֲבִֽיאוֹתִים֙] אֶל־הַמָּק֔וֹם אֲשֶׁ֣ר בָּחַ֔רְתִּי לְשַׁכֵּ֥ן אֶת־שְׁמִ֖י שָֽׁם׃
Translated: but if you turn back to Me, faithfully keep My commandments, even if your dispersed are at the ends of the earth, I will gather them from there and bring them to the place where I have chosen to establish My name.’
Transliteration: veshavetem elay ushemaretem mitsevotay vaashiytem otam im-yiheyeh nidachakhem viketseh hashamayiim misham akavetsem (vhvvtym) [vahaviyvotiym] el-hamakvom asher vacharetiy leshakhen et-shemiy sham

Hebrew: וְהֵ֥ם עֲבָדֶ֖יךָ וְעַמֶּ֑ךָ אֲשֶׁ֤ר פָּדִ֙יתָ֙ בְּכֹחֲךָ֣ הַגָּד֔וֹל וּבְיָדְךָ֖ הַחֲזָקָֽה׃
Translated: For they are Your servants and Your people whom You redeemed by Your great power and Your mighty hand.
Transliteration: vehem avadeykha veamekha asher fadiyta vekhochakha hagadvol uveyadekha hachazakah

Hebrew: אָנָּ֣א אֲדֹנָ֗י תְּהִ֣י נָ֣א אׇזְנְךָֽ־קַ֠שֶּׁ֠בֶת אֶל־תְּפִלַּ֨ת עַבְדְּךָ֜ וְאֶל־תְּפִלַּ֣ת עֲבָדֶ֗יךָ הַֽחֲפֵצִים֙ לְיִרְאָ֣ה אֶת־שְׁמֶ֔ךָ וְהַצְלִֽיחָה־נָּ֤א לְעַבְדְּךָ֙ הַיּ֔וֹם וּתְנֵ֣הוּ לְרַחֲמִ֔ים לִפְנֵ֖י הָאִ֣ישׁ הַזֶּ֑ה וַאֲנִ֛י הָיִ֥יתִי מַשְׁקֶ֖ה לַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃ {פ}
Translated:
O Lord! Let Your ear be attentive to the prayer of Your servant, and to the prayer of Your servants who desire to hold Your name in awe. Grant Your servant success today, and dispose that man to be compassionate toward him!”
I was the king’s cupbearer at the time.
Transliteration: ana adonay tehiy na ׇzenekha-kashevet el-tefilat avedekha veel-tefilat avadeykha hachafetsiym leyireah et-shemekha vehatseliychah-na leavedekha hayyvom utenehu lerachamiym lifeney haiysh hazeh vaaniy hayiytiy mashekeh lamelekhe {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֣י ׀ בְּחֹ֣דֶשׁ נִיסָ֗ן שְׁנַ֥ת עֶשְׂרִ֛ים לְאַרְתַּחְשַׁ֥סְתְּא הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ יַ֣יִן לְפָנָ֑יו וָאֶשָּׂ֤א אֶת־הַיַּ֙יִן֙ וָאֶתְּנָ֣ה לַמֶּ֔לֶךְ וְלֹא־הָיִ֥יתִי רַ֖ע לְפָנָֽיו׃
Translated: In the month of Nisan, in the twentieth year of King Artaxerxes, wine was set before him; I took the wine and gave it to the king—I had never been out of sorts in his presence.
Transliteration: vayehiy vechodesh niysan shenat esheriym learetacheshasete hamelekhe yayiin lefanayv vaesha et-hayayiin vaetenah lamelekhe velo-hayiytiy ra lefanayv

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֩אמֶר֩ לִ֨י הַמֶּ֜לֶךְ מַדּ֣וּעַ ׀ פָּנֶ֣יךָ רָעִ֗ים וְאַתָּה֙ אֵֽינְךָ֣ חוֹלֶ֔ה אֵ֣ין זֶ֔ה כִּי־אִ֖ם רֹ֣עַֽ לֵ֑ב וָאִירָ֖א הַרְבֵּ֥ה מְאֹֽד׃
Translated: The king said to me, “How is it that you look bad, though you are not ill? It must be bad thoughts.” I was very frightened,
Transliteration: vayomer liy hamelekhe madua faneykha raiym veatah eynekha chvoleh eyn zeh khiy-im roa lev vaiyra hareveh meod

Hebrew: וָאֹמַ֣ר לַמֶּ֔לֶךְ הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ לְעוֹלָ֣ם יִחְיֶ֑ה מַדּ֜וּעַ לֹא־יֵרְע֣וּ פָנַ֗י אֲשֶׁ֨ר הָעִ֜יר בֵּית־קִבְר֤וֹת אֲבֹתַי֙ חֲרֵבָ֔ה וּשְׁעָרֶ֖יהָ אֻכְּל֥וּ בָאֵֽשׁ׃
Translated: but I answered the king, “May the king live forever! How should I not look bad when the city of the graveyard of my ancestors lies in ruins, and its gates have been consumed by fire?”
Transliteration: vaomar lamelekhe hamelekhe levolam yicheyeh madua lo-eireu fanay asher haiyr veyt-kivervot avotay charevah usheareyha ukhelu vaesh

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר לִי֙ הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ עַל־מַה־זֶּ֖ה אַתָּ֣ה מְבַקֵּ֑שׁ וָֽאֶתְפַּלֵּ֔ל אֶל־אֱלֹהֵ֖י הַשָּׁמָֽיִם׃
Translated: The king said to me, “What is your request?” With a prayer to the God of Heaven,
Transliteration: vayomer liy hamelekhe al-mah-zeh atah mevakesh vaetefalel el-elohey hashamayiim

Hebrew: וָאֹמַ֣ר לַמֶּ֔לֶךְ אִם־עַל־הַמֶּ֣לֶךְ ט֔וֹב וְאִם־יִיטַ֥ב עַבְדְּךָ֖ לְפָנֶ֑יךָ אֲשֶׁ֧ר תִּשְׁלָחֵ֣נִי אֶל־יְהוּדָ֗ה אֶל־עִ֛יר קִבְר֥וֹת אֲבֹתַ֖י וְאֶבְנֶֽנָּה׃
Translated: I answered the king, “If it please the king, and if your servant has found favor with you, send me to Judah, to the city of my ancestors’ graves, to rebuild it.”
Transliteration: vaomar lamelekhe im-al-hamelekhe tvov veim-yiytav avedekha lefaneykha asher tishelacheniy el-yehudah el-iyr kivervot avotay veevenenah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֩אמֶר֩ לִ֨י הַמֶּ֜לֶךְ וְהַשֵּׁגַ֣ל ׀ יוֹשֶׁ֣בֶת אֶצְל֗וֹ עַד־מָתַ֛י יִהְיֶ֥ה מַֽהֲלָכְךָ֖ וּמָתַ֣י תָּשׁ֑וּב וַיִּיטַ֤ב לִפְנֵֽי־הַמֶּ֙לֶךְ֙ וַיִּשְׁלָחֵ֔נִי וָֽאֶתְּנָ֥ה ל֖וֹ זְמָֽן׃
Translated: With the consort seated at his side, the king said to me, “How long will you be gone and when will you return?” So it was agreeable to the king to send me, and I gave him a date.
Transliteration: vayomer liy hamelekhe vehashegal yvoshevet etselvo ad-matay yiheyeh mahalakhekha umatay tashuv vayiytav lifeney-hamelekhe vayishelacheniy vaetenah lvo zeman

Hebrew: וָאוֹמַר֮ לַמֶּ֒לֶךְ֒ אִם־עַל־הַמֶּ֣לֶךְ ט֔וֹב אִגְּרוֹת֙ יִתְּנוּ־לִ֔י עַֽל־פַּחֲו֖וֹת עֵ֣בֶר הַנָּהָ֑ר אֲשֶׁר֙ יַעֲבִיר֔וּנִי עַ֥ד אֲשֶׁר־אָב֖וֹא אֶל־יְהוּדָֽה׃
Translated: Then I said to the king, “If it please the king, let me have letters to the governors of the province of Beyond the River, directing them to grant me passage until I reach Judah;
Transliteration: vavomar lamelekhe im-al-hamelekhe tvov igervot yitenu-liy al-fachavvot ever hanahar asher yaaviyruniy ad asher-avvo el-yehudah

Hebrew: וְאִגֶּ֡רֶת אֶל־אָסָף֩ שֹׁמֵ֨ר הַפַּרְדֵּ֜ס אֲשֶׁ֣ר לַמֶּ֗לֶךְ אֲשֶׁ֣ר יִתֶּן־לִ֣י עֵצִ֡ים לְ֠קָר֠וֹת אֶת־שַׁעֲרֵ֨י הַבִּירָ֤ה אֲשֶׁר־לַבַּ֙יִת֙ וּלְחוֹמַ֣ת הָעִ֔יר וְלַבַּ֖יִת אֲשֶׁר־אָב֣וֹא אֵלָ֑יו וַיִּתֶּן־לִ֣י הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ כְּיַד־אֱלֹהַ֖י הַטּוֹבָ֥ה עָלָֽי׃
Translated: likewise, a letter to Asaph, the keeper of the King’s Park, directing him to give me timber for roofing the gatehouses of the temple fortress and the city walls and for the house I shall occupy.” The king gave me these, thanks to my God’s benevolent care for me.
Transliteration: veigeret el-asaf shomer hafaredes asher lamelekhe asher yiten-liy etsiym lekarvot et-shaarey haviyrah asher-lavayiit ulechvomat haiyr velavayiit asher-avvo elayv vayiten-liy hamelekhe kheyad-elohay hatvovah alay

Hebrew: וָֽאָב֗וֹא אֶֽל־פַּֽחֲווֹת֙ עֵ֣בֶר הַנָּהָ֔ר וָאֶתְּנָ֣ה לָהֶ֔ם אֵ֖ת אִגְּר֣וֹת הַמֶּ֑לֶךְ וַיִּשְׁלַ֤ח עִמִּי֙ הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ שָׂ֥רֵי חַ֖יִל וּפָרָשִֽׁים׃ {פ}
Translated: When I came to the governors of the province of Beyond the River I gave them the king’s letters. The king also sent army officers and cavalry with me.
Transliteration: vaavvo el-fachavvot ever hanahar vaetenah lahem et igervot hamelekhe vayishelach imiy hamelekhe sharey chayiil ufarashiym {f}

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁמַ֞ע סַנְבַלַּ֣ט הַחֹרֹנִ֗י וְטֽוֹבִיָּה֙ הָעֶ֣בֶד הָֽעַמֹּנִ֔י וַיֵּ֥רַע לָהֶ֖ם רָעָ֣ה גְדֹלָ֑ה אֲשֶׁר־בָּ֣א אָדָ֔ם לְבַקֵּ֥שׁ טוֹבָ֖ה לִבְנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: When Sanballat the Horonite and Tobiah the Ammonite servant heard, it displeased them greatly that someone had come, intent on improving the condition of the Israelites.
Transliteration: vayishema sanevalat hachoroniy vetvoviyah haeved haamoniy vayera lahem raah gedolah asher-va adam levakesh tvovah liveney yisherael

Hebrew: וָאָב֖וֹא אֶל־יְרוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם וָאֱהִי־שָׁ֖ם יָמִ֥ים שְׁלֹשָֽׁה׃
Translated: I arrived in Jerusalem. After I was there three days
Transliteration: vaavvo el-yerushala͏im vaehiy-sham yamiym sheloshah

Hebrew: וָאָק֣וּם ׀ לַ֗יְלָה אֲנִי֮ וַאֲנָשִׁ֣ים ׀ מְעַט֮ עִמִּי֒ וְלֹא־הִגַּ֣דְתִּי לְאָדָ֔ם מָ֗ה אֱלֹהַי֙ נֹתֵ֣ן אֶל־לִבִּ֔י לַעֲשׂ֖וֹת לִירוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם וּבְהֵמָה֙ אֵ֣ין עִמִּ֔י כִּ֚י אִם־הַבְּהֵמָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר אֲנִ֖י רֹכֵ֥ב בָּֽהּ׃
Translated: I got up at night, I and a few men with me, and telling no one what my God had put into my mind to do for Jerusalem, and taking no other beast than the one on which I was riding,
Transliteration: vaakum layelah aniy vaanashiym meat imiy velo-higadetiy leadam mah elohay noten el-liviy laashvot liyrushala͏im uvehemah eyn imiy khiy im-havehemah asher aniy rokhev vah

Hebrew: וָאֵצְאָ֨ה בְשַֽׁעַר־הַגַּ֜יְא לַ֗יְלָה וְאֶל־פְּנֵי֙ עֵ֣ין הַתַּנִּ֔ין וְאֶל־שַׁ֖עַר הָאַשְׁפֹּ֑ת וָאֱהִ֨י שֹׂבֵ֜ר בְּחוֹמֹ֤ת יְרוּשָׁלַ֙͏ִם֙ אֲשֶׁר־[הֵ֣ם ׀ פְּרוּצִ֔ים] (המפרוצים) וּשְׁעָרֶ֖יהָ אֻכְּל֥וּ בָאֵֽשׁ׃
Translated: I went out by the Valley Gate, at night, toward the Jackals’ Spring and the Dung Gate; and I surveyed the walls of Jerusalem that were breached, and its gates, consumed by fire.
Transliteration: vaetseah veshaar-hagaye layelah veel-feney eyn hataniyn veel-shaar haashefot vaehiy shover vechvomot yerushala͏im asher-[hem ferutsiym] (hmfrvtsym) usheareyha ukhelu vaesh

Hebrew: וָאֶֽעֱבֹר֙ אֶל־שַׁ֣עַר הָעַ֔יִן וְאֶל־בְּרֵכַ֖ת הַמֶּ֑לֶךְ וְאֵין־מָק֥וֹם לַבְּהֵמָ֖ה לַעֲבֹ֥ר תַּחְתָּֽי׃
Translated: I proceeded to the Fountain Gate and to the King’s Pool, where there was no room for the beast under me to continue.
Transliteration: vaeevor el-shaar haayiin veel-verekhat hamelekhe veeyn-makvom lavehemah laavor tachetay

Hebrew: וָאֱהִ֨י עֹלֶ֤ה בַנַּ֙חַל֙ לַ֔יְלָה וָאֱהִ֥י שֹׂבֵ֖ר בַּחוֹמָ֑ה וָאָשׁ֗וּב וָאָב֛וֹא בְּשַׁ֥עַר הַגַּ֖יְא וָאָשֽׁוּב׃
Translated: So I went up the wadi by night, surveying the wall, and, entering again by the Valley Gate, I returned.
Transliteration: vaehiy oleh vanachal layelah vaehiy shover vachvomah vaashuv vaavvo veshaar hagaye vaashuv

Hebrew: וְהַסְּגָנִ֗ים לֹ֤א יָדְעוּ֙ אָ֣נָה הָלַ֔כְתִּי וּמָ֖ה אֲנִ֣י עֹשֶׂ֑ה וְלַיְּהוּדִ֨ים וְלַכֹּהֲנִ֜ים וְלַחֹרִ֣ים וְלַסְּגָנִ֗ים וּלְיֶ֙תֶר֙ עֹשֵׂ֣ה הַמְּלָאכָ֔ה עַד־כֵּ֖ן לֹ֥א הִגַּֽדְתִּי׃
Translated: The prefects knew nothing of where I had gone or what I had done, since I had not yet divulged it to the Jews—the priests, the nobles, the prefects, or the rest of the officials.
Transliteration: vehaseganiym lo yadeu anah halakhetiy umah aniy osheh velayehudiym velakhohaniym velachoriym velaseganiym uleyeter osheh hamelakhah ad-khen lo higadetiy

Hebrew: וָאוֹמַ֣ר אֲלֵהֶ֗ם אַתֶּ֤ם רֹאִים֙ הָרָעָה֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר אֲנַ֣חְנוּ בָ֔הּ אֲשֶׁ֤ר יְרוּשָׁלַ֙͏ִם֙ חֲרֵבָ֔ה וּשְׁעָרֶ֖יהָ נִצְּת֣וּ בָאֵ֑שׁ לְכ֗וּ וְנִבְנֶה֙ אֶת־חוֹמַ֣ת יְרוּשָׁלַ֔͏ִם וְלֹא־נִהְיֶ֥ה ע֖וֹד חֶרְפָּֽה׃
Translated: Then I said to them, “You see the bad state we are in—Jerusalem lying in ruins and its gates destroyed by fire. Come, let us rebuild the wall of Jerusalem and suffer no more disgrace.”
Transliteration: vavomar alehem atem roiym haraah asher anachenu vah asher yerushala͏im charevah usheareyha nitsetu vaesh lekhu veniveneh et-chvomat yerushala͏im velo-niheyeh vod cherefah

Hebrew: וָאַגִּ֨יד לָהֶ֜ם אֶת־יַ֣ד אֱלֹהַ֗י אֲשֶׁר־הִיא֙ טוֹבָ֣ה עָלַ֔י וְאַף־דִּבְרֵ֥י הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ אֲשֶׁ֣ר אָֽמַר־לִ֑י וַיֹּֽאמְרוּ֙ נָק֣וּם וּבָנִ֔ינוּ וַיְחַזְּק֥וּ יְדֵיהֶ֖ם לַטּוֹבָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: I told them of my God’s benevolent care for me, also of the things that the king had said to me, and they said, “Let us start building!” They were encouraged by [His] benevolence.
Transliteration: vaagiyd lahem et-yad elohay asher-hiy tvovah alay veaf-diverey hamelekhe asher amar-liy vayomeru nakum uvaniynu vayechazeku yedeyhem latvovah {f}

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁמַע֩ סַנְבַלַּ֨ט הַחֹרֹנִ֜י וְטֹבִיָּ֣ה ׀ הָעֶ֣בֶד הָֽעַמּוֹנִ֗י וְגֶ֙שֶׁם֙ הָֽעַרְבִ֔י וַיַּלְעִ֣גוּ לָ֔נוּ וַיִּבְז֖וּ עָלֵ֑ינוּ וַיֹּאמְר֗וּ מָֽה־הַדָּבָ֤ר הַזֶּה֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר אַתֶּ֣ם עֹשִׂ֔ים הַעַ֥ל הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ אַתֶּ֥ם מֹרְדִֽים׃
Translated: When Sanballat the Horonite and Tobiah the Ammonite servant and Geshem the Arab heard, they mocked us and held us in contempt and said, “What is this that you are doing? Are you rebelling against the king?”
Transliteration: vayishema sanevalat hachoroniy vetoviyah haeved haamvoniy vegeshem haareviy vayaleigu lanu vayivezu aleynu vayomeru mah-hadavar hazeh asher atem oshiym haal hamelekhe atem morediym

Hebrew: וָאָשִׁ֨יב אוֹתָ֜ם דָּבָ֗ר וָאוֹמַ֤ר לָהֶם֙ אֱלֹהֵ֣י הַשָּׁמַ֗יִם ה֚וּא יַצְלִ֣יחַֽ לָ֔נוּ וַאֲנַ֥חְנוּ עֲבָדָ֖יו נָק֣וּם וּבָנִ֑ינוּ וְלָכֶ֗ם אֵֽין־חֵ֧לֶק וּצְדָקָ֛ה וְזִכָּר֖וֹן בִּירוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃ {פ}
Translated: I said to them in reply, “The God of Heaven will grant us success, and we, His servants, will start building. But you have no share or claim or stake in Jerusalem!”
Transliteration: vaashiyv votam davar vavomar lahem elohey hashamayiim hu yatseliycha lanu vaanachenu avadayv nakum uvaniynu velakhem eyn-chelek utsedakah vezikharvon viyrushala͏im {f}

Hebrew: וַיָּ֡קׇם אֶלְיָשִׁיב֩ הַכֹּהֵ֨ן הַגָּד֜וֹל וְאֶחָ֣יו הַכֹּהֲנִ֗ים וַיִּבְנוּ֙ אֶת־שַׁ֣עַר הַצֹּ֔אן הֵ֣מָּה קִדְּשׁ֔וּהוּ וַֽיַּעֲמִ֖ידוּ דַּלְתֹתָ֑יו וְעַד־מִגְדַּ֤ל הַמֵּאָה֙ קִדְּשׁ֔וּהוּ עַ֖ד מִגְדַּ֥ל חֲנַנְאֵֽל׃ {ס}
Translated: Then Eliashib the high priest and his fellow priests set to and rebuilt the Sheep Gate; they consecrated it and set up its doors, consecrating it as far as the Hundred’s Tower, as far as the Tower of Hananel.
Transliteration: vayakׇm eleyashiyv hakhohen hagadvol veechayv hakhohaniym vayivenu et-shaar hatson hemah kideshuhu vayaamiydu daletotayv vead-migedal hameah kideshuhu ad migedal chananeel {s}

Hebrew: וְעַל־יָד֥וֹ בָנ֖וּ אַנְשֵׁ֣י יְרֵח֑וֹ וְעַל־יָד֣וֹ בָנָ֔ה זַכּ֖וּר בֶּן־אִמְרִֽי׃ {ס}
Translated: Next to him, the men of Jericho built. Next to them, Zaccur son of Imri.
Transliteration: veal-yadvo vanu aneshey yerechvo veal-yadvo vanah zakhur ven-imeriy {s}

Hebrew: וְאֵת֙ שַׁ֣עַר הַדָּגִ֔ים בָּנ֖וּ בְּנֵ֣י הַסְּנָאָ֑ה הֵ֣מָּה קֵר֔וּהוּ וַֽיַּעֲמִ֙ידוּ֙ דַּלְתֹתָ֔יו מַנְעוּלָ֖יו וּבְרִיחָֽיו׃ {ס}
Translated: The sons of Hassenaah rebuilt the Fish Gate; they roofed it and set up its doors, locks, and bars.
Transliteration: veet shaar hadagiym vanu veney hasenaah hemah keruhu vayaamiydu daletotayv maneulayv uveriychayv {s}

Hebrew: וְעַל־יָדָ֣ם הֶחֱזִ֗יק מְרֵמ֤וֹת בֶּן־אוּרִיָּה֙ בֶּן־הַקּ֔וֹץ {ס} וְעַל־יָדָ֣ם הֶחֱזִ֔יק מְשֻׁלָּ֥ם בֶּן־בֶּרֶכְיָ֖ה בֶּן־מְשֵׁיזַבְאֵ֑ל {ס} וְעַל־יָדָ֣ם הֶֽחֱזִ֔יק צָד֖וֹק בֶּֽן־בַּעֲנָֽא׃ {ס}
Translated: Next to them, Meremoth son of Uriah son of Hakkoz repaired; and next to him, Meshullam son of Berechiah son of Meshezabel. Next to him, Zadok son of Baana repaired.
Transliteration: veal-yadam hecheziyk meremvot ven-uriyah ven-hakvots {s} veal-yadam hecheziyk meshulam ven-verekheyah ven-mesheyzaveel {s} veal-yadam hecheziyk tsadvok ven-vaana {s}

Hebrew: וְעַל־יָדָ֖ם הֶחֱזִ֣יקוּ הַתְּקוֹעִ֑ים וְאַדִּֽירֵיהֶם֙ לֹא־הֵבִ֣יאוּ צַוָּרָ֔ם בַּעֲבֹדַ֖ת אֲדֹנֵיהֶֽם׃ {ס}
Translated: Next to him, the Tekoites repaired, though their nobles would not take upon their shoulders the work of their lord.
Transliteration: veal-yadam hecheziyku hatekvoiym veadiyreyhem lo-heviyu tsavaram vaavodat adoneyhem {s}

Hebrew: וְאֵת֩ שַׁ֨עַר הַיְשָׁנָ֜ה הֶחֱזִ֗יקוּ יֽוֹיָדָע֙ בֶּן־פָּסֵ֔חַ וּמְשֻׁלָּ֖ם בֶּן־בְּסֽוֹדְיָ֑ה הֵ֣מָּה קֵר֔וּהוּ וַֽיַּעֲמִ֙ידוּ֙ דַּלְתֹתָ֔יו וּמַנְעֻלָ֖יו וּבְרִיחָֽיו׃ {ס}
Translated: Joiada son of Paseah and Meshullam son of Besodeiah repaired the Jeshanah Gate; they roofed it and set up its doors, locks, and bars.
Transliteration: veet shaar hayeshanah hecheziyku yvoyada ven-fasecha umeshulam ven-vesvodeyah hemah keruhu vayaamiydu daletotayv umaneulayv uveriychayv {s}

Hebrew: וְעַל־יָדָ֨ם הֶחֱזִ֜יק מְלַטְיָ֣ה הַגִּבְעֹנִ֗י וְיָדוֹן֙ הַמֵּרֹ֣נֹתִ֔י אַנְשֵׁ֥י גִבְע֖וֹן וְהַמִּצְפָּ֑ה לְכִסֵּ֕א פַּחַ֖ת עֵ֥בֶר הַנָּהָֽר׃ {ס}
Translated: Next to them, Melatiah the Gibeonite and Jadon the Meronothite repaired, [with] the men of Gibeon and Mizpah, under the jurisdiction of the governor of the province of Beyond the River.
Transliteration: veal-yadam hecheziyk melateyah hagiveoniy veyadvon hameronotiy aneshey givevon vehamitsefah lekhise fachat ever hanahar {s}

Hebrew: עַל־יָד֣וֹ הֶחֱזִ֗יק עֻזִּיאֵ֤ל בֶּֽן־חַרְהֲיָה֙ צֽוֹרְפִ֔ים {ס} וְעַל־יָד֣וֹ הֶחֱזִ֔יק חֲנַנְיָ֖ה בֶּן־הָרַקָּחִ֑ים וַיַּֽעַזְבוּ֙ יְר֣וּשָׁלַ֔͏ִם עַ֖ד הַחוֹמָ֥ה הָרְחָבָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: Next to them, Uzziel son of Harhaiah, [of the] smiths, repaired. Next to him, Hananiah, of the perfumers. They restored Jerusalem as far as the Broad Wall.
Transliteration: al-yadvo hecheziyk uziyel ven-charehayah tsvorefiym {s} veal-yadvo hecheziyk chananeyah ven-harakachiym vayaazevu yerushala͏im ad hachvomah harechavah {s}

Hebrew: וְעַל־יָדָ֤ם הֶחֱזִיק֙ רְפָיָ֣ה בֶן־ח֔וּר שַׂ֕ר חֲצִ֖י פֶּ֥לֶךְ יְרוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃ {ס}
Translated: Next to them, Rephaiah son of Hur, chief of half the district of Jerusalem, repaired.
Transliteration: veal-yadam hecheziyk refayah ven-chur shar chatsiy felekhe yerushala͏im {s}

Hebrew: וְעַל־יָדָ֧ם הֶחֱזִ֛יק יְדָיָ֥ה בֶן־חֲרוּמַ֖ף וְנֶ֣גֶד בֵּית֑וֹ וְעַל־יָד֣וֹ הֶחֱזִ֔יק חַטּ֖וּשׁ בֶּן־חֲשַׁבְנְיָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: Next to him, Jedaiah son of Harumaph repaired in front of his house. Next to him, Hattush son of Hashabneiah repaired.
Transliteration: veal-yadam hecheziyk yedayah ven-charumaf veneged veytvo veal-yadvo hecheziyk chatush ven-chashaveneyah {s}

Hebrew: מִדָּ֣ה שֵׁנִ֗ית הֶחֱזִיק֙ מַלְכִּיָּ֣ה בֶן־חָרִ֔ם וְחַשּׁ֖וּב בֶּן־פַּחַ֣ת מוֹאָ֑ב וְאֵ֖ת מִגְדַּ֥ל הַתַּנּוּרִֽים׃ {ס}
Translated: Malchijah son of Harim and Hasshub son of Pahath-moab repaired a second stretch, including the Tower of Ovens.
Transliteration: midah sheniyt hecheziyk malekhiyah ven-charim vechashuv ven-fachat mvoav veet migedal hatanuriym {s}

Hebrew: וְעַל־יָד֣וֹ הֶחֱזִ֗יק שַׁלּוּם֙ בֶּן־הַלּוֹחֵ֔שׁ שַׂ֕ר חֲצִ֖י פֶּ֣לֶךְ יְרוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם ה֖וּא וּבְנוֹתָֽיו׃ {ס}
Translated: Next to them, Shallum son of Hallohesh, chief of half the district of Jerusalem, repaired—he and his daughters.
Transliteration: veal-yadvo hecheziyk shalum ven-halvochesh shar chatsiy felekhe yerushala͏im hu uvenvotayv {s}

Hebrew: אֵת֩ שַׁ֨עַר הַגַּ֜יְא הֶחֱזִ֣יק חָנוּן֮ וְיֹשְׁבֵ֣י זָנ֒וֹחַ֒ הֵ֣מָּה בָנ֔וּהוּ וַֽיַּעֲמִ֙ידוּ֙ דַּלְתֹתָ֔יו מַנְעֻלָ֖יו וּבְרִיחָ֑יו וְאֶ֤לֶף אַמָּה֙ בַּחוֹמָ֔ה עַ֖ד שַׁ֥עַר הָשְׁפֽוֹת׃
Translated: Hanun and the inhabitants of Zanoah repaired the Valley Gate; they rebuilt it and set up its doors, locks, and bars. And [they also repaired] a thousand cubits of wall to the Dung Gate.
Transliteration: et shaar hagaye hecheziyk chanun veyoshevey zanvocha hemah vanuhu vayaamiydu daletotayv maneulayv uveriychayv veelef amah vachvomah ad shaar hashefvot

Hebrew: וְאֵ֣ת ׀ שַׁ֣עַר הָאַשְׁפּ֗וֹת הֶחֱזִיק֙ מַלְכִּיָּ֣ה בֶן־רֵכָ֔ב שַׂ֖ר פֶּ֣לֶךְ בֵּית־הַכָּ֑רֶם ה֣וּא יִבְנֶ֔נּוּ וְיַעֲמִיד֙ דַּלְתֹתָ֔יו מַנְעֻלָ֖יו וּבְרִיחָֽיו׃ {ס}
Translated: Malchijah son of Rechab, chief of the district of Beth-haccerem, repaired the Dung Gate; he rebuilt it and set up its doors, locks, and bars.
Transliteration: veet shaar haashefvot hecheziyk malekhiyah ven-rekhav shar felekhe veyt-hakharem hu yivenenu veyaamiyd daletotayv maneulayv uveriychayv {s}

Hebrew: וְאֵת֩ שַׁ֨עַר הָעַ֜יִן הֶ֠חֱזִ֠יק שַׁלּ֣וּן בֶּן־כׇּל־חֹזֶה֮ שַׂ֣ר פֶּ֣לֶךְ הַמִּצְפָּה֒ ה֤וּא יִבְנֶ֙נּוּ֙ וִיטַֽלְלֶ֔נּוּ (ויעמידו) [וְיַעֲמִיד֙] דַּלְתֹתָ֔יו מַנְעֻלָ֖יו וּבְרִיחָ֑יו וְ֠אֵ֠ת חוֹמַ֞ת בְּרֵכַ֤ת הַשֶּׁ֙לַח֙ לְגַן־הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ וְעַד־הַֽמַּעֲל֔וֹת הַיּוֹרְד֖וֹת מֵעִ֥יר דָּוִֽיד׃ {ס}
Translated: Shallun son of Col-hozeh, chief of the district of Mizpah, repaired the Fountain Gate; he rebuilt it and covered it, and set up its doors, locks, and bars, as well as the wall of the irrigation pool of the King’s Garden as far as the steps going down from the City of David.
Transliteration: veet shaar haayiin hecheziyk shalun ven-khׇl-chozeh shar felekhe hamitsefah hu yivenenu viytalelenu (vymydv) [veyaamiyd] daletotayv maneulayv uveriychayv veet chvomat verekhat hashelach legan-hamelekhe vead-hamaalvot hayyvoredvot meiyr daviyd {s}

Hebrew: אַחֲרָ֤יו הֶחֱזִיק֙ נְחֶמְיָ֣ה בֶן־עַזְבּ֔וּק שַׂ֕ר חֲצִ֖י פֶּ֣לֶךְ בֵּֽית־צ֑וּר עַד־נֶ֙גֶד֙ קִבְרֵ֣י דָוִ֔יד וְעַד־הַבְּרֵכָה֙ הָעֲשׂוּיָ֔ה וְעַ֖ד בֵּ֥ית הַגִּבֹּרִֽים׃ {ס}
Translated: After him, Nehemiah son of Azbuk, chief of half the district of Beth-zur, repaired, from in front of the graves of David as far as the artificial pool, and as far as the House of the Warriors.
Transliteration: acharayv hecheziyk nechemeyah ven-azevuk shar chatsiy felekhe veyt-tsur ad-neged kiverey daviyd vead-haverekhah haashuyah vead veyt hagivoriym {s}

Hebrew: אַחֲרָ֛יו הֶחֱזִ֥יקוּ הַלְוִיִּ֖ם רְח֣וּם בֶּן־בָּנִ֑י {ס} עַל־יָד֣וֹ הֶחֱזִ֗יק חֲשַׁבְיָ֛ה שַׂר־חֲצִי־פֶ֥לֶךְ קְעִילָ֖ה לְפִלְכּֽוֹ׃ {ס}
Translated: After him, the Levites repaired: Rehum son of Bani. Next to him, Hashabiah, chief of half the district of Keilah, repaired for his district.
Transliteration: acharayv hecheziyku haleviyim rechum ven-vaniy {s} al-yadvo hecheziyk chashaveyah shar-chatsiy-felekhe keiylah lefilekhvo {s}

Hebrew: אַחֲרָיו֙ הֶחֱזִ֣יקוּ אֲחֵיהֶ֔ם בַּוַּ֖י בֶּן־חֵנָדָ֑ד שַׂ֕ר חֲצִ֖י פֶּ֥לֶךְ קְעִילָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: After him, their brothers repaired: Bavvai son of Henadad, chief of half the district of Keilah.
Transliteration: acharayv hecheziyku acheyhem vavay ven-chenadad shar chatsiy felekhe keiylah {s}

Hebrew: וַיְחַזֵּ֨ק עַל־יָד֜וֹ עֵ֧זֶר בֶּן־יֵשׁ֛וּעַ שַׂ֥ר הַמִּצְפָּ֖ה מִדָּ֣ה שֵׁנִ֑ית מִנֶּ֕גֶד עֲלֹ֥ת הַנֶּ֖שֶׁק הַמִּקְצֹֽעַ׃ {ס}
Translated: Next to him, Ezer son of Jeshua, the chief of Mizpah, repaired a second stretch, from in front of the ascent to the armory [at] the angle [of the wall].
Transliteration: vayechazek al-yadvo ezer ven-eishua shar hamitsefah midah sheniyt mineged alot haneshek hamiketsoa {s}

Hebrew: אַחֲרָ֨יו הֶחֱרָ֧ה הֶחֱזִ֛יק בָּר֥וּךְ בֶּן־[זַכַּ֖י] (זבי) מִדָּ֣ה שֵׁנִ֑ית מִ֨ן־הַמִּקְצ֔וֹעַ עַד־פֶּ֙תַח֙ בֵּ֣ית אֶלְיָשִׁ֔יב הַכֹּהֵ֖ן הַגָּדֽוֹל׃ {ס}
Translated: After him, Baruch son of Zaccai zealously repaired a second stretch, from the angle to the entrance to the house of Eliashib, the high priest.
Transliteration: acharayv hecherah hecheziyk varukhe ven-[zakhay] (zvy) midah sheniyt min-hamiketsvoa ad-fetach veyt eleyashiyv hakhohen hagadvol {s}

Hebrew: אַחֲרָ֣יו הֶחֱזִ֗יק מְרֵמ֧וֹת בֶּן־אוּרִיָּ֛ה בֶּן־הַקּ֖וֹץ מִדָּ֣ה שֵׁנִ֑ית מִפֶּ֙תַח֙ בֵּ֣ית אֶלְיָשִׁ֔יב וְעַד־תַּכְלִ֖ית בֵּ֥ית אֶלְיָשִֽׁיב׃ {ס}
Translated: After him, Meremoth son of Uriah son of Hakkoz repaired a second stretch, from the entrance to Eliashib’s house to the end of Eliashib’s house.
Transliteration: acharayv hecheziyk meremvot ven-uriyah ven-hakvots midah sheniyt mifetach veyt eleyashiyv vead-takheliyt veyt eleyashiyv {s}

Hebrew: וְאַחֲרָ֛יו הֶחֱזִ֥יקוּ הַכֹּהֲנִ֖ים אַנְשֵׁ֥י הַכִּכָּֽר׃
Translated: After him, the priests, inhabitants of the plain, repaired.
Transliteration: veacharayv hecheziyku hakhohaniym aneshey hakhikhar

Hebrew: אַחֲרָ֨יו הֶחֱזִ֧יק בִּנְיָמִ֛ן וְחַשּׁ֖וּב נֶ֣גֶד בֵּיתָ֑ם {ס} אַחֲרָ֣יו הֶחֱזִ֗יק עֲזַרְיָ֧ה בֶן־מַעֲשֵׂיָ֛ה בֶּן־עֲנָֽנְיָ֖ה אֵ֥צֶל בֵּיתֽוֹ׃ {ס}
Translated: After them, Benjamin and Hasshub repaired in front of their houses. After them, Azariah son of Maaseiah son of Ananiah repaired beside his house.
Transliteration: acharayv hecheziyk vineyamin vechashuv neged veytam {s} acharayv hecheziyk azareyah ven-maasheyah ven-ananeyah etsel veytvo {s}

Hebrew: אַחֲרָ֣יו הֶחֱזִ֗יק בִּנּ֛וּי בֶּן־חֵנָדָ֖ד מִדָּ֣ה שֵׁנִ֑ית מִבֵּ֣ית עֲזַרְיָ֔ה עַד־הַמִּקְצ֖וֹעַ וְעַד־הַפִּנָּֽה׃
Translated: After him, Binnui son of Henadad repaired a second stretch, from the house of Azariah to the angle, to the corner.
Transliteration: acharayv hecheziyk vinuy ven-chenadad midah sheniyt miveyt azareyah ad-hamiketsvoa vead-hafinah

Hebrew: פָּלָ֣ל בֶּן־אוּזַי֮ מִנֶּ֣גֶד הַמִּקְצ֒וֹעַ֒ וְהַמִּגְדָּ֗ל הַיּוֹצֵא֙ מִבֵּ֤ית הַמֶּ֙לֶךְ֙ הָֽעֶלְי֔וֹן אֲשֶׁ֖ר לַחֲצַ֣ר הַמַּטָּרָ֑ה אַחֲרָ֖יו פְּדָיָ֥ה בֶן־פַּרְעֹֽשׁ׃ {ס}
Translated: Palal son of Uzai—from in front of the angle and the tower that juts out of the house of the king, the upper [tower] of the prison compound. After him, Pedaiah son of Parosh. (
Transliteration: falal ven-uzay mineged hamiketsvoa vehamigedal hayyvotse miveyt hamelekhe haeleyvon asher lachatsar hamatarah acharayv fedayah ven-fareosh {s}

Hebrew: וְהַ֨נְּתִינִ֔ים הָי֥וּ יֹשְׁבִ֖ים בָּעֹ֑פֶל עַ֠ד נֶ֜גֶד שַׁ֤עַר הַמַּ֙יִם֙ לַמִּזְרָ֔ח וְהַמִּגְדָּ֖ל הַיּוֹצֵֽא׃ {ס}
Translated: The temple servants were living on the Ophel, as far as a point in front of the Water Gate in the east, and the jutting tower.)
Transliteration: vehanetiyniym hayu yosheviym vaofel ad neged shaar hamayiim lamizerach vehamigedal hayyvotse {s}

Hebrew: אַחֲרָ֛יו הֶחֱזִ֥יקוּ הַתְּקֹעִ֖ים מִדָּ֣ה שֵׁנִ֑ית מִנֶּ֜גֶד הַמִּגְדָּ֤ל הַגָּדוֹל֙ הַיּוֹצֵ֔א וְעַ֖ד חוֹמַ֥ת הָעֹֽפֶל׃
Translated: After him, the Tekoites repaired a second stretch, from in front of the great jutting tower to the wall of the Ophel.
Transliteration: acharayv hecheziyku hatekoiym midah sheniyt mineged hamigedal hagadvol hayyvotse vead chvomat haofel

Hebrew: מֵעַ֣ל ׀ שַׁ֣עַר הַסּוּסִ֗ים הֶחֱזִ֙יקוּ֙ הַכֹּ֣הֲנִ֔ים אִ֖ישׁ לְנֶ֥גֶד בֵּיתֽוֹ׃ {ס}
Translated: Above the Horse Gate, the priests repaired, each in front of his house.
Transliteration: meal shaar hasusiym hecheziyku hakhohaniym iysh leneged veytvo {s}

Hebrew: אַחֲרָ֧יו הֶחֱזִ֛יק צָד֥וֹק בֶּן־אִמֵּ֖ר נֶ֣גֶד בֵּית֑וֹ {ס} וְאַחֲרָ֤יו הֶחֱזִיק֙ שְׁמַֽעְיָ֣ה בֶן־שְׁכַנְיָ֔ה שֹׁמֵ֖ר שַׁ֥עַר הַמִּזְרָֽח׃ {ס}
Translated: After them, Zadok son of Immer repaired in front of his house. After him, Shemaiah son of Shechaniah, keeper of the East Gate, repaired.
Transliteration: acharayv hecheziyk tsadvok ven-imer neged veytvo {s} veacharayv hecheziyk shemaeyah ven-shekhaneyah shomer shaar hamizerach {s}

Hebrew: (אחרי) [אַחֲרָ֨יו] הֶחֱזִ֜יק חֲנַנְיָ֣ה בֶן־שֶׁלֶמְיָ֗ה וְחָנ֧וּן בֶּן־צָלָ֛ף הַשִּׁשִּׁ֖י מִדָּ֣ה שֵׁנִ֑י {ס} אַחֲרָ֣יו הֶחֱזִ֗יק מְשֻׁלָּם֙ בֶּן־בֶּ֣רֶכְיָ֔ה נֶ֖גֶד נִשְׁכָּתֽוֹ׃ {ס}
Translated: After him, Hananiah son of Shelemiah and Hanun, the sixth son of Zalaph, repaired a second stretch. After them, Meshullam son of Berechiah repaired in front of his chamber.
Transliteration: (chry) [acharayv] hecheziyk chananeyah ven-shelemeyah vechanun ven-tsalaf hashishiy midah sheniy {s} acharayv hecheziyk meshulam ven-verekheyah neged nishekhatvo {s}

Hebrew: (אחרי) [אַחֲרָ֣יו] הֶחֱזִ֗יק מַלְכִּיָּה֙ בֶּן־הַצֹּ֣רְפִ֔י עַד־בֵּ֥ית הַנְּתִינִ֖ים וְהָרֹכְלִ֑ים נֶ֚גֶד שַׁ֣עַר הַמִּפְקָ֔ד וְעַ֖ד עֲלִיַּ֥ת הַפִּנָּֽה׃
Translated: After him, Malchijah of the smiths repaired as far as the house of the temple servants and the merchants, [from] in front of the Muster Gate to the corner loft.
Transliteration: (chry) [acharayv] hecheziyk malekhiyah ven-hatsorefiy ad-veyt hanetiyniym veharokheliym neged shaar hamifekad vead aliyat hafinah

Hebrew: וּבֵ֨ין עֲלִיַּ֤ת הַפִּנָּה֙ לְשַׁ֣עַר הַצֹּ֔אן הֶחֱזִ֥יקוּ הַצֹּרְפִ֖ים וְהָרֹכְלִֽים׃ {פ}
Translated: And between the corner loft to the Sheep Gate the smiths and the merchants repaired.
Transliteration: uveyn aliyat hafinah leshaar hatson hecheziyku hatsorefiym veharokheliym {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֞י כַּאֲשֶׁ֧ר שָׁמַ֣ע סַנְבַלַּ֗ט כִּֽי־אֲנַ֤חְנוּ בוֹנִים֙ אֶת־הַ֣חוֹמָ֔ה וַיִּ֣חַר ל֔וֹ וַיִּכְעַ֖ס הַרְבֵּ֑ה וַיַּלְעֵ֖ג עַל־הַיְּהוּדִֽים׃
Translated: When Sanballat heard that we were rebuilding the wall, it angered him, and he was extremely vexed. He mocked the Jews,
Transliteration: vayehiy khaasher shama sanevalat khiy-anachenu vvoniym et-hachvomah vayichar lvo vayikheas hareveh vayaleeg al-hayehudiym

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר ׀ לִפְנֵ֣י אֶחָ֗יו וְחֵיל֙ שֹֽׁמְר֔וֹן וַיֹּ֕אמֶר מָ֛ה הַיְּהוּדִ֥ים הָאֲמֵלָלִ֖ים עֹשִׂ֑ים הֲיַעַזְב֨וּ לָהֶ֤ם הֲיִזְבָּ֙חוּ֙ הַיְכַלּ֣וּ בַיּ֔וֹם הַיְחַיּ֧וּ אֶת־הָאֲבָנִ֛ים מֵעֲרֵמ֥וֹת הֶעָפָ֖ר וְהֵ֥מָּה שְׂרוּפֽוֹת׃
Translated: saying in the presence of his brothers and the Samarian force, “What are the miserable Jews doing? Will they restore, offer sacrifice, and finish one day? Can they revive those stones out of the dust heaps, burned as they are?”
Transliteration: vayomer lifeney echayv vecheyl shomervon vayomer mah hayehudiym haamelaliym oshiym hayaazevu lahem hayizevachu hayekhalu vayyvom hayechayyu et-haavaniym mearemvot heafar vehemah sherufvot

Hebrew: וְטוֹבִיָּ֥ה הָעַמֹּנִ֖י אֶצְל֑וֹ וַיֹּ֗אמֶר גַּ֚ם אֲשֶׁר־הֵ֣ם בּוֹנִ֔ים אִם־יַעֲלֶ֣ה שׁוּעָ֔ל וּפָרַ֖ץ חוֹמַ֥ת אַבְנֵיהֶֽם׃ {פ}
Translated: Tobiah the Ammonite, alongside him, said, “That stone wall they are building—if a fox climbed it he would breach it!”
Transliteration: vetvoviyah haamoniy etselvo vayomer gam asher-hem vvoniym im-yaaleh shual ufarats chvomat aveneyhem {f}

Hebrew: שְׁמַ֤ע אֱלֹהֵ֙ינוּ֙ כִּֽי־הָיִ֣ינוּ בוּזָ֔ה וְהָשֵׁ֥ב חֶרְפָּתָ֖ם אֶל־רֹאשָׁ֑ם וּתְנֵ֥ם לְבִזָּ֖ה בְּאֶ֥רֶץ שִׁבְיָֽה׃
Translated: Hear, our God, how we have become a mockery, and return their taunts upon their heads! Let them be taken as spoil to a land of captivity!
Transliteration: shema eloheynu khiy-hayiynu vuzah vehashev cherefatam el-rosham utenem levizah veerets shiveyah

Hebrew: וְאַל־תְּכַס֙ עַל־עֲוֺנָ֔ם וְחַטָּאתָ֖ם מִלְּפָנֶ֣יךָ אַל־תִּמָּחֶ֑ה כִּ֥י הִכְעִ֖יסוּ לְנֶ֥גֶד הַבּוֹנִֽים׃
Translated: Do not cover up their iniquity or let their sin be blotted out before You, for they hurled provocations at the builders.
Transliteration: veal-tekhas al-avonam vechatatam milefaneykha al-timacheh khiy hikheiysu leneged havvoniym

Hebrew: וַנִּבְנֶה֙ אֶת־הַ֣חוֹמָ֔ה וַתִּקָּשֵׁ֥ר כׇּל־הַחוֹמָ֖ה עַד־חֶצְיָ֑הּ וַיְהִ֧י לֵ֦ב לָעָ֖ם לַעֲשֽׂוֹת׃ {פ}
Translated: We rebuilt the wall till it was continuous all around to half its height; for the people’s heart was in the work.
Transliteration: vaniveneh et-hachvomah vatikasher khׇl-hachvomah ad-chetseyah vayehiy lev laam laashvot {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֣י כַאֲשֶׁ֣ר שָׁמַ֣ע סַנְבַלַּ֡ט וְ֠טוֹבִיָּ֠ה וְהָעַרְבִ֨ים וְהָעַמֹּנִ֜ים וְהָאַשְׁדּוֹדִ֗ים כִּֽי־עָלְתָ֤ה אֲרוּכָה֙ לְחֹמ֣וֹת יְרוּשָׁלַ֔͏ִם כִּי־הֵחֵ֥לּוּ הַפְּרֻצִ֖ים לְהִסָּתֵ֑ם וַיִּ֥חַר לָהֶ֖ם מְאֹֽד׃
Translated: When Sanballat and Tobiah, and the Arabs, the Ammonites, and the Ashdodites heard that healing had come to the walls of Jerusalem, that the breached parts had begun to be filled, it angered them very much,
Transliteration: vayehiy khaasher shama sanevalat vetvoviyah vehaareviym vehaamoniym vehaashedvodiym khiy-aletah arukhah lechomvot yerushala͏im khiy-hechelu haferutsiym lehisatem vayichar lahem meod

Hebrew: וַיִּקְשְׁר֤וּ כֻלָּם֙ יַחְדָּ֔ו לָב֖וֹא לְהִלָּחֵ֣ם בִּירוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם וְלַעֲשׂ֥וֹת ל֖וֹ תּוֹעָֽה׃
Translated: and they all conspired together to come and fight against Jerusalem and to throw it into confusion.
Transliteration: vayikesheru khulam yachedav lavvo lehilachem viyrushala͏im velaashvot lvo tvoah

Hebrew: וַנִּתְפַּלֵּ֖ל אֶל־אֱלֹהֵ֑ינוּ וַנַּעֲמִ֨יד מִשְׁמָ֧ר עֲלֵיהֶ֛ם יוֹמָ֥ם וָלַ֖יְלָה מִפְּנֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: Because of them we prayed to our God, and set up a watch over them day and night.
Transliteration: vanitefalel el-eloheynu vanaamiyd mishemar aleyhem yvomam valayelah mifeneyhem

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר יְהוּדָ֗ה כָּשַׁל֙ כֹּ֣חַ הַסַּבָּ֔ל וְהֶעָפָ֖ר הַרְבֵּ֑ה וַאֲנַ֙חְנוּ֙ לֹ֣א נוּכַ֔ל לִבְנ֖וֹת בַּחוֹמָֽה׃
Translated:
Judah was saying,
“The strength of the basket-carrier has failed,
And there is so much rubble;
We are not able ourselves
To rebuild the wall.”
Transliteration: vayomer yehudah khashal khocha hasaval veheafar hareveh vaanachenu lo nukhal livenvot vachvomah

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֣וּ צָרֵ֗ינוּ לֹ֤א יֵדְעוּ֙ וְלֹ֣א יִרְא֔וּ עַ֛ד אֲשֶׁר־נָב֥וֹא אֶל־תּוֹכָ֖ם וַהֲרַגְנ֑וּם וְהִשְׁבַּ֖תְנוּ אֶת־הַמְּלָאכָֽה׃
Translated: And our foes were saying, “Before they know or see it, we shall be in among them and kill them, and put a stop to the work.”
Transliteration: vayomeru tsareynu lo eideu velo yireu ad asher-navvo el-tvokham vaharagenum vehishevatenu et-hamelakhah

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִי֙ כַּאֲשֶׁר־בָּ֣אוּ הַיְּהוּדִ֔ים הַיֹּשְׁבִ֖ים אֶצְלָ֑ם וַיֹּ֤אמְרוּ לָ֙נוּ֙ עֶ֣שֶׂר פְּעָמִ֔ים מִכׇּל־הַמְּקֹמ֖וֹת אֲשֶׁר־תָּשׁ֥וּבוּ עָלֵֽינוּ׃
Translated: When the Jews living near them would arrive, they would tell us time and again “…from all the places where…you shall come back to us…”
Transliteration: vayehiy khaasher-vau hayehudiym hayosheviym etselam vayomeru lanu esher feamiym mikhׇl-hamekomvot asher-tashuvu aleynu

Hebrew: וָֽאַעֲמִ֞יד מִֽתַּחְתְּי֧וֹת לַמָּק֛וֹם מֵאַחֲרֵ֥י לַחוֹמָ֖ה (בצחחיים) [בַּצְּחִיחִ֑ים] וָֽאַעֲמִ֤יד אֶת־הָעָם֙ לְמִשְׁפָּח֔וֹת עִם־חַרְבֹתֵיהֶ֛ם רׇמְחֵיהֶ֖ם וְקַשְּׁתֹתֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: I stationed, on the lower levels of the place, behind the walls, on the bare rock—I stationed the people by families with their swords, their lances, and their bows.
Transliteration: vaaamiyd mitacheteyvot lamakvom meacharey lachvomah (vtschchyym) [vatsechiychiym] vaaamiyd et-haam lemishefachvot im-charevoteyhem rׇmecheyhem vekashetoteyhem

Hebrew: וָאֵ֣רֶא וָאָק֗וּם וָאֹמַ֞ר אֶל־הַחֹרִ֤ים וְאֶל־הַסְּגָנִים֙ וְאֶל־יֶ֣תֶר הָעָ֔ם אַל־תִּֽירְא֖וּ מִפְּנֵיהֶ֑ם אֶת־אֲדֹנָ֞י הַגָּד֤וֹל וְהַנּוֹרָא֙ זְכֹ֔רוּ וְהִֽלָּחֲמ֗וּ עַל־אֲחֵיכֶם֙ בְּנֵיכֶ֣ם וּבְנֹתֵיכֶ֔ם נְשֵׁיכֶ֖ם וּבָתֵּיכֶֽם׃ {פ}
Translated: Then I decided to exhort the nobles, the prefects, and the rest of the people, “Do not be afraid of them! Think of the great and awesome Lord, and fight for your brothers, your sons and daughters, your wives and homes!”
Transliteration: vaere vaakum vaomar el-hachoriym veel-haseganiym veel-yeter haam al-tiyreu mifeneyhem et-adonay hagadvol vehanvora zekhoru vehilachamu al-acheykhem veneykhem uvenoteykhem nesheykhem uvateykhem {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֞י כַּֽאֲשֶׁר־שָׁמְע֤וּ אוֹיְבֵ֙ינוּ֙ כִּי־נ֣וֹדַֽע לָ֔נוּ וַיָּ֥פֶר הָאֱלֹהִ֖ים אֶת־עֲצָתָ֑ם (ונשוב) [וַנָּ֤שׇׁב] כֻּלָּ֙נוּ֙ אֶל־הַ֣חוֹמָ֔ה אִ֖ישׁ אֶל־מְלַאכְתּֽוֹ׃
Translated: When our enemies learned that it had become known to us, since God had thus frustrated their plan, we could all return to the wall, each to his work.
Transliteration: vayehiy khaasher-shameu voyeveynu khiy-nvoda lanu vayafer haElohim et-atsatam (vnshvv) [vanashׇv] khulanu el-hachvomah iysh el-melakhetvo

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֣י ׀ מִן־הַיּ֣וֹם הַה֗וּא חֲצִ֣י נְעָרַי֮ עֹשִׂ֣ים בַּמְּלָאכָה֒ וְחֶצְיָ֗ם מַחֲזִיקִים֙ וְהָרְמָחִ֣ים הַמָּגִנִּ֔ים וְהַקְּשָׁת֖וֹת וְהַשִּׁרְיֹנִ֑ים וְהַ֨שָּׂרִ֔ים אַחֲרֵ֖י כׇּל־בֵּ֥ית יְהוּדָֽה׃
Translated: From that day on, half my servants did work and half held lances and shields, bows and armor. And the officers stood behind the whole house of Judah
Transliteration: vayehiy min-hayyvom hahu chatsiy nearay oshiym vamelakhah vechetseyam machaziykiym veharemachiym hamaginiym vehakeshatvot vehashireyoniym vehashariym acharey khׇl-veyt yehudah

Hebrew: הַבּוֹנִ֧ים בַּחוֹמָ֛ה וְהַנֹּשְׂאִ֥ים בַּסֶּ֖בֶל עֹמְשִׂ֑ים בְּאַחַ֤ת יָדוֹ֙ עֹשֶׂ֣ה בַמְּלָאכָ֔ה וְאַחַ֖ת מַחֲזֶ֥קֶת הַשָּֽׁלַח׃
Translated: who were rebuilding the wall. The basket-carriers were burdened, doing work with one hand while the other held a weapon.
Transliteration: havvoniym vachvomah vehanosheiym vasevel omeshiym veachat yadvo osheh vamelakhah veachat machazeket hashalach

Hebrew: וְהַ֨בּוֹנִ֔ים אִ֥ישׁ חַרְבּ֛וֹ אֲסוּרִ֥ים עַל־מׇתְנָ֖יו וּבוֹנִ֑ים וְהַתּוֹקֵ֥עַ בַּשּׁוֹפָ֖ר אֶצְלִֽי׃
Translated: As for the builders, each had his sword girded at his side as he was building. The trumpeter stood beside me.
Transliteration: vehavvoniym iysh charevvo asuriym al-mׇtenayv uvvoniym vehatvokea vashvofar etseliy

Hebrew: וָאֹמַ֞ר אֶל־הַחֹרִ֤ים וְאֶל־הַסְּגָנִים֙ וְאֶל־יֶ֣תֶר הָעָ֔ם הַמְּלָאכָ֥ה הַרְבֵּ֖ה וּרְחָבָ֑ה וַאֲנַ֗חְנוּ נִפְרָדִים֙ עַל־הַ֣חוֹמָ֔ה רְחוֹקִ֖ים אִ֥ישׁ מֵאָחִֽיו׃
Translated: I said to the nobles, the prefects, and the rest of the people, “There is much work and it is spread out; we are scattered over the wall, far from one another.
Transliteration: vaomar el-hachoriym veel-haseganiym veel-yeter haam hamelakhah hareveh urechavah vaanachenu niferadiym al-hachvomah rechvokiym iysh meachiyv

Hebrew: בִּמְק֗וֹם אֲשֶׁ֤ר תִּשְׁמְעוּ֙ אֶת־ק֣וֹל הַשּׁוֹפָ֔ר שָׁ֖מָּה תִּקָּבְצ֣וּ אֵלֵ֑ינוּ אֱלֹהֵ֖ינוּ יִלָּ֥חֶם לָֽנוּ׃
Translated: When you hear a trumpet call, gather yourselves to me at that place; our God will fight for us!”
Transliteration: vimekvom asher tishemeu et-kvol hashvofar shamah tikavetsu eleynu eloheynu yilachem lanu

Hebrew: וַאֲנַ֖חְנוּ עֹשִׂ֣ים בַּמְּלָאכָ֑ה וְחֶצְיָ֗ם מַחֲזִיקִים֙ בָּֽרְמָחִ֔ים מֵעֲל֣וֹת הַשַּׁ֔חַר עַ֖ד צֵ֥את הַכּוֹכָבִֽים׃
Translated: And so we worked on, while half were holding lances, from the break of day until the stars appeared.
Transliteration: vaanachenu oshiym vamelakhah vechetseyam machaziykiym varemachiym mealvot hashachar ad tset hakhvokhaviym

Hebrew: גַּ֣ם בָּעֵ֤ת הַהִיא֙ אָמַ֣רְתִּי לָעָ֔ם אִ֣ישׁ וְנַעֲר֔וֹ יָלִ֖ינוּ בְּת֣וֹךְ יְרוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם וְהָֽיוּ־לָ֧נוּ הַלַּ֛יְלָה מִשְׁמָ֖ר וְהַיּ֥וֹם מְלָאכָֽה׃
Translated: I further said to the people at that time, “Let every man with his servant lodge in Jerusalem, that we may use the night to stand guard and the day to work.”
Transliteration: gam vaet hahiy amaretiy laam iysh venaarvo yaliynu vetvokhe yerushala͏im vehayu-lanu halayelah mishemar vehayyvom melakhah

Hebrew: וְאֵ֨ין אֲנִ֜י וְאַחַ֣י וּנְעָרַ֗י וְאַנְשֵׁ֤י הַמִּשְׁמָר֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר אַחֲרַ֔י אֵין־אֲנַ֥חְנוּ פֹשְׁטִ֖ים בְּגָדֵ֑ינוּ אִ֖ישׁ שִׁלְח֥וֹ הַמָּֽיִם׃ {פ}
Translated: Nor did I, my brothers, my servants, or the guards following me ever take off our clothes, [or] each his weapon, even at the water.
Transliteration: veeyn aniy veachay unearay veaneshey hamishemar asher acharay eyn-anachenu foshetiym vegadeynu iysh shilechvo hamayiim {f}

Hebrew: וַתְּהִ֨י צַעֲקַ֥ת הָעָ֛ם וּנְשֵׁיהֶ֖ם גְּדוֹלָ֑ה אֶל־אֲחֵיהֶ֖ם הַיְּהוּדִֽים׃
Translated: There was a great outcry by the common folk and their wives against their brother Jews.
Transliteration: vatehiy tsaakat haam unesheyhem gedvolah el-acheyhem hayehudiym

Hebrew: וְיֵשׁ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר אֹמְרִ֔ים בָּנֵ֥ינוּ וּבְנֹתֵ֖ינוּ אֲנַ֣חְנוּ רַבִּ֑ים וְנִקְחָ֥ה דָגָ֖ן וְנֹאכְלָ֥ה וְנִחְיֶֽה׃
Translated: Some said, “Our sons and daughters are numerous; we must get grain to eat in order that we may live!”
Transliteration: veeish asher omeriym vaneynu uvenoteynu anachenu raviym venikechah dagan venokhelah venicheyeh

Hebrew: וְיֵשׁ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר אֹמְרִ֔ים שְׂדֹתֵ֛ינוּ וּכְרָמֵ֥ינוּ וּבָתֵּ֖ינוּ אֲנַ֣חְנוּ עֹרְבִ֑ים וְנִקְחָ֥ה דָגָ֖ן בָּרָעָֽב׃
Translated: Others said, “We must pawn our fields, our vineyards, and our homes to get grain to stave off hunger.”
Transliteration: veeish asher omeriym shedoteynu ukherameynu uvateynu anachenu oreviym venikechah dagan varaav

Hebrew: וְיֵשׁ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר אֹמְרִ֔ים לָוִ֥ינוּ כֶ֖סֶף לְמִדַּ֣ת הַמֶּ֑לֶךְ שְׂדֹתֵ֖ינוּ וּכְרָמֵֽינוּ׃
Translated: Yet others said, “We have borrowed money against our fields and vineyards to pay the king’s tax.
Transliteration: veeish asher omeriym laviynu khesef lemidat hamelekhe shedoteynu ukherameynu

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֗ה כִּבְשַׂ֤ר אַחֵ֙ינוּ֙ בְּשָׂרֵ֔נוּ כִּבְנֵיהֶ֖ם בָּנֵ֑ינוּ וְהִנֵּ֣ה אֲנַ֣חְנוּ כֹ֠בְשִׁ֠ים אֶת־בָּנֵ֨ינוּ וְאֶת־בְּנֹתֵ֜ינוּ לַעֲבָדִ֗ים וְיֵ֨שׁ מִבְּנֹתֵ֤ינוּ נִכְבָּשׁוֹת֙ וְאֵ֣ין לְאֵ֣ל יָדֵ֔נוּ וּשְׂדֹתֵ֥ינוּ וּכְרָמֵ֖ינוּ לַאֲחֵרִֽים׃
Translated: Now we are as good as our brothers, and our children as good as theirs; yet here we are subjecting our sons and daughters to slavery—some of our daughters are already subjected—and we are powerless, while our fields and vineyards belong to others.”
Transliteration: veatah khiveshar acheynu vesharenu khiveneyhem vaneynu vehineh anachenu khoveshiym et-vaneynu veet-venoteynu laavadiym veeish mivenoteynu nikhevashvot veeyn leel yadenu ushedoteynu ukherameynu laacheriym

Hebrew: וַיִּ֥חַר לִ֖י מְאֹ֑ד כַּאֲשֶׁ֤ר שָׁמַ֙עְתִּי֙ אֶת־זַֽעֲקָתָ֔ם וְאֵ֖ת הַדְּבָרִ֥ים הָאֵֽלֶּה׃
Translated: It angered me very much to hear their outcry and these complaints.
Transliteration: vayichar liy meod khaasher shamaetiy et-zaakatam veet hadevariym haeleh

Hebrew: וַיִּמָּלֵ֨ךְ לִבִּ֜י עָלַ֗י וָאָרִ֙יבָה֙ אֶת־הַחֹרִ֣ים וְאֶת־הַסְּגָנִ֔ים וָאֹמְרָ֣ה לָהֶ֔ם מַשָּׁ֥א אִישׁ־בְּאָחִ֖יו אַתֶּ֣ם (נשאים) [נֹשִׁ֑ים] וָאֶתֵּ֥ן עֲלֵיהֶ֖ם קְהִלָּ֥ה גְדוֹלָֽה׃
Translated: After pondering the matter carefully, I censured the nobles and the prefects, saying, “Are you pressing claims on loans made to your brothers?” Then I raised a large crowd against them
Transliteration: vayimalekhe liviy alay vaariyvah et-hachoriym veet-haseganiym vaomerah lahem masha iysh-veachiyv atem (nshym) [noshiym] vaeten aleyhem kehilah gedvolah

Hebrew: וָאֹמְרָ֣ה לָהֶ֗ם אֲנַ֣חְנוּ קָ֠נִ֠ינוּ אֶת־אַחֵ֨ינוּ הַיְּהוּדִ֜ים הַנִּמְכָּרִ֤ים לַגּוֹיִם֙ כְּדֵ֣י בָ֔נוּ וְגַם־אַתֶּ֛ם תִּמְכְּר֥וּ אֶת־אֲחֵיכֶ֖ם וְנִמְכְּרוּ־לָ֑נוּ וַֽיַּחֲרִ֔ישׁוּ וְלֹ֥א מָצְא֖וּ דָּבָֽר׃ {פ}
Translated: and said to them, “We have done our best to buy back our Jewish brothers who were sold to the nations; will you now sell your brothers so that they must be sold [back] to us?” They kept silent, for they found nothing to answer.
Transliteration: vaomerah lahem anachenu kaniynu et-acheynu hayehudiym hanimekhariym lagvoyim khedey vanu vegam-atem timekheru et-acheykhem venimekheru-lanu vayachariyshu velo matseu davar {f}

Hebrew: (ויאמר) [וָאוֹמַ֕ר] לֹא־ט֥וֹב הַדָּבָ֖ר אֲשֶׁר־אַתֶּ֣ם עֹשִׂ֑ים הֲל֞וֹא בְּיִרְאַ֤ת אֱלֹהֵ֙ינוּ֙ תֵּלֵ֔כוּ מֵחֶרְפַּ֖ת הַגּוֹיִ֥ם אוֹיְבֵֽינוּ׃
Translated: So I continued, “What you are doing is not right. You ought to act in a God-fearing way so as not to give our enemies, the nations, room to reproach us.
Transliteration: (vymr) [vavomar] lo-tvov hadavar asher-atem oshiym halvo veyireat eloheynu telekhu mecherefat hagvoyim voyeveynu

Hebrew: וְגַם־אֲנִי֙ אַחַ֣י וּנְעָרַ֔י נֹשִׁ֥ים בָּהֶ֖ם כֶּ֣סֶף וְדָגָ֑ן נַֽעַזְבָה־נָּ֖א אֶת־הַמַּשָּׁ֥א הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: I, my brothers, and my servants also have claims of money and grain against them; let us now abandon those claims!
Transliteration: vegam-aniy achay unearay noshiym vahem khesef vedagan naazevah-na et-hamasha hazeh

Hebrew: הָשִׁ֩יבוּ֩ נָ֨א לָהֶ֜ם כְּהַיּ֗וֹם שְׂדֹתֵיהֶ֛ם כַּרְמֵיהֶ֥ם זֵיתֵיהֶ֖ם וּבָתֵּיהֶ֑ם וּמְאַ֨ת הַכֶּ֤סֶף וְהַדָּגָן֙ הַתִּיר֣וֹשׁ וְהַיִּצְהָ֔ר אֲשֶׁ֥ר אַתֶּ֖ם נֹשִׁ֥ים בָּהֶֽם׃
Translated: Give back at once their fields, their vineyards, their olive trees, and their homes, and [abandon] the claims for the hundred pieces of silver, the grain, the wine, and the oil that you have been pressing against them!”
Transliteration: hashiyvu na lahem khehayyvom shedoteyhem kharemeyhem zeyteyhem uvateyhem umeat hakhesef vehadagan hatiyrvosh vehayitsehar asher atem noshiym vahem

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֣וּ נָשִׁ֗יב וּמֵהֶם֙ לֹ֣א נְבַקֵּ֔שׁ כֵּ֣ן נַעֲשֶׂ֔ה כַּאֲשֶׁ֖ר אַתָּ֣ה אוֹמֵ֑ר וָאֶקְרָא֙ אֶת־הַכֹּ֣הֲנִ֔ים וָֽאַשְׁבִּיעֵ֔ם לַעֲשׂ֖וֹת כַּדָּבָ֥ר הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: They replied, “We shall give them back, and not demand anything of them; we shall do just as you say.” Summoning the priests, I put them under oath to keep this promise.
Transliteration: vayomeru nashiyv umehem lo nevakesh khen naasheh khaasher atah vomer vaekera et-hakhohaniym vaasheviyem laashvot khadavar hazeh

Hebrew: גַּם־חׇצְנִ֣י נָעַ֗רְתִּי וָֽאֹמְרָ֡ה כָּ֣כָה יְנַעֵ֪ר הָֽאֱלֹהִ֟ים אֶת־כׇּל־הָאִישׁ֩ אֲשֶׁ֨ר לֹֽא־יָקִ֜ים אֶת־הַדָּבָ֣ר הַזֶּ֗ה מִבֵּיתוֹ֙ וּמִ֣יגִיע֔וֹ וְכָ֛כָה יִהְיֶ֥ה נָע֖וּר וָרֵ֑ק וַיֹּאמְר֨וּ כׇֽל־הַקָּהָ֜ל אָמֵ֗ן וַֽיְהַלְלוּ֙ אֶת־יְהֹוָ֔ה וַיַּ֥עַשׂ הָעָ֖ם כַּדָּבָ֥ר הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated:
I also shook out the bosom of my garment and said, “So may God shake free of his household and property any man who fails to keep this promise; may he be thus shaken out and stripped.” All the assembled answered, “Amen,” and praised the LORD.
The people kept this promise.
Transliteration: gam-chׇtseniy naaretiy vaomerah khakhah yenaer haElohimm et-khׇl-haiysh asher lo-yakiym et-hadavar hazeh miveytvo umiygiyvo vekhakhah yiheyeh naur varek vayomeru khׇl-hakahal amen vayehalelu et-yehovah vayaash haam khadavar hazeh

Hebrew: גַּ֞ם מִיּ֣וֹם ׀ אֲשֶׁר־צִוָּ֣ה אוֹתִ֗י לִהְי֣וֹת פֶּחָם֮ בְּאֶ֣רֶץ יְהוּדָה֒ מִשְּׁנַ֣ת עֶשְׂרִ֗ים וְ֠עַ֠ד שְׁנַ֨ת שְׁלֹשִׁ֤ים וּשְׁתַּ֙יִם֙ לְאַרְתַּחְשַׁ֣סְתְּא הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ שָׁנִ֖ים שְׁתֵּ֣ים עֶשְׂרֵ֑ה אֲנִ֣י וְאַחַ֔י לֶ֥חֶם הַפֶּחָ֖ה לֹ֥א אָכַֽלְתִּי׃
Translated: Furthermore, from the day I was commissioned to be governor in the land of Judah—from the twentieth year of King Artaxerxes until his thirty-second year, twelve years in all—neither I nor my brothers ever ate of the governor’s food allowance.
Transliteration: gam miyyvom asher-tsivah votiy liheyvot fecham veerets yehudah mishenat esheriym vead shenat sheloshiym ushetayiim learetacheshasete hamelekhe shaniym sheteym eshereh aniy veachay lechem hafechah lo akhaletiy

Hebrew: וְהַפַּחוֹת֩ הָרִאשֹׁנִ֨ים אֲשֶׁר־לְפָנַ֜י הִכְבִּ֣ידוּ עַל־הָעָ֗ם וַיִּקְח֨וּ מֵהֶ֜ם בְּלֶ֤חֶם וָיַ֙יִן֙ אַחַר֙ כֶּֽסֶף־שְׁקָלִ֣ים אַרְבָּעִ֔ים גַּ֥ם נַעֲרֵיהֶ֖ם שָׁלְט֣וּ עַל־הָעָ֑ם וַאֲנִי֙ לֹא־עָשִׂ֣יתִי כֵ֔ן מִפְּנֵ֖י יִרְאַ֥ת אֱלֹהִֽים׃
Translated: The former governors who preceded me laid heavy burdens on the people, and took from them for bread and wine more than forty shekels of silver. Their servants also tyrannized over the people. But I, out of the fear of God, did not do so.
Transliteration: vehafachvot harishoniym asher-lefanay hikheviydu al-haam vayikechu mehem velechem vayayiin achar khesef-shekaliym arevaiym gam naareyhem shaletu al-haam vaaniy lo-ashiytiy khen mifeney yireat Elohim

Hebrew: וְ֠גַ֠ם בִּמְלֶ֜אכֶת הַחוֹמָ֤ה הַזֹּאת֙ הֶחֱזַ֔קְתִּי וְשָׂדֶ֖ה לֹ֣א קָנִ֑ינוּ וְכׇ֨ל־נְעָרַ֔י קְבוּצִ֥ים שָׁ֖ם עַל־הַמְּלָאכָֽה׃
Translated: I also supported the work on this wall; we did not buy any land, and all my servants were gathered there at the work.
Transliteration: vegam vimelekhet hachvomah hazot hechezaketiy veshadeh lo kaniynu vekhׇl-nearay kevutsiym sham al-hamelakhah

Hebrew: וְהַיְּהוּדִ֨ים וְהַסְּגָנִ֜ים מֵאָ֧ה וַחֲמִשִּׁ֣ים אִ֗ישׁ וְהַבָּאִ֥ים אֵלֵ֛ינוּ מִן־הַגּוֹיִ֥ם אֲשֶׁר־סְבִיבֹתֵ֖ינוּ עַל־שֻׁלְחָנִֽי׃
Translated: Although there were at my table, between Jews and prefects, one hundred and fifty men in all, beside those who came to us from surrounding nations;
Transliteration: vehayehudiym vehaseganiym meah vachamishiym iysh vehavaiym eleynu min-hagvoyim asher-seviyvoteynu al-shulechaniy

Hebrew: וַאֲשֶׁר֩ הָיָ֨ה נַעֲשֶׂ֜ה לְי֣וֹם אֶחָ֗ד שׁ֣וֹר אֶחָ֞ד צֹ֠אן שֵׁשׁ־בְּרֻר֤וֹת וְצִפֳּרִים֙ נַֽעֲשׂוּ־לִ֔י וּבֵ֨ין עֲשֶׂ֧רֶת יָמִ֛ים בְּכׇל־יַ֖יִן לְהַרְבֵּ֑ה וְעִם־זֶ֗ה לֶ֤חֶם הַפֶּחָה֙ לֹ֣א בִקַּ֔שְׁתִּי כִּֽי־כָֽבְדָ֥ה הָעֲבֹדָ֖ה עַל־הָעָ֥ם הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: and although what was prepared for each day came to one ox, six select sheep, and fowl, all prepared for me, and at ten-day intervals all sorts of wine in abundance—yet I did not resort to the governor’s food allowance, for the [king’s] service lay heavily on the people.
Transliteration: vaasher hayah naasheh leyvom echad shvor echad tson shesh-verurvot vetsiforiym naashu-liy uveyn asheret yamiym vekhׇl-yayiin lehareveh veim-zeh lechem hafechah lo vikashetiy khiy-khavedah haavodah al-haam hazeh

Hebrew: זׇכְרָה־לִּ֥י אֱלֹהַ֖י לְטוֹבָ֑ה כֹּ֥ל אֲשֶׁר־עָשִׂ֖יתִי עַל־הָעָ֥ם הַזֶּֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: O my God, remember to my credit all that I have done for this people!
Transliteration: zׇkherah-liy elohay letvovah khol asher-ashiytiy al-haam hazeh {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֣י כַאֲשֶׁ֣ר נִשְׁמַ֣ע לְסַנְבַלַּ֣ט וְ֠טוֹבִיָּ֠ה וּלְגֶ֨שֶׁם הָֽעַרְבִ֜י וּלְיֶ֣תֶר אֹֽיְבֵ֗ינוּ כִּ֤י בָנִ֙יתִי֙ אֶת־הַ֣חוֹמָ֔ה וְלֹא־נ֥וֹתַר בָּ֖הּ פָּ֑רֶץ גַּ֚ם עַד־הָעֵ֣ת הַהִ֔יא דְּלָת֖וֹת לֹא־הֶעֱמַ֥דְתִּי בַשְּׁעָרִֽים׃
Translated: When word reached Sanballat, Tobiah, Geshem the Arab, and the rest of our enemies that I had rebuilt the wall and not a breach remained in it—though at that time I had not yet set up doors in the gateways—
Transliteration: vayehiy khaasher nishema lesanevalat vetvoviyah ulegeshem haareviy uleyeter oyeveynu khiy vaniytiy et-hachvomah velo-nvotar vah farets gam ad-haet hahiy delatvot lo-heemadetiy vasheariym

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֨ח סַנְבַלַּ֤ט וְגֶ֙שֶׁם֙ אֵלַ֣י לֵאמֹ֔ר לְכָ֞ה וְנִֽוָּעֲדָ֥ה יַחְדָּ֛ו בַּכְּפִירִ֖ים בְּבִקְעַ֣ת אוֹנ֑וֹ וְהֵ֙מָּה֙ חֹֽשְׁבִ֔ים לַעֲשׂ֥וֹת לִ֖י רָעָֽה׃
Translated: Sanballat and Geshem sent a message to me, saying, “Come, let us get together in Kephirim in the Ono valley”; they planned to do me harm.
Transliteration: vayishelach sanevalat vegeshem elay lemor lekhah venivaadah yachedav vakhefiyriym vevikeat vonvo vehemah chosheviym laashvot liy raah

Hebrew: וָאֶשְׁלְחָ֨ה עֲלֵיהֶ֤ם מַלְאָכִים֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר מְלָאכָ֤ה גְדוֹלָה֙ אֲנִ֣י עֹשֶׂ֔ה וְלֹ֥א אוּכַ֖ל לָרֶ֑דֶת לָ֣מָּה תִשְׁבַּ֤ת הַמְּלָאכָה֙ כַּאֲשֶׁ֣ר אַרְפֶּ֔הָ וְיָרַדְתִּ֖י אֲלֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: I sent them messengers, saying, “I am engaged in a great work and cannot come down, for the work will stop if I leave it in order to come down to you.”
Transliteration: vaeshelechah aleyhem maleakhiym lemor melakhah gedvolah aniy osheh velo ukhal laredet lamah tishevat hamelakhah khaasher arefeha veyaradetiy aleykhem

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלְח֥וּ אֵלַ֛י כַּדָּבָ֥ר הַזֶּ֖ה אַרְבַּ֣ע פְּעָמִ֑ים וָאָשִׁ֥יב אוֹתָ֖ם כַּדָּבָ֥ר הַזֶּֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: They sent me the same message four times, and I gave them the same answer.
Transliteration: vayishelechu elay khadavar hazeh areva feamiym vaashiyv votam khadavar hazeh {f}

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַח֩ אֵלַ֨י סַנְבַלַּ֜ט כַּדָּבָ֥ר הַזֶּ֛ה פַּ֥עַם חֲמִישִׁ֖ית אֶֽת־נַעֲר֑וֹ וְאִגֶּ֥רֶת פְּתוּחָ֖ה בְּיָדֽוֹ׃
Translated: Sanballat sent me the same message a fifth time by his servant, who had an open letter with him.
Transliteration: vayishelach elay sanevalat khadavar hazeh faam chamiyshiyt et-naarvo veigeret fetuchah veyadvo

Hebrew: כָּת֣וּב בָּ֗הּ בַּגּוֹיִ֤ם נִשְׁמָע֙ וְגַשְׁמ֣וּ אֹמֵ֔ר אַתָּ֤ה וְהַיְּהוּדִים֙ חֹשְׁבִ֣ים לִמְר֔וֹד עַל־כֵּ֛ן אַתָּ֥ה בוֹנֶ֖ה הַחוֹמָ֑ה וְאַתָּ֗ה הֹוֶ֤ה לָהֶם֙ לְמֶ֔לֶךְ כַּדְּבָרִ֖ים הָאֵֽלֶּה׃
Translated: Its text was: “Word has reached the nations, and Geshem too says that you and the Jews are planning to rebel—for which reason you are building the wall—and that you are to be their king. Such is the word.
Transliteration: khatuv vah vagvoyim nishema vegashemu omer atah vehayehudiym chosheviym limervod al-khen atah vvoneh hachvomah veatah hoveh lahem lemelekhe khadevariym haeleh

Hebrew: וְגַם־נְבִיאִ֡ים הֶעֱמַ֣דְתָּ לִקְרֹא֩ עָלֶ֨יךָ בִֽירוּשָׁלַ֜͏ִם לֵאמֹ֗ר מֶ֚לֶךְ בִּֽיהוּדָ֔ה וְעַתָּה֙ יִשָּׁמַ֣ע לַמֶּ֔לֶךְ כַּדְּבָרִ֖ים הָאֵ֑לֶּה וְעַתָּ֣ה לְכָ֔ה וְנִֽוָּעֲצָ֖ה יַחְדָּֽו׃ {פ}
Translated: You have also set up prophets in Jerusalem to proclaim about you, ‘There is a king in Judah!’ Word of these things will surely reach the king; so come, let us confer together.”
Transliteration: vegam-neviyiym heemadeta likero aleykha viyrushala͏im lemor melekhe viyhudah veatah yishama lamelekhe khadevariym haeleh veatah lekhah venivaatsah yachedav {f}

Hebrew: וָאֶשְׁלְחָ֤ה אֵלָיו֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר לֹ֤א נִֽהְיָה֙ כַּדְּבָרִ֣ים הָאֵ֔לֶּה אֲשֶׁ֖ר אַתָּ֣ה אוֹמֵ֑ר כִּ֥י מִֽלִּבְּךָ֖ אַתָּ֥ה בוֹדָֽאם׃
Translated: I sent back a message to him, saying, “None of these things you mention has occurred; they are figments of your imagination”—
Transliteration: vaeshelechah elayv lemor lo niheyah khadevariym haeleh asher atah vomer khiy milivekha atah vvodam

Hebrew: כִּ֣י כֻלָּ֗ם מְיָֽרְאִ֤ים אוֹתָ֙נוּ֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר יִרְפּ֧וּ יְדֵיהֶ֛ם מִן־הַמְּלָאכָ֖ה וְלֹ֣א תֵעָשֶׂ֑ה וְעַתָּ֖ה חַזֵּ֥ק אֶת־יָדָֽי׃
Translated: for they all wished to intimidate us, thinking, “They will desist from the work, and it will not get done.” Now strengthen my hands!
Transliteration: khiy khulam meyareiym votanu lemor yirefu yedeyhem min-hamelakhah velo teasheh veatah chazek et-yaday

Hebrew: וַאֲנִי־בָ֗אתִי בֵּ֣ית שְֽׁמַֽעְיָ֧ה בֶן־דְּלָיָ֛ה בֶּן־מְהֵֽיטַבְאֵ֖ל וְה֣וּא עָצ֑וּר וַיֹּ֡אמֶר נִוָּעֵד֩ אֶל־בֵּ֨ית הָאֱלֹהִ֜ים אֶל־תּ֣וֹךְ הַֽהֵיכָ֗ל וְנִסְגְּרָה֙ דַּלְת֣וֹת הַהֵיכָ֔ל כִּ֚י בָּאִ֣ים לְהׇרְגֶ֔ךָ וְלַ֖יְלָה בָּאִ֥ים לְהׇרְגֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
Then I visited Shemaiah son of Delaiah son of Mehetabel when he was housebound, and he said,
“Let us meet in the House of God, inside the sanctuary,
And let us shut the doors of the sanctuary, for they are coming to kill you,
By night they are coming to kill you.”
Transliteration: vaaniy-vatiy veyt shemaeyah ven-delayah ven-meheytaveel vehu atsur vayomer nivaed el-veyt haElohim el-tvokhe haheykhal venisegerah daletvot haheykhal khiy vaiym lehׇregekha velayelah vaiym lehׇregekha

Hebrew: וָאֹמְרָ֗ה הַאִ֤ישׁ כָּמ֙וֹנִי֙ יִבְרָ֔ח וּמִ֥י כָמ֛וֹנִי אֲשֶׁר־יָבֹ֥א אֶל־הַהֵיכָ֖ל וָחָ֑י לֹ֖א אָבֽוֹא׃
Translated: I replied, “Will a man like me take flight? Besides, who such as I can go into the sanctuary and live? I will not go in.”
Transliteration: vaomerah haiysh khamvoniy yiverach umiy khamvoniy asher-yavo el-haheykhal vachay lo avvo

Hebrew: וָאַכִּ֕ירָה וְהִנֵּ֥ה לֹֽא־אֱלֹהִ֖ים שְׁלָח֑וֹ כִּ֤י הַנְּבוּאָה֙ דִּבֶּ֣ר עָלַ֔י וְטוֹבִיָּ֥ה וְסַנְבַלַּ֖ט שְׂכָרֽוֹ׃
Translated: Then I realized that it was not God who sent him, but that he uttered that prophecy about me—Tobiah and Sanballat having hired him—
Transliteration: vaakhiyrah vehineh lo-Elohim shelachvo khiy hanevuah diver alay vetvoviyah vesanevalat shekharvo

Hebrew: לְמַ֤עַן שָׂכוּר֙ ה֔וּא לְמַֽעַן־אִירָ֥א וְאֶֽעֱשֶׂה־כֵּ֖ן וְחָטָ֑אתִי וְהָיָ֤ה לָהֶם֙ לְשֵׁ֣ם רָ֔ע לְמַ֖עַן יְחָֽרְפֽוּנִי׃ {פ}
Translated: because he was a hireling, that I might be intimidated and act thus and commit a sin, and so provide them a scandal with which to reproach me.
Transliteration: lemaan shakhur hu lemaan-iyra veeesheh-khen vechatatiy vehayah lahem leshem ra lemaan yecharefuniy {f}

Hebrew: זׇכְרָ֧ה אֱלֹהַ֛י לְטוֹבִיָּ֥ה וּלְסַנְבַלַּ֖ט כְּמַעֲשָׂ֣יו אֵ֑לֶּה וְגַ֨ם לְנוֹעַדְיָ֤ה הַנְּבִיאָה֙ וּלְיֶ֣תֶר הַנְּבִיאִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר הָי֖וּ מְיָֽרְאִ֥ים אוֹתִֽי׃
Translated: “O my God, remember against Tobiah and Sanballat these deeds of theirs, and against Noadiah the prophetess, and against the other prophets that they wished to intimidate me!”
Transliteration: zׇkherah elohay letvoviyah ulesanevalat khemaashayv eleh vegam lenvoadeyah haneviyah uleyeter haneviyiym asher hayu meyareiym votiy

Hebrew: וַתִּשְׁלַם֙ הַֽחוֹמָ֔ה בְּעֶשְׂרִ֥ים וַחֲמִשָּׁ֖ה לֶאֱל֑וּל לַחֲמִשִּׁ֥ים וּשְׁנַ֖יִם יֽוֹם׃ {פ}
Translated: The wall was finished on the twenty-fifth of Elul, after fifty-two days.
Transliteration: vatishelam hachvomah veesheriym vachamishah leelul lachamishiym ushenayiim yvom {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֗י כַּאֲשֶׁ֤ר שָֽׁמְעוּ֙ כׇּל־א֣וֹיְבֵ֔ינוּ וַיִּֽרְא֗וּ כׇּל־הַגּוֹיִם֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר סְבִֽיבֹתֵ֔ינוּ וַיִּפְּל֥וּ מְאֹ֖ד בְּעֵינֵיהֶ֑ם וַיֵּ֣דְע֔וּ כִּ֚י מֵאֵ֣ת אֱלֹהֵ֔ינוּ נֶעֶשְׂתָ֖ה הַמְּלָאכָ֥ה הַזֹּֽאת׃
Translated: When all our enemies heard it, all the nations round about us were intimidated, and fell very low in their own estimation; they realized that this work had been accomplished by the help of our God.
Transliteration: vayehiy khaasher shameu khׇl-voyeveynu vayireu khׇl-hagvoyim asher seviyvoteynu vayifelu meod veeyneyhem vayedeu khiy meet eloheynu neeshetah hamelakhah hazot

Hebrew: גַּ֣ם ׀ בַּיָּמִ֣ים הָהֵ֗ם מַרְבִּ֞ים חֹרֵ֤י יְהוּדָה֙ אִגְּרֹ֣תֵיהֶ֔ם הוֹלְכ֖וֹת עַל־טוֹבִיָּ֑ה וַאֲשֶׁ֥ר לְטוֹבִיָּ֖ה בָּא֥וֹת אֲלֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: Also in those days, the nobles of Judah kept up a brisk correspondence with Tobiah, and Tobiah with them.
Transliteration: gam vayamiym hahem mareviym chorey yehudah igeroteyhem hvolekhvot al-tvoviyah vaasher letvoviyah vavot aleyhem

Hebrew: כִּי־רַבִּ֣ים בִּֽיהוּדָ֗ה בַּעֲלֵ֤י שְׁבוּעָה֙ ל֔וֹ כִּי־חָתָ֥ן ה֖וּא לִשְׁכַנְיָ֣ה בֶן־אָרַ֑ח וִֽיהוֹחָנָ֣ן בְּנ֔וֹ לָקַ֕ח אֶת־בַּת־מְשֻׁלָּ֖ם בֶּ֥ן בֶּֽרֶכְיָֽה׃
Translated: Many in Judah were his confederates, for he was a son-in-law of Shecaniah son of Arah, and his son Jehohanan had married the daughter of Meshullam son of Berechiah.
Transliteration: khiy-raviym viyhudah vaaley shevuah lvo khiy-chatan hu lishekhaneyah ven-arach viyhvochanan venvo lakach et-vat-meshulam ven verekheyah

Hebrew: גַּ֣ם טוֹבֹתָ֗יו הָי֤וּ אֹמְרִים֙ לְפָנַ֔י וּדְבָרַ֕י הָי֥וּ מוֹצִיאִ֖ים ל֑וֹ אִגְּר֛וֹת שָׁלַ֥ח טוֹבִיָּ֖ה לְיָֽרְאֵֽנִי׃ {פ}
Translated: They would also speak well of him to me, and would divulge my affairs to him. Tobiah sent letters to intimidate me.
Transliteration: gam tvovotayv hayu omeriym lefanay udevaray hayu mvotsiyiym lvo igervot shalach tvoviyah leyareeniy {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֗י כַּאֲשֶׁ֤ר נִבְנְתָה֙ הַחוֹמָ֔ה וָאַעֲמִ֖יד הַדְּלָת֑וֹת וַיִּפָּ֥קְד֛וּ הַשּׁוֹעֲרִ֥ים וְהַמְשֹׁרְרִ֖ים וְהַלְוִיִּֽם׃
Translated: When the wall was rebuilt and I had set up the doors, tasks were assigned to the gatekeepers, the singers, and the Levites.
Transliteration: vayehiy khaasher nivenetah hachvomah vaaamiyd hadelatvot vayifakedu hashvoariym vehameshoreriym vehaleviyim

Hebrew: וָאֲצַוֶּ֞ה אֶת־חֲנָ֣נִי אָחִ֗י וְאֶת־חֲנַנְיָ֛ה שַׂ֥ר הַבִּירָ֖ה עַל־יְרוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם כִּי־הוּא֙ כְּאִ֣ישׁ אֱמֶ֔ת וְיָרֵ֥א אֶת־הָאֱלֹהִ֖ים מֵרַבִּֽים׃
Translated: I put Hanani my brother and Hananiah, the captain of the fortress, in charge of Jerusalem, for he was a more trustworthy and God-fearing man than most.
Transliteration: vaatsaveh et-chananiy achiy veet-chananeyah shar haviyrah al-yerushala͏im khiy-hu kheiysh emet veyare et-haElohim meraviym

Hebrew: (ויאמר) [וָאֹמַ֣ר] לָהֶ֗ם לֹ֣א יִפָּֽתְח֞וּ שַׁעֲרֵ֤י יְרוּשָׁלַ֙͏ִם֙ עַד־חֹ֣ם הַשֶּׁ֔מֶשׁ וְעַ֨ד הֵ֥ם עֹמְדִ֛ים יָגִ֥יפוּ הַדְּלָת֖וֹת וֶאֱחֹ֑זוּ וְהַעֲמֵ֗יד מִשְׁמְרוֹת֙ יֹשְׁבֵ֣י יְרוּשָׁלַ֔͏ִם אִ֚ישׁ בְּמִשְׁמָר֔וֹ וְאִ֖ישׁ נֶ֥גֶד בֵּיתֽוֹ׃
Translated: I said to them, “The gates of Jerusalem are not to be opened until the heat of the day, and before you leave your posts let the doors be closed and barred. And assign the inhabitants of Jerusalem to watches, each man to his watch, and each in front of his own house.”
Transliteration: (vymr) [vaomar] lahem lo yifatechu shaarey yerushala͏im ad-chom hashemesh vead hem omediym yagiyfu hadelatvot veechozu vehaameyd mishemervot yoshevey yerushala͏im iysh vemishemarvo veiysh neged veytvo

Hebrew: וְהָעִ֞יר רַחֲבַ֤ת יָדַ֙יִם֙ וּגְדֹלָ֔ה וְהָעָ֥ם מְעַ֖ט בְּתוֹכָ֑הּ וְאֵ֥ין בָּתִּ֖ים בְּנוּיִֽם׃
Translated: The city was broad and large, the people in it were few, and houses were not yet built.
Transliteration: vehaiyr rachavat yadayiim ugedolah vehaam meat vetvokhah veeyn vatiym venuyim

Hebrew: וַיִּתֵּ֤ן אֱלֹהַי֙ אֶל־לִבִּ֔י וָאֶקְבְּצָ֞ה אֶת־הַחֹרִ֧ים וְאֶת־הַסְּגָנִ֛ים וְאֶת־הָעָ֖ם לְהִתְיַחֵ֑שׂ וָֽאֶמְצָ֗א סֵ֤פֶר הַיַּ֙חַשׂ֙ הָעוֹלִ֣ים בָּרִאשׁוֹנָ֔ה וָאֶמְצָ֖א כָּת֥וּב בּֽוֹ׃ {פ}
Translated: My God put it into my mind to assemble the nobles, the prefects, and the people, in order to register them by families. I found the genealogical register of those who were the first to come up, and there I found written:
Transliteration: vayiten elohay el-liviy vaekevetsah et-hachoriym veet-haseganiym veet-haam lehiteyachesh vaemetsa sefer hayachash havoliym varishvonah vaemetsa khatuv vvo {f}

Hebrew: אֵ֣לֶּה ׀ בְּנֵ֣י הַמְּדִינָ֗ה הָעֹלִים֙ מִשְּׁבִ֣י הַגּוֹלָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֣ר הֶגְלָ֔ה נְבוּכַדְנֶצַּ֖ר מֶ֣לֶךְ בָּבֶ֑ל וַיָּשׁ֧וּבוּ לִֽירוּשָׁלַ֛͏ִם וְלִיהוּדָ֖ה אִ֥ישׁ לְעִירֽוֹ׃
Translated: These are the people of the province who came up from among the captive exiles that Nebuchadnezzar, king of Babylon, had deported, and who returned to Jerusalem and to Judah, each to his own city,
Transliteration: eleh veney hamediynah haoliym misheviy hagvolah asher hegelah nevukhadenetsar melekhe vavel vayashuvu liyrushala͏im veliyhudah iysh leiyrvo

Hebrew: הַבָּאִ֣ים עִם־זְרֻבָּבֶ֗ל יֵשׁ֡וּעַ נְחֶמְיָ֡ה עֲ֠זַרְיָ֠ה רַֽעַמְיָ֨ה נַחֲמָ֜נִי מׇרְדֳּכַ֥י בִּלְשָׁ֛ן מִסְפֶּ֥רֶת בִּגְוַ֖י נְח֣וּם בַּעֲנָ֑ה מִסְפַּ֕ר אַנְשֵׁ֖י עַ֥ם יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ {ס}
Translated:
who came with Zerubbabel, Jeshua, Nehemiah, Azariah, Raamiah, Nahamani, Mordecai, Bilshan, Mispereth, Bigvai, Nehum, Baanah.

The number of the men of the people of Israel:
Transliteration: havaiym im-zeruvavel eishua nechemeyah azareyah raameyah nachamaniy mׇredokhay vileshan miseferet vigevay nechum vaanah misefar aneshey am yisherael {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֣י פַרְעֹ֔שׁ אַלְפַּ֕יִם מֵאָ֖ה וְשִׁבְעִ֥ים וּשְׁנָֽיִם׃ {ס}
Translated: the sons of Parosh—2,172;
Transliteration: veney fareosh alefayiim meah veshiveiym ushenayiim {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֣י שְׁפַטְיָ֔ה שְׁלֹ֥שׁ מֵא֖וֹת שִׁבְעִ֥ים וּשְׁנָֽיִם׃ {ס}
Translated: the sons of Shephatiah—372;
Transliteration: veney shefateyah shelosh mevot shiveiym ushenayiim {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֣י אָרַ֔ח שֵׁ֥שׁ מֵא֖וֹת חֲמִשִּׁ֥ים וּשְׁנָֽיִם׃ {ס}
Translated: the sons of Arah—652;
Transliteration: veney arach shesh mevot chamishiym ushenayiim {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵֽי־פַחַ֥ת מוֹאָ֛ב לִבְנֵ֥י יֵשׁ֖וּעַ וְיוֹאָ֑ב אַלְפַּ֕יִם וּשְׁמֹנֶ֥ה מֵא֖וֹת שְׁמֹנָ֥ה עָשָֽׂר׃ {ס}
Translated: the sons of Pahath-moab: the sons of Jeshua and Joab—2,818;
Transliteration: veney-fachat mvoav liveney eishua veyvoav alefayiim ushemoneh mevot shemonah ashar {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֣י עֵילָ֔ם אֶ֕לֶף מָאתַ֖יִם חֲמִשִּׁ֥ים וְאַרְבָּעָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: the sons of Elam—1,254;
Transliteration: veney eylam elef matayiim chamishiym vearevaah {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֣י זַתּ֔וּא שְׁמֹנֶ֥ה מֵא֖וֹת אַרְבָּעִ֥ים וַחֲמִשָּֽׁה׃ {ס}
Translated: the sons of Zattu—845;
Transliteration: veney zatu shemoneh mevot arevaiym vachamishah {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֣י זַכָּ֔י שְׁבַ֥ע מֵא֖וֹת וְשִׁשִּֽׁים׃ {ס}
Translated: the sons of Zaccai—760;
Transliteration: veney zakhay sheva mevot veshishiym {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֣י בִנּ֔וּי שֵׁ֥שׁ מֵא֖וֹת אַרְבָּעִ֥ים וּשְׁמֹנָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: the sons of Binnui—648;
Transliteration: veney vinuy shesh mevot arevaiym ushemonah {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֣י בֵבָ֔י שֵׁ֥שׁ מֵא֖וֹת עֶשְׂרִ֥ים וּשְׁמֹנָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: the sons of Bebai—628;
Transliteration: veney vevay shesh mevot esheriym ushemonah {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֣י עַזְגָּ֔ד אַלְפַּ֕יִם שְׁלֹ֥שׁ מֵא֖וֹת עֶשְׂרִ֥ים וּשְׁנָֽיִם׃ {ס}
Translated: the sons of Azgad—2,322;
Transliteration: veney azegad alefayiim shelosh mevot esheriym ushenayiim {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵי֙ אֲדֹ֣נִיקָ֔ם שֵׁ֥שׁ מֵא֖וֹת שִׁשִּׁ֥ים וְשִׁבְעָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: the sons of Adonikam—667;
Transliteration: veney adoniykam shesh mevot shishiym veshiveah {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֣י בִגְוָ֔י אַלְפַּ֖יִם שִׁשִּׁ֥ים וְשִׁבְעָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: the sons of Bigvai—2,067;
Transliteration: veney vigevay alefayiim shishiym veshiveah {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֣י עָדִ֔ין שֵׁ֥שׁ מֵא֖וֹת חֲמִשִּׁ֥ים וַחֲמִשָּֽׁה׃ {ס}
Translated: the sons of Adin—655;
Transliteration: veney adiyn shesh mevot chamishiym vachamishah {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵֽי־אָטֵ֥ר לְחִזְקִיָּ֖ה תִּשְׁעִ֥ים וּשְׁמֹנָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: the sons of Ater: Hezekiah—98;
Transliteration: veney-ater lechizekiyah tisheiym ushemonah {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֣י חָשֻׁ֔ם שְׁלֹ֥שׁ מֵא֖וֹת עֶשְׂרִ֥ים וּשְׁמֹנָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: the sons of Hashum—328;
Transliteration: veney chashum shelosh mevot esheriym ushemonah {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֣י בֵצָ֔י שְׁלֹ֥שׁ מֵא֖וֹת עֶשְׂרִ֥ים וְאַרְבָּעָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: the sons of Bezai—324;
Transliteration: veney vetsay shelosh mevot esheriym vearevaah {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֣י חָרִ֔יף מֵאָ֖ה שְׁנֵ֥ים עָשָֽׂר׃ {ס}
Translated: the sons of Hariph—112;
Transliteration: veney chariyf meah sheneym ashar {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֥י גִבְע֖וֹן תִּשְׁעִ֥ים וַחֲמִשָּֽׁה׃ {ס}
Translated: the sons of Gibeon—95;
Transliteration: veney givevon tisheiym vachamishah {s}

Hebrew: אַנְשֵׁ֤י בֵֽית־לֶ֙חֶם֙ וּנְטֹפָ֔ה מֵאָ֖ה שְׁמֹנִ֥ים וּשְׁמֹנָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: the men of Bethlehem and Netophah—188;
Transliteration: aneshey veyt-lechem unetofah meah shemoniym ushemonah {s}

Hebrew: אַנְשֵׁ֣י עֲנָת֔וֹת מֵאָ֖ה עֶשְׂרִ֥ים וּשְׁמֹנָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: the men of Anathoth—128;
Transliteration: aneshey anatvot meah esheriym ushemonah {s}

Hebrew: אַנְשֵׁ֥י בֵית־עַזְמָ֖וֶת אַרְבָּעִ֥ים וּשְׁנָֽיִם׃ {ס}
Translated: the men of Beth-azmaveth—42;
Transliteration: aneshey veyt-azemavet arevaiym ushenayiim {s}

Hebrew: אַנְשֵׁ֨י קִרְיַ֤ת יְעָרִים֙ כְּפִירָ֣ה וּבְאֵר֔וֹת שְׁבַ֥ע מֵא֖וֹת אַרְבָּעִ֥ים וּשְׁלֹשָֽׁה׃ {ס}
Translated: the men of Kiriath-jearim, Chephirah, and Beeroth—743;
Transliteration: aneshey kireyat yeariym khefiyrah uveervot sheva mevot arevaiym usheloshah {s}

Hebrew: אַנְשֵׁ֤י הָֽרָמָה֙ וָגָ֔בַע שֵׁ֥שׁ מֵא֖וֹת עֶשְׂרִ֥ים וְאֶחָֽד׃ {ס}
Translated: the men of Ramah and Geba—621;
Transliteration: aneshey haramah vagava shesh mevot esheriym veechad {s}

Hebrew: אַנְשֵׁ֣י מִכְמָ֔ס מֵאָ֖ה וְעֶשְׂרִ֥ים וּשְׁנָֽיִם׃ {ס}
Translated: the men of Michmas—122;
Transliteration: aneshey mikhemas meah veesheriym ushenayiim {s}

Hebrew: אַנְשֵׁ֤י בֵֽית־אֵל֙ וְהָעָ֔י מֵאָ֖ה עֶשְׂרִ֥ים וּשְׁלֹשָֽׁה׃ {ס}
Translated: the men of Bethel and Ai—123;
Transliteration: aneshey veyt-el vehaay meah esheriym usheloshah {s}

Hebrew: אַנְשֵׁ֥י נְב֛וֹ אַחֵ֖ר חֲמִשִּׁ֥ים וּשְׁנָֽיִם׃ {ס}
Translated: the men of the other Nebo—52;
Transliteration: aneshey nevvo acher chamishiym ushenayiim {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵי֙ עֵילָ֣ם אַחֵ֔ר אֶ֕לֶף מָאתַ֖יִם חֲמִשִּׁ֥ים וְאַרְבָּעָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: the sons of the other Elam—1,254;
Transliteration: veney eylam acher elef matayiim chamishiym vearevaah {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֣י חָרִ֔ם שְׁלֹ֥שׁ מֵא֖וֹת וְעֶשְׂרִֽים׃ {ס}
Translated: the sons of Harim—320;
Transliteration: veney charim shelosh mevot veesheriym {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֣י יְרֵח֔וֹ שְׁלֹ֥שׁ מֵא֖וֹת אַרְבָּעִ֥ים וַחֲמִשָּֽׁה׃ {ס}
Translated: the sons of Jericho—345;
Transliteration: veney yerechvo shelosh mevot arevaiym vachamishah {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵי־לֹד֙ חָדִ֣יד וְאֹנ֔וֹ שְׁבַ֥ע מֵא֖וֹת וְעֶשְׂרִ֥ים וְאֶחָֽד׃ {ס}
Translated: the sons of Lod, Hadid, and Ono—721;
Transliteration: veney-lod chadiyd veonvo sheva mevot veesheriym veechad {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֣י סְנָאָ֔ה שְׁלֹ֣שֶׁת אֲלָפִ֔ים תְּשַׁ֥ע מֵא֖וֹת וּשְׁלֹשִֽׁים׃ {פ}
Translated: the sons of Senaah—3,930.
Transliteration: veney senaah sheloshet alafiym tesha mevot usheloshiym {f}

Hebrew: הַֽכֹּהֲנִ֑ים בְּנֵ֤י יְדַֽעְיָה֙ לְבֵ֣ית יֵשׁ֔וּעַ תְּשַׁ֥ע מֵא֖וֹת שִׁבְעִ֥ים וּשְׁלֹשָֽׁה׃ {ס}
Translated: The priests: the sons of Jedaiah: the house of Jeshua—973;
Transliteration: hakhohaniym veney yedaeyah leveyt eishua tesha mevot shiveiym usheloshah {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֣י אִמֵּ֔ר אֶ֖לֶף חֲמִשִּׁ֥ים וּשְׁנָֽיִם׃ {ס}
Translated: the sons of Immer—1,052;
Transliteration: veney imer elef chamishiym ushenayiim {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֣י פַשְׁח֔וּר אֶ֕לֶף מָאתַ֖יִם אַרְבָּעִ֥ים וְשִׁבְעָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: the sons of Pashhur—1,247;
Transliteration: veney fashechur elef matayiim arevaiym veshiveah {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֣י חָרִ֔ם אֶ֖לֶף שִׁבְעָ֥ה עָשָֽׂר׃ {ס}
Translated: the sons of Harim—1,017.
Transliteration: veney charim elef shiveah ashar {s}

Hebrew: הַלְוִיִּ֑ם בְּנֵֽי־יֵשׁ֧וּעַ לְקַדְמִיאֵ֛ל לִבְנֵ֥י לְהוֹדְוָ֖ה שִׁבְעִ֥ים וְאַרְבָּעָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: The Levites: the sons of Jeshua: Kadmiel, the sons of Hodeiah—74.
Transliteration: haleviyim veney-eishua lekademiyel liveney lehvodevah shiveiym vearevaah {s}

Hebrew: הַֽמְשֹׁרְרִ֑ים בְּנֵ֣י אָסָ֔ף מֵאָ֖ה אַרְבָּעִ֥ים וּשְׁמֹנָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: The singers: the sons of Asaph—148.
Transliteration: hameshoreriym veney asaf meah arevaiym ushemonah {s}

Hebrew: הַשֹּֽׁעֲרִ֗ים בְּנֵֽי־שַׁלֻּ֤ם בְּנֵֽי־אָטֵר֙ בְּנֵֽי־טַלְמֹ֣ן בְּנֵֽי־עַקּ֔וּב בְּנֵ֥י חֲטִיטָ֖א בְּנֵ֣י שֹׁבָ֑י מֵאָ֖ה שְׁלֹשִׁ֥ים וּשְׁמֹנָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: The gatekeepers: the sons of Shallum, the sons of Ater, the sons of Talmon, the sons of Akkub, the sons of Hatita, the sons of Shobai—138.
Transliteration: hashoariym veney-shalum veney-ater veney-talemon veney-akuv veney chatiyta veney shovay meah sheloshiym ushemonah {f}

Hebrew: הַנְּתִינִ֑ים בְּנֵי־צִחָ֥א בְנֵי־חֲשֻׂפָ֖א בְּנֵ֥י טַבָּעֽוֹת׃ {ס}
Translated: The temple servants: the sons of Ziha, the sons of Hasupha, the sons of Tabbaoth,
Transliteration: hanetiyniym veney-tsicha veney-chashufa veney tavavot {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵי־קֵירֹ֥ס בְּנֵי־סִיעָ֖א בְּנֵ֥י פָדֽוֹן׃ {ס}
Translated: the sons of Keros, the sons of Siah, the sons of Padon,
Transliteration: veney-keyros veney-siya veney fadvon {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵי־לְבָנָ֥ה בְנֵי־חֲגָבָ֖א בְּנֵ֥י שַׁלְמָֽי׃ {ס}
Translated: the sons of Lebanah, the sons of Hagabah, the sons of Shalmai,
Transliteration: veney-levanah veney-chagava veney shalemay {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵי־חָנָ֥ן בְּנֵי־גִדֵּ֖ל בְּנֵי־גָֽחַר׃ {ס}
Translated: the sons of Hanan, the sons of Giddel, the sons of Gahar,
Transliteration: veney-chanan veney-gidel veney-gachar {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵי־רְאָיָ֥ה בְנֵי־רְצִ֖ין בְּנֵ֥י נְקוֹדָֽא׃ {ס}
Translated: the sons of Reaiah, the sons of Rezin, the sons of Nekoda,
Transliteration: veney-reayah veney-retsiyn veney nekvoda {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵי־גַזָּ֥ם בְּנֵי־עֻזָּ֖א בְּנֵ֥י פָסֵֽחַ׃ {ס}
Translated: the sons of Gazzam, the sons of Uzza, the sons of Paseah,
Transliteration: veney-gazam veney-uza veney fasecha {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵי־בֵסַ֥י בְּנֵי־מְעוּנִ֖ים בְּנֵ֥י (נפושסים) [נְפִֽישְׁסִֽים]׃ {ס}
Translated: the sons of Besai, the sons of Meunim, the sons of Nephishesim,
Transliteration: veney-vesay veney-meuniym veney (nfvshsym) [nefiyshesiym] {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵי־בַקְבּ֥וּק בְּנֵֽי־חֲקוּפָ֖א בְּנֵ֥י חַרְחֽוּר׃ {ס}
Translated: the sons of Bakbuk, the sons of Hakupha, the sons of Harhur,
Transliteration: veney-vakevuk veney-chakufa veney charechur {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵי־בַצְלִ֥ית בְּנֵֽי־מְחִידָ֖א בְּנֵ֥י חַרְשָֽׁא׃ {ס}
Translated: the sons of Bazlith, the sons of Mehida, the sons of Harsha,
Transliteration: veney-vatseliyt veney-mechiyda veney charesha {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵי־בַרְק֥וֹס בְּֽנֵי־סִֽיסְרָ֖א בְּנֵי־תָֽמַח׃ {ס}
Translated: the sons of Barkos, the sons of Sisera, the sons of Temah,
Transliteration: veney-varekvos veney-siysera veney-tamach {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֥י נְצִ֖יחַ בְּנֵ֥י חֲטִיפָֽא׃ {ס}
Translated: the sons of Neziah, the sons of Hatipha.
Transliteration: veney netsiycha veney chatiyfa {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֖י עַבְדֵ֣י שְׁלֹמֹ֑ה בְּנֵי־סוֹטַ֥י בְּנֵי־סֹפֶ֖רֶת בְּנֵ֥י פְרִידָֽא׃ {ס}
Translated: The sons of Solomon’s servants: the sons of Sotai, the sons of Sophereth, the sons of Perida,
Transliteration: veney avedey shelomoh veney-svotay veney-soferet veney feriyda {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵי־יַעְלָ֥א בְנֵי־דַרְק֖וֹן בְּנֵ֥י גִדֵּֽל׃ {ס}
Translated: the sons of Jala, the sons of Darkon, the sons of Giddel,
Transliteration: veney-yaela veney-darekvon veney gidel {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֧י שְׁפַטְיָ֣ה בְנֵֽי־חַטִּ֗יל {ס} בְּנֵ֛י פֹּכֶ֥רֶת הַצְּבָיִ֖ים בְּנֵ֥י אָמֽוֹן׃ {ס}
Translated: the sons of Shephatiah, the sons of Hattil, the sons of Pochereth-hazzebaim, the sons of Amon.
Transliteration: veney shefateyah veney-chatiyl {s} veney fokheret hatsevayiym veney amvon {s}

Hebrew: כׇּ֨ל־הַנְּתִינִ֔ים וּבְנֵ֖י עַבְדֵ֣י שְׁלֹמֹ֑ה שְׁלֹ֥שׁ מֵא֖וֹת תִּשְׁעִ֥ים וּשְׁנָֽיִם׃ {פ}
Translated: The total of temple servants and the sons of Solomon’s servants—392.
Transliteration: khׇl-hanetiyniym uveney avedey shelomoh shelosh mevot tisheiym ushenayiim {f}

Hebrew: וְאֵ֗לֶּה הָֽעוֹלִים֙ מִתֵּ֥ל מֶ֙לַח֙ תֵּ֣ל חַרְשָׁ֔א כְּר֥וּב אַדּ֖וֹן וְאִמֵּ֑ר וְלֹ֣א יָכְל֗וּ לְהַגִּ֤יד בֵּית־אֲבֹתָם֙ וְזַרְעָ֔ם אִ֥ם מִיִּשְׂרָאֵ֖ל הֵֽם׃ {ס}
Translated: The following were those who came up from Tel-melah, Tel-harsha, Cherub, Addon, and Immer—they were unable to tell whether their father’s house and descent were Israelite:
Transliteration: veeleh havoliym mitel melach tel charesha kheruv advon veimer velo yakhelu lehagiyd veyt-avotam vezaream im miyisherael hem {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵי־דְלָיָ֥ה בְנֵֽי־טוֹבִיָּ֖ה בְּנֵ֣י נְקוֹדָ֑א שֵׁ֥שׁ מֵא֖וֹת וְאַרְבָּעִ֥ים וּשְׁנָֽיִם׃ {פ}
Translated: the sons of Delaiah, the sons of Tobiah, the sons of Nekoda—642.
Transliteration: veney-delayah veney-tvoviyah veney nekvoda shesh mevot vearevaiym ushenayiim {f}

Hebrew: וּמִן־הַכֹּ֣הֲנִ֔ים בְּנֵ֥י חֳבַיָּ֖ה בְּנֵ֣י הַקּ֑וֹץ בְּנֵ֣י בַרְזִלַּ֗י אֲשֶׁ֣ר לָ֠קַ֠ח מִבְּנ֞וֹת בַּרְזִלַּ֤י הַגִּלְעָדִי֙ אִשָּׁ֔ה וַיִּקָּרֵ֖א עַל־שְׁמָֽם׃
Translated: Of the priests: the sons of Habaiah, the sons of Hakkoz, the sons of Barzillai who had married a daughter of Barzillai the Gileadite and had taken his name—
Transliteration: umin-hakhohaniym veney chovayah veney hakvots veney varezilay asher lakach mivenvot varezilay hagileadiy ishah vayikare al-shemam

Hebrew: אֵ֗לֶּה בִּקְשׁ֧וּ כְתָבָ֛ם הַמִּתְיַחְשִׂ֖ים וְלֹ֣א נִמְצָ֑א וַיְגֹֽאֲל֖וּ מִן־הַכְּהֻנָּֽה׃
Translated: these searched for their genealogical records, but they could not be found, so they were disqualified for the priesthood.
Transliteration: eleh vikeshu khetavam hamiteyacheshiym velo nimetsa vayegoalu min-hakhehunah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר הַתִּרְשָׁ֙תָא֙ לָהֶ֔ם אֲשֶׁ֥ר לֹא־יֹאכְל֖וּ מִקֹּ֣דֶשׁ הַקֳּדָשִׁ֑ים עַ֛ד עֲמֹ֥ד הַכֹּהֵ֖ן לְאוּרִ֥ים וְתֻמִּֽים׃
Translated: The Tirshatha ordered them not to eat of the most holy things until a priest with Urim and Thummim should appear.
Transliteration: vayomer hatireshata lahem asher lo-yokhelu mikodesh hakodashiym ad amod hakhohen leuriym vetumiym

Hebrew: כׇּל־הַקָּהָ֖ל כְּאֶחָ֑ד אַרְבַּ֣ע רִבּ֔וֹא אַלְפַּ֖יִם שְׁלֹשׁ־מֵא֥וֹת וְשִׁשִּֽׁים׃
Translated: The sum of the entire community was 42,360,
Transliteration: khׇl-hakahal kheechad areva rivvo alefayiim shelosh-mevot veshishiym

Hebrew: מִ֠לְּבַ֠ד עַבְדֵיהֶ֤ם וְאַמְהֹֽתֵיהֶם֙ אֵ֔לֶּה שִׁבְעַ֣ת אֲלָפִ֔ים שְׁלֹ֥שׁ מֵא֖וֹת שְׁלֹשִׁ֣ים וְשִׁבְעָ֑ה וְלָהֶ֗ם מְשֹֽׁרְרִים֙ וּמְשֹׁ֣רְר֔וֹת מָאתַ֖יִם וְאַרְבָּעִ֥ים וַחֲמִשָּֽׁה׃ {ס}
Translated: not counting their male and female servants, these being 7,337; they also had 245 male and female singers.
Transliteration: milevad avedeyhem veamehoteyhem eleh shiveat alafiym shelosh mevot sheloshiym veshiveah velahem meshoreriym umeshorervot matayiim vearevaiym vachamishah {s}

Hebrew: גְּמַלִּ֕ים אַרְבַּ֥ע מֵא֖וֹת שְׁלֹשִׁ֣ים וַחֲמִשָּׁ֑ה חֲמֹרִ֕ים שֵׁ֣שֶׁת אֲלָפִ֔ים שְׁבַ֥ע מֵא֖וֹת וְעֶשְׂרִֽים׃
Translated: [Their horses—736, their mules—245,] camels—435, asses—6,720.
Transliteration: gemaliym areva mevot sheloshiym vachamishah chamoriym sheshet alafiym sheva mevot veesheriym

Hebrew: וּמִקְצָת֙ רָאשֵׁ֣י הָֽאָב֔וֹת נָתְנ֖וּ לַמְּלָאכָ֑ה הַתִּרְשָׁ֜תָא נָתַ֣ן לָאוֹצָ֗ר זָהָ֞ב דַּרְכְּמֹנִ֥ים אֶ֙לֶף֙ מִזְרָק֣וֹת חֲמִשִּׁ֔ים כׇּתְנוֹת֙ כֹּֽהֲנִ֔ים שְׁלֹשִׁ֖ים וַחֲמֵ֥שׁ מֵאֽוֹת׃
Translated: Some of the heads of the clans made donations for the work. The Tirshatha donated to the treasury: gold—1,000 drachmas, basins—50, priestly robes—530.
Transliteration: umiketsat rashey haavvot natenu lamelakhah hatireshata natan lavotsar zahav darekhemoniym elef mizerakvot chamishiym khׇtenvot khohaniym sheloshiym vachamesh mevot

Hebrew: וּמֵֽרָאשֵׁ֣י הָֽאָב֗וֹת נָֽתְנוּ֙ לְאוֹצַ֣ר הַמְּלָאכָ֔ה זָהָ֕ב דַּרְכְּמוֹנִ֖ים שְׁתֵּ֣י רִבּ֑וֹת וְכֶ֕סֶף מָנִ֖ים אַלְפַּ֥יִם וּמָאתָֽיִם׃
Translated: Some of the heads of the clans donated to the work treasury: gold—20,000 drachmas, and silver—2,200 minas.
Transliteration: umerashey haavvot natenu levotsar hamelakhah zahav darekhemvoniym shetey rivvot vekhesef maniym alefayiim umatayiim

Hebrew: וַאֲשֶׁ֣ר נָתְנוּ֮ שְׁאֵרִ֣ית הָעָם֒ זָהָ֗ב דַּרְכְּמֹנִים֙ שְׁתֵּ֣י רִבּ֔וֹא וְכֶ֖סֶף מָנִ֣ים אַלְפָּ֑יִם וְכׇתְנֹ֥ת כֹּֽהֲנִ֖ים שִׁשִּׁ֥ים וְשִׁבְעָֽה׃
Translated: The rest of the people donated: gold—20,000 drachmas, silver—2,000, and priestly robes—67.
Transliteration: vaasher natenu sheeriyt haam zahav darekhemoniym shetey rivvo vekhesef maniym alefayiim vekhׇtenot khohaniym shishiym veshiveah

Hebrew: וַיֵּשְׁב֣וּ הַכֹּהֲנִ֣ים וְהַלְוִיִּ֡ם וְהַשּׁוֹעֲרִים֩ וְהַמְשֹׁרְרִ֨ים וּמִן־הָעָ֧ם וְהַנְּתִינִ֛ים וְכׇל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל בְּעָרֵיהֶ֑ם {ס} וַיִּגַּע֙ הַחֹ֣דֶשׁ הַשְּׁבִיעִ֔י וּבְנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל בְּעָרֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated:
The priests, the Levites, the gatekeepers, the singers, some of the people, the temple servants, and all Israel took up residence in their towns.
When the seventh month arrived—the Israelites being [settled] in their towns—
Transliteration: vayeshevu hakhohaniym vehaleviyim vehashvoariym vehameshoreriym umin-haam vehanetiyniym vekhׇl-yisherael veareyhem {s} vayiga hachodesh hasheviyiy uveney yisherael veareyhem

Hebrew: וַיֵּאָסְפ֤וּ כׇל־הָעָם֙ כְּאִ֣ישׁ אֶחָ֔ד אֶל־הָ֣רְח֔וֹב אֲשֶׁ֖ר לִפְנֵ֣י שַֽׁעַר־הַמָּ֑יִם וַיֹּֽאמְרוּ֙ לְעֶזְרָ֣א הַסֹּפֵ֔ר לְהָבִ֗יא אֶת־סֵ֙פֶר֙ תּוֹרַ֣ת מֹשֶׁ֔ה אֲשֶׁר־צִוָּ֥ה יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: the entire people assembled as one man in the square before the Water Gate, and they asked Ezra the scribe to bring the scroll of the Teaching of Moses with which the L<small>ORD</small> had charged Israel.
Transliteration: vayeasefu khׇl-haam kheiysh echad el-harechvov asher lifeney shaar-hamayiim vayomeru leezera hasofer lehaviy et-sefer tvorat mosheh asher-tsivah yehovah et-yisherael

Hebrew: וַיָּבִ֣יא עֶזְרָ֣א הַ֠כֹּהֵ֠ן אֶֽת־הַתּוֹרָ֞ה לִפְנֵ֤י הַקָּהָל֙ מֵאִ֣ישׁ וְעַד־אִשָּׁ֔ה וְכֹ֖ל מֵבִ֣ין לִשְׁמֹ֑עַ בְּי֥וֹם אֶחָ֖ד לַחֹ֥דֶשׁ הַשְּׁבִיעִֽי׃
Translated: On the first day of the seventh month, Ezra the priest brought the Teaching before the congregation, men and women and all who could listen with understanding.
Transliteration: vayaviy ezera hakhohen et-hatvorah lifeney hakahal meiysh vead-ishah vekhol meviyn lishemoa veyvom echad lachodesh hasheviyiy

Hebrew: וַיִּקְרָא־בוֹ֩ לִפְנֵ֨י הָרְח֜וֹב אֲשֶׁ֣ר ׀ לִפְנֵ֣י שַֽׁעַר־הַמַּ֗יִם מִן־הָאוֹר֙ עַד־מַחֲצִ֣ית הַיּ֔וֹם נֶ֛גֶד הָאֲנָשִׁ֥ים וְהַנָּשִׁ֖ים וְהַמְּבִינִ֑ים וְאׇזְנֵ֥י כׇל־הָעָ֖ם אֶל־סֵ֥פֶר הַתּוֹרָֽה׃
Translated: He read from it, facing the square before the Water Gate, from the first light until midday, to the men and the women and those who could understand; the ears of all the people were given to the scroll of the Teaching.
Transliteration: vayikera-vvo lifeney harechvov asher lifeney shaar-hamayiim min-havor ad-machatsiyt hayyvom neged haanashiym vehanashiym vehameviyniym veׇzeney khׇl-haam el-sefer hatvorah
