Hebrew: וַֽיַּעֲמֹ֞ד עֶזְרָ֣א הַסֹּפֵ֗ר עַֽל־מִגְדַּל־עֵץ֮ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָשׂ֣וּ לַדָּבָר֒ וַיַּֽעֲמֹ֣ד אֶצְל֡וֹ מַתִּתְיָ֡ה וְשֶׁ֡מַע וַ֠עֲנָיָ֠ה וְאוּרִיָּ֧ה וְחִלְקִיָּ֛ה וּמַעֲשֵׂיָ֖ה עַל־יְמִינ֑וֹ וּמִשְּׂמֹאל֗וֹ פְּ֠דָיָ֠ה וּמִֽישָׁאֵ֧ל וּמַלְכִּיָּ֛ה וְחָשֻׁ֥ם וְחַשְׁבַּדָּ֖נָה זְכַרְיָ֥ה מְשֻׁלָּֽם׃ {פ}
Translated: Ezra the scribe stood upon a wooden tower made for the purpose, and beside him stood Mattithiah, Shema, Anaiah, Uriah, Hilkiah, and Maaseiah at his right, and at his left Pedaiah, Mishael, Malchijah, Hashum, Hashbaddanah, Zechariah, Meshullam.
Transliteration: vayaamod ezera hasofer al-migedal-ets asher ashu ladavar vayaamod etselvo matiteyah veshema vaanayah veuriyah vechilekiyah umaasheyah al-yemiynvo umishemolvo fedayah umiyshael umalekhiyah vechashum vechashevadanah zekhareyah meshulam {f}

Hebrew: וַיִּפְתַּ֨ח עֶזְרָ֤א הַסֵּ֙פֶר֙ לְעֵינֵ֣י כׇל־הָעָ֔ם כִּֽי־מֵעַ֥ל כׇּל־הָעָ֖ם הָיָ֑ה וּכְפִתְח֖וֹ עָֽמְד֥וּ כׇל־הָעָֽם׃
Translated: Ezra opened the scroll in the sight of all the people, for he was above all the people; as he opened it, all the people stood up.
Transliteration: vayifetach ezera hasefer leeyney khׇl-haam khiy-meal khׇl-haam hayah ukhefitechvo amedu khׇl-haam

Hebrew: וַיְבָ֣רֶךְ עֶזְרָ֔א אֶת־יְהֹוָ֥ה הָאֱלֹהִ֖ים הַגָּד֑וֹל וַיַּֽעֲנ֨וּ כׇל־הָעָ֜ם אָמֵ֤ן <small>׀</small> אָמֵן֙ בְּמֹ֣עַל יְדֵיהֶ֔ם וַיִּקְּד֧וּ וַיִּֽשְׁתַּחֲו֛וּ לַיהֹוָ֖ה אַפַּ֥יִם אָֽרְצָה׃
Translated: Ezra blessed the L<small>ORD</small>, the great God, and all the people answered, “Amen, Amen,” with hands upraised. Then they bowed their heads and prostrated themselves before the L<small>ORD</small> with their faces to the ground.
Transliteration: vayevarekhe ezera et-yehovah haElohim hagadvol vayaanu khׇl-haam amen <small></small> amen vemoal yedeyhem vayikedu vayishetachavu layhovah afayiim aretsah

Hebrew: וְיֵשׁ֡וּעַ וּבָנִ֡י וְשֵׁרֵ֥בְיָ֣ה ׀ יָמִ֡ין עַקּ֡וּב שַׁבְּתַ֣י ׀ הֽוֹדִיָּ֡ה מַעֲשֵׂיָ֡ה קְלִיטָ֣א עֲזַרְיָה֩ יוֹזָבָ֨ד חָנָ֤ן פְּלָאיָה֙ וְהַלְוִיִּ֔ם מְבִינִ֥ים אֶת־הָעָ֖ם לַתּוֹרָ֑ה וְהָעָ֖ם עַל־עׇמְדָֽם׃
Translated: Jeshua, Bani, Sherebiah, Jamin, Akkub, Shabbethai, Hodiah, Maaseiah, Kelita, Azariah, Jozabad, Hanan, Pelaiah, and the Levites explained the Teaching to the people, while the people stood in their places.
Transliteration: veeishua uvaniy veshereveyah yamiyn akuv shavetay hvodiyah maasheyah keliyta azareyah yvozavad chanan felayah vehaleviyim meviyniym et-haam latvorah vehaam al-ׇmedam

Hebrew: וַֽיִּקְרְא֥וּ בַסֵּ֛פֶר בְּתוֹרַ֥ת הָאֱלֹהִ֖ים מְפֹרָ֑שׁ וְשׂ֣וֹם שֶׂ֔כֶל וַיָּבִ֖ינוּ בַּמִּקְרָֽא׃ {פ}
Translated: They read from the scroll of the Teaching of God, translating it and giving the sense; so they understood the reading.
Transliteration: vayikereu vasefer vetvorat haElohim meforash veshvom shekhel vayaviynu vamikera {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר נְחֶמְיָ֣ה ה֣וּא הַתִּרְשָׁ֡תָא וְעֶזְרָ֣א הַכֹּהֵ֣ן <small>׀</small> הַסֹּפֵ֡ר וְהַלְוִיִּם֩ הַמְּבִינִ֨ים אֶת־הָעָ֜ם לְכׇל־הָעָ֗ם הַיּ֤וֹם קָדֹֽשׁ־הוּא֙ לַיהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶ֔ם אַל־תִּֽתְאַבְּל֖וּ וְאַל־תִּבְכּ֑וּ כִּ֤י בוֹכִים֙ כׇּל־הָעָ֔ם כְּשׇׁמְעָ֖ם אֶת־דִּבְרֵ֥י הַתּוֹרָֽה׃
Translated: Nehemiah the Tirshatha, Ezra the priest and scribe, and the Levites who were explaining to the people said to all the people, “This day is holy to the L<small>ORD</small> your God: you must not mourn or weep,” for all the people were weeping as they listened to the words of the Teaching.
Transliteration: vayomer nechemeyah hu hatireshata veezera hakhohen <small></small> hasofer vehaleviyim hameviyniym et-haam lekhׇl-haam hayyvom kadosh-hu layhovah eloheykhem al-titeavelu veal-tivekhu khiy vvokhiym khׇl-haam kheshׇmeam et-diverey hatvorah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר לָהֶ֡ם לְכוּ֩ אִכְל֨וּ מַשְׁמַנִּ֜ים וּשְׁת֣וּ מַֽמְתַקִּ֗ים וְשִׁלְח֤וּ מָנוֹת֙ לְאֵ֣ין נָכ֣וֹן ל֔וֹ כִּֽי־קָד֥וֹשׁ הַיּ֖וֹם לַאֲדֹנֵ֑ינוּ וְאַל־תֵּ֣עָצֵ֔בוּ כִּֽי־חֶדְוַ֥ת יְהֹוָ֖ה הִ֥יא מָֽעֻזְּכֶֽם׃
Translated: He further said to them, “Go, eat choice foods and drink sweet drinks and send portions to whoever has nothing prepared, for the day is holy to our Lord. Do not be sad, for your rejoicing in the L<small>ORD</small> is the source of your strength.”
Transliteration: vayomer lahem lekhu ikhelu mashemaniym ushetu mametakiym veshilechu manvot leeyn nakhvon lvo khiy-kadvosh hayyvom laadoneynu veal-teatsevu khiy-chedevat yehovah hiy mauzekhem

Hebrew: וְהַלְוִיִּ֞ם מַחְשִׁ֤ים לְכׇל־הָעָם֙ לֵאמֹ֣ר הַ֔סּוּ כִּ֥י הַיּ֖וֹם קָדֹ֑שׁ וְאַל־תֵּעָצֵֽבוּ׃
Translated: The Levites were quieting the people, saying, “Hush, for the day is holy; do not be sad.”
Transliteration: vehaleviyim macheshiym lekhׇl-haam lemor hasu khiy hayyvom kadosh veal-teatsevu

Hebrew: וַיֵּלְכ֨וּ כׇל־הָעָ֜ם לֶאֱכֹ֤ל וְלִשְׁתּוֹת֙ וּלְשַׁלַּ֣ח מָנ֔וֹת וְלַעֲשׂ֖וֹת שִׂמְחָ֣ה גְדוֹלָ֑ה כִּ֤י הֵבִ֙ינוּ֙ בַּדְּבָרִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר הוֹדִ֖יעוּ לָהֶֽם׃ {פ}
Translated: Then all the people went to eat and drink and send portions and make great merriment, for they understood the things they were told.
Transliteration: vayelekhu khׇl-haam leekhol velishetvot uleshalach manvot velaashvot shimechah gedvolah khiy heviynu vadevariym asher hvodiyu lahem {f}

Hebrew: וּבַיּ֣וֹם הַשֵּׁנִ֡י נֶאֶסְפוּ֩ רָאשֵׁ֨י הָאָב֜וֹת לְכׇל־הָעָ֗ם הַכֹּֽהֲנִים֙ וְהַלְוִיִּ֔ם אֶל־עֶזְרָ֖א הַסֹּפֵ֑ר וּלְהַשְׂכִּ֖יל אֶל־דִּבְרֵ֥י הַתּוֹרָֽה׃
Translated: On the second day, the heads of the clans of all the people and the priests and Levites gathered to Ezra the scribe to study the words of the Teaching.
Transliteration: uvayyvom hasheniy neesefu rashey haavvot lekhׇl-haam hakhohaniym vehaleviyim el-ezera hasofer ulehashekhiyl el-diverey hatvorah

Hebrew: וַֽיִּמְצְא֖וּ כָּת֣וּב בַּתּוֹרָ֑ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר צִוָּ֤ה יְהֹוָה֙ בְּיַד־מֹשֶׁ֔ה אֲשֶׁר֩ יֵשְׁב֨וּ בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֧ל בַּסֻּכּ֛וֹת בֶּחָ֖ג בַּחֹ֥דֶשׁ הַשְּׁבִיעִֽי׃
Translated: They found written in the Teaching that the L<small>ORD</small> had commanded Moses that the Israelites must dwell in booths during the festival of the seventh month,
Transliteration: vayimetseu khatuv vatvorah asher tsivah yehovah veyad-mosheh asher eishevu veney-yisherael vasukhvot vechag vachodesh hasheviyiy

Hebrew: וַאֲשֶׁ֣ר יַשְׁמִ֗יעוּ וְיַעֲבִ֨ירוּ ק֥וֹל בְּכׇל־עָרֵיהֶם֮ וּבִירוּשָׁלַ֣͏ִם לֵאמֹר֒ צְא֣וּ הָהָ֗ר וְהָבִ֙יאוּ֙ עֲלֵי־זַ֙יִת֙ וַעֲלֵי־עֵ֣ץ שֶׁ֔מֶן וַעֲלֵ֤י הֲדַס֙ וַעֲלֵ֣י תְמָרִ֔ים וַעֲלֵ֖י עֵ֣ץ עָבֹ֑ת לַעֲשֹׂ֥ת סֻכֹּ֖ת כַּכָּתֽוּב׃ {ס}
Translated: and that they must announce and proclaim throughout all their towns and Jerusalem as follows, “Go out to the mountains and bring leafy branches of olive trees, pine trees, myrtles, palms and [other] leafy trees to make booths, as it is written.”
Transliteration: vaasher yashemiyu veyaaviyru kvol vekhׇl-areyhem uviyrushala͏im lemor tseu hahar vehaviyu aley-zayiit vaaley-ets shemen vaaley hadas vaaley temariym vaaley ets avot laashot sukhot khakhatuv {s}

Hebrew: וַיֵּצְא֣וּ הָעָם֮ וַיָּבִ֒יאוּ֒ וַיַּעֲשׂוּ֩ לָהֶ֨ם סֻכּ֜וֹת אִ֤ישׁ עַל־גַּגּוֹ֙ וּבְחַצְרֹ֣תֵיהֶ֔ם וּבְחַצְר֖וֹת בֵּ֣ית הָאֱלֹהִ֑ים וּבִרְחוֹב֙ שַׁ֣עַר הַמַּ֔יִם וּבִרְח֖וֹב שַׁ֥עַר אֶפְרָֽיִם׃ {ס}
Translated: So the people went out and brought them, and made themselves booths on their roofs, in their courtyards, in the courtyards of the House of God, in the square of the Water Gate and in the square of the Ephraim Gate.
Transliteration: vayetseu haam vayaviyu vayaashu lahem sukhvot iysh al-gagvo uvechatseroteyhem uvechatservot veyt haElohim uvirechvov shaar hamayiim uvirechvov shaar eferayiim {s}

Hebrew: וַיַּֽעֲשׂ֣וּ כׇֽל־הַ֠קָּהָ֠ל הַשָּׁבִ֨ים מִן־הַשְּׁבִ֥י <small>׀</small> סֻכּוֹת֮ וַיֵּשְׁב֣וּ בַסֻּכּוֹת֒ כִּ֣י לֹֽא־עָשׂ֡וּ מִימֵי֩ יֵשׁ֨וּעַ בִּן־נ֥וּן כֵּן֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל עַ֖ד הַיּ֣וֹם הַה֑וּא וַתְּהִ֥י שִׂמְחָ֖ה גְּדוֹלָ֥ה מְאֹֽד׃
Translated: The whole community that returned from the captivity made booths and dwelt in the booths—the Israelites had not done so from the days of Joshua son of Nun to that day—and there was very great rejoicing.
Transliteration: vayaashu khׇl-hakahal hashaviym min-hasheviy <small></small> sukhvot vayeshevu vasukhvot khiy lo-ashu miymey eishua vin-nun khen veney yisherael ad hayyvom hahu vatehiy shimechah gedvolah meod

Hebrew: וַ֠יִּקְרָ֠א בְּסֵ֨פֶר תּוֹרַ֤ת הָאֱלֹהִים֙ י֣וֹם ׀ בְּי֔וֹם מִן־הַיּוֹם֙ הָֽרִאשׁ֔וֹן עַ֖ד הַיּ֣וֹם הָאַחֲר֑וֹן וַיַּֽעֲשׂוּ־חָג֙ שִׁבְעַ֣ת יָמִ֔ים וּבַיּ֧וֹם הַשְּׁמִינִ֛י עֲצֶ֖רֶת כַּמִּשְׁפָּֽט׃ {פ}
Translated: He read from the scroll of the Teaching of God each day, from the first to the last day. They celebrated the festival seven days, and there was a solemn gathering on the eighth, as prescribed.
Transliteration: vayikera vesefer tvorat haElohim yvom veyvom min-hayyvom harishvon ad hayyvom haacharvon vayaashu-chag shiveat yamiym uvayyvom hashemiyniy atseret khamishefat {f}

Hebrew: וּבְיוֹם֩ עֶשְׂרִ֨ים וְאַרְבָּעָ֜ה לַחֹ֣דֶשׁ הַזֶּ֗ה נֶאֶסְפ֤וּ בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ בְּצ֣וֹם וּבְשַׂקִּ֔ים וַאֲדָמָ֖ה עֲלֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: On the twenty-fourth day of this month, the Israelites assembled, fasting, in sackcloth, and with earth upon them.
Transliteration: uveyvom esheriym vearevaah lachodesh hazeh neesefu veney-yisherael vetsvom uveshakiym vaadamah aleyhem

Hebrew: וַיִּבָּֽדְלוּ֙ זֶ֣רַע יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל מִכֹּ֖ל בְּנֵ֣י נֵכָ֑ר וַיַּעַמְד֗וּ וַיִּתְוַדּוּ֙ עַל־חַטֹּ֣אתֵיהֶ֔ם וַעֲוֺנ֖וֹת אֲבֹתֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: Those of the stock of Israel separated themselves from all foreigners, and stood and confessed their sins and the iniquities of their fathers.
Transliteration: vayivadelu zera yisherael mikhol veney nekhar vayaamedu vayitevadu al-chatoteyhem vaavonvot avoteyhem

Hebrew: וַיָּק֙וּמוּ֙ עַל־עׇמְדָ֔ם וַֽיִּקְרְא֗וּ בְּסֵ֨פֶר תּוֹרַ֧ת יְהֹוָ֛ה אֱלֹהֵיהֶ֖ם רְבִעִ֣ית הַיּ֑וֹם וּרְבִעִית֙ מִתְוַדִּ֣ים וּמִֽשְׁתַּחֲוִ֔ים לַיהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵיהֶֽם׃ {פ}
Translated: Standing in their places, they read from the scroll of the Teaching of the L<small>ORD</small> their God for one-fourth of the day, and for another fourth they confessed and prostrated themselves before the L<small>ORD</small> their God.
Transliteration: vayakumu al-ׇmedam vayikereu vesefer tvorat yehovah eloheyhem reviiyt hayyvom ureviiyt mitevadiym umishetachaviym layhovah eloheyhem {f}

Hebrew: וַיָּ֜קׇם עַֽל־מַֽעֲלֵ֣ה הַלְוִיִּ֗ם יֵשׁ֨וּעַ וּבָנִ֜י קַדְמִיאֵ֧ל שְׁבַנְיָ֛ה בֻּנִּ֥י שֵׁרֵבְיָ֖ה בָּנִ֣י כְנָ֑נִי וַֽיִּזְעֲקוּ֙ בְּק֣וֹל גָּד֔וֹל אֶל־יְהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: On the raised platform of the Levites stood Jeshua and Bani, Kadmiel, Shebaniah, Bunni, Sherebiah, Bani, and Chenani, and cried in a loud voice to the L<small>ORD</small> their God.
Transliteration: vayakׇm al-maaleh haleviyim eishua uvaniy kademiyel shevaneyah vuniy shereveyah vaniy khenaniy vayizeaku vekvol gadvol el-yehovah eloheyhem

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֣וּ הַלְוִיִּ֡ם יֵשׁ֣וּעַ וְ֠קַדְמִיאֵ֠ל בָּנִ֨י חֲשַׁבְנְיָ֜ה שֵׁרֵֽבְיָ֤ה הֽוֹדִיָּה֙ שְׁבַנְיָ֣ה פְתַֽחְיָ֔ה ק֗וּמוּ בָּרְכוּ֙ אֶת־יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹֽהֵיכֶ֔ם מִן־הָעוֹלָ֖ם עַד־הָעוֹלָ֑ם וִיבָֽרְכוּ֙ שֵׁ֣ם כְּבֹדֶ֔ךָ וּמְרוֹמַ֥ם עַל־כׇּל־בְּרָכָ֖ה וּתְהִלָּֽה׃
Translated: The Levites Jeshua, Kadmiel, Bani, Hashabniah, Sherebiah, Hodiah, Shebaniah, and Pethahiah said, “Rise, bless the L<small>ORD</small> your God who is from eternity to eternity: ‘May Your glorious name be blessed, exalted though it is above every blessing and praise!’
Transliteration: vayomeru haleviyim eishua vekademiyel vaniy chashaveneyah shereveyah hvodiyah shevaneyah fetacheyah kumu varekhu et-yehovah eloheykhem min-havolam ad-havolam viyvarekhu shem khevodekha umervomam al-khׇl-verakhah utehilah

Hebrew: אַתָּה־ה֣וּא יְהֹוָה֮ לְבַדֶּ֒ךָ֒ (את) [אַתָּ֣ה] עָשִׂ֡יתָ אֶֽת־הַשָּׁמַ֩יִם֩ שְׁמֵ֨י הַשָּׁמַ֜יִם וְכׇל־צְבָאָ֗ם הָאָ֜רֶץ וְכׇל־אֲשֶׁ֤ר עָלֶ֙יהָ֙ הַיַּמִּים֙ וְכׇל־אֲשֶׁ֣ר בָּהֶ֔ם וְאַתָּ֖ה מְחַיֶּ֣ה אֶת־כֻּלָּ֑ם וּצְבָ֥א הַשָּׁמַ֖יִם לְךָ֥ מִשְׁתַּחֲוִֽים׃
Translated: “You alone are the L<small>ORD</small>. You made the heavens, the highest heavens, and all their host, the earth and everything upon it, the seas and everything in them. You keep them all alive, and the host of heaven prostrate themselves before You.
Transliteration: atah-hu yehovah levadekha (t) [atah] ashiyta et-hashamayiim shemey hashamayiim vekhׇl-tsevaam haarets vekhׇl-asher aleyha hayamiym vekhׇl-asher vahem veatah mechayeh et-khulam utseva hashamayiim lekha mishetachaviym

Hebrew: אַתָּה־הוּא֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה הָאֱלֹהִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֤ר בָּחַ֙רְתָּ֙ בְּאַבְרָ֔ם וְהוֹצֵאת֖וֹ מֵא֣וּר כַּשְׂדִּ֑ים וְשַׂ֥מְתָּ שְּׁמ֖וֹ אַבְרָהָֽם׃
Translated: You are the L<small>ORD</small> God, who chose Abram, who brought him out of Ur of the Chaldeans and changed his name to Abraham.
Transliteration: atah-hu yehovah haElohim asher vachareta veaveram vehvotsetvo meur khashediym veshameta shemvo averaham

Hebrew: וּמָצָ֣אתָ אֶת־לְבָבוֹ֮ נֶאֱמָ֣ן לְפָנֶ֒יךָ֒ וְכָר֨וֹת עִמּ֜וֹ הַבְּרִ֗ית לָתֵ֡ת אֶת־אֶ֩רֶץ֩ הַכְּנַעֲנִ֨י הַחִתִּ֜י הָאֱמֹרִ֧י וְהַפְּרִזִּ֛י וְהַיְבוּסִ֥י וְהַגִּרְגָּשִׁ֖י לָתֵ֣ת לְזַרְע֑וֹ וַתָּ֙קֶם֙ אֶת־דְּבָרֶ֔יךָ כִּ֥י צַדִּ֖יק אָֽתָּה׃
Translated: Finding his heart true to You, You made a covenant with him to give the land of the Canaanite, the Hittite, the Amorite, the Perizzite, the Jebusite, and the Girgashite—to give it to his descendants. And You kept Your word, for You are righteous.
Transliteration: umatsata et-levavvo neeman lefaneykha vekharvot imvo haveriyt latet et-erets hakhenaaniy hachitiy haemoriy vehaferiziy vehayevusiy vehagiregashiy latet lezarevo vatakem et-devareykha khiy tsadiyk atah

Hebrew: וַתֵּ֛רֶא אֶת־עֳנִ֥י אֲבֹתֵ֖ינוּ בְּמִצְרָ֑יִם וְאֶת־זַעֲקָתָ֥ם שָׁמַ֖עְתָּ עַל־יַם־סֽוּף׃
Translated: You took note of our fathers’ affliction in Egypt, and heard their cry at the Sea of Reeds.
Transliteration: vatere et-oniy avoteynu vemitserayiim veet-zaakatam shamaeta al-yam-suf

Hebrew: וַ֠תִּתֵּ֠ן אֹתֹ֨ת וּמֹֽפְתִ֜ים בְּפַרְעֹ֤ה וּבְכׇל־עֲבָדָיו֙ וּבְכׇל־עַ֣ם אַרְצ֔וֹ כִּ֣י יָדַ֔עְתָּ כִּ֥י הֵזִ֖ידוּ עֲלֵיהֶ֑ם וַתַּֽעַשׂ־לְךָ֥ שֵׁ֖ם כְּהַיּ֥וֹם הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: You performed signs and wonders against Pharaoh, all his servants, and all the people of his land, for You knew that they acted presumptuously toward them. You made a name for Yourself that endures to this day.
Transliteration: vatiten otot umofetiym vefareoh uvekhׇl-avadayv uvekhׇl-am aretsvo khiy yadaeta khiy heziydu aleyhem vataash-lekha shem khehayyvom hazeh

Hebrew: וְהַיָּם֙ בָּקַ֣עְתָּ לִפְנֵיהֶ֔ם וַיַּֽעַבְר֥וּ בְתוֹךְ־הַיָּ֖ם בַּיַּבָּשָׁ֑ה וְֽאֶת־רֹ֨דְפֵיהֶ֜ם הִשְׁלַ֧כְתָּ בִמְצוֹלֹ֛ת כְּמוֹ־אֶ֖בֶן בְּמַ֥יִם עַזִּֽים׃
Translated: You split the sea before them; they passed through the sea on dry land, but You threw their pursuers into the depths, like a stone into the raging waters.
Transliteration: vehayam vakaeta lifeneyhem vayaaveru vetvokhe-hayam vayavashah veet-rodefeyhem hishelakheta vimetsvolot khemvo-even vemayiim aziym

Hebrew: וּבְעַמּ֣וּד עָנָ֔ן הִנְחִיתָ֖ם יוֹמָ֑ם וּבְעַמּ֥וּד אֵשׁ֙ לַ֔יְלָה לְהָאִ֣יר לָהֶ֔ם אֶת־הַדֶּ֖רֶךְ אֲשֶׁ֥ר יֵֽלְכוּ־בָֽהּ׃
Translated: “You led them by day with a pillar of cloud, and by night with a pillar of fire, to give them light in the way they were to go.
Transliteration: uveamud anan hinechiytam yvomam uveamud esh layelah lehaiyr lahem et-haderekhe asher eilekhu-vah

Hebrew: וְעַ֤ל הַר־סִינַי֙ יָרַ֔דְתָּ וְדַבֵּ֥ר עִמָּהֶ֖ם מִשָּׁמָ֑יִם וַתִּתֵּ֨ן לָהֶ֜ם מִשְׁפָּטִ֤ים יְשָׁרִים֙ וְתוֹר֣וֹת אֱמֶ֔ת חֻקִּ֥ים וּמִצְוֺ֖ת טוֹבִֽים׃
Translated: You came down on Mount Sinai and spoke to them from heaven; You gave them right rules and true teachings, good laws and commandments.
Transliteration: veal har-siynay yaradeta vedaver imahem mishamayiim vatiten lahem mishefatiym yeshariym vetvorvot emet chukiym umitsevot tvoviym

Hebrew: וְאֶת־שַׁבַּ֥ת קׇדְשְׁךָ֖ הוֹדַ֣עְתָּ לָהֶ֑ם וּמִצְו֤וֹת וְחֻקִּים֙ וְתוֹרָ֔ה צִוִּ֣יתָ לָהֶ֔ם בְּיַ֖ד מֹשֶׁ֥ה עַבְדֶּֽךָ׃
Translated: You made known to them Your holy sabbath, and You ordained for them laws, commandments and Teaching, through Moses Your servant.
Transliteration: veet-shavat kׇdeshekha hvodaeta lahem umitsevvot vechukiym vetvorah tsiviyta lahem veyad mosheh avedekha

Hebrew: וְ֠לֶ֠חֶם מִשָּׁמַ֜יִם נָתַ֤תָּה לָהֶם֙ לִרְעָבָ֔ם וּמַ֗יִם מִסֶּ֛לַע הוֹצֵ֥אתָ לָהֶ֖ם לִצְמָאָ֑ם וַתֹּ֣אמֶר לָהֶ֗ם לָבוֹא֙ לָרֶ֣שֶׁת אֶת־הָאָ֔רֶץ אֲשֶׁר־נָשָׂ֥אתָ אֶת־יָדְךָ֖ לָתֵ֥ת לָהֶֽם׃
Translated: You gave them bread from heaven when they were hungry, and produced water from a rock when they were thirsty. You told them to go and possess the land that You swore to give them.
Transliteration: velechem mishamayiim natatah lahem lireavam umayiim misela hvotseta lahem litsemaam vatomer lahem lavvo lareshet et-haarets asher-nashata et-yadekha latet lahem

Hebrew: וְהֵ֥ם וַאֲבֹתֵ֖ינוּ הֵזִ֑ידוּ וַיַּקְשׁוּ֙ אֶת־עׇרְפָּ֔ם וְלֹ֥א שָׁמְע֖וּ אֶל־מִצְוֺתֶֽיךָ׃
Translated: But they—our fathers—acted presumptuously; they stiffened their necks and did not obey Your commandments.
Transliteration: vehem vaavoteynu heziydu vayakeshu et-ׇrefam velo shameu el-mitsevoteykha

Hebrew: וַיְמָאֲנ֣וּ לִשְׁמֹ֗עַ וְלֹא־זָכְר֤וּ נִפְלְאֹתֶ֙יךָ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָשִׂ֣יתָ עִמָּהֶ֔ם וַיַּקְשׁוּ֙ אֶת־עׇרְפָּ֔ם וַיִּתְּנוּ־רֹ֛אשׁ לָשׁ֥וּב לְעַבְדֻתָ֖ם בְּמִרְיָ֑ם וְאַתָּה֩ אֱל֨וֹהַּ סְלִיח֜וֹת חַנּ֧וּן וְרַח֛וּם אֶֽרֶךְ־אַפַּ֥יִם וְרַב־[חֶ֖סֶד] (וחסד) וְלֹ֥א עֲזַבְתָּֽם׃
Translated: Refusing to obey, unmindful of Your wonders that You did for them, they stiffened their necks, and in their defiance resolved to return to their slavery. But You, being a forgiving God, gracious and compassionate, long-suffering and abounding in faithfulness, did not abandon them.
Transliteration: vayemaanu lishemoa velo-zakheru nifeleoteykha asher ashiyta imahem vayakeshu et-ׇrefam vayitenu-rosh lashuv leavedutam vemireyam veatah elvoha seliychvot chanun verachum erekhe-afayiim verav-[chesed] (vchsd) velo azavetam

Hebrew: אַ֗ף כִּֽי־עָשׂ֤וּ לָהֶם֙ עֵ֣גֶל מַסֵּכָ֔ה וַיֹּ֣אמְר֔וּ זֶ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ אֲשֶׁ֥ר הֶעֶלְךָ֖ מִמִּצְרָ֑יִם וַֽיַּעֲשׂ֔וּ נֶאָצ֖וֹת גְּדֹלֽוֹת׃
Translated: Even though they made themselves a molten calf and said, ‘This is your God who brought you out of Egypt,’ thus committing great impieties,
Transliteration: af khiy-ashu lahem egel masekhah vayomeru zeh eloheykha asher heelekha mimitserayiim vayaashu neatsvot gedolvot

Hebrew: וְאַתָּה֙ בְּרַחֲמֶ֣יךָ הָֽרַבִּ֔ים לֹ֥א עֲזַבְתָּ֖ם בַּמִּדְבָּ֑ר אֶת־עַמּ֣וּד הֶ֠עָנָ֠ן לֹא־סָ֨ר מֵעֲלֵיהֶ֤ם בְּיוֹמָם֙ לְהַנְחֹתָ֣ם בְּהַדֶּ֔רֶךְ וְאֶת־עַמּ֨וּד הָאֵ֤שׁ בְּלַ֙יְלָה֙ לְהָאִ֣יר לָהֶ֔ם וְאֶת־הַדֶּ֖רֶךְ אֲשֶׁ֥ר יֵֽלְכוּ־בָֽהּ׃
Translated: You, in Your abundant compassion, did not abandon them in the wilderness. The pillar of cloud did not depart from them to lead them on the way by day, nor the pillar of fire by night to give them light in the way they were to go.
Transliteration: veatah verachameykha haraviym lo azavetam vamidevar et-amud heanan lo-sar mealeyhem veyvomam lehanechotam vehaderekhe veet-amud haesh velayelah lehaiyr lahem veet-haderekhe asher eilekhu-vah

Hebrew: וְרוּחֲךָ֙ הַטּוֹבָ֔ה נָתַ֖תָּ לְהַשְׂכִּילָ֑ם וּמַנְךָ֙ לֹא־מָנַ֣עְתָּ מִפִּיהֶ֔ם וּמַ֛יִם נָתַ֥תָּה לָהֶ֖ם לִצְמָאָֽם׃
Translated: You endowed them with Your good spirit to instruct them. You did not withhold Your manna from their mouth; You gave them water when they were thirsty.
Transliteration: veruchakha hatvovah natata lehashekhiylam umanekha lo-manaeta mifiyhem umayiim natatah lahem litsemaam

Hebrew: וְאַרְבָּעִ֥ים שָׁנָ֛ה כִּלְכַּלְתָּ֥ם בַּמִּדְבָּ֖ר לֹ֣א חָסֵ֑רוּ שַׂלְמֹֽתֵיהֶם֙ לֹ֣א בָל֔וּ וְרַגְלֵיהֶ֖ם לֹ֥א בָצֵֽקוּ׃
Translated: Forty years You sustained them in the wilderness so that they lacked nothing; their clothes did not wear out, and their feet did not swell.
Transliteration: vearevaiym shanah khilekhaletam vamidevar lo chaseru shalemoteyhem lo valu verageleyhem lo vatseku

Hebrew: וַתִּתֵּ֨ן לָהֶ֤ם מַמְלָכוֹת֙ וַעֲמָמִ֔ים וַֽתַּחְלְקֵ֖ם לְפֵאָ֑ה וַיִּֽירְשׁ֞וּ אֶת־אֶ֣רֶץ סִיח֗וֹן וְאֶת־אֶ֙רֶץ֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ חֶשְׁבּ֔וֹן וְאֶת־אֶ֖רֶץ ע֥וֹג מֶֽלֶךְ־הַבָּשָֽׁן׃
Translated: “You gave them kingdoms and peoples, and allotted them territory. They took possession of the land of Sihon, the land of the king of Heshbon, and the land of Og, king of Bashan.
Transliteration: vatiten lahem mamelakhvot vaamamiym vatachelekem lefeah vayiyreshu et-erets siychvon veet-erets melekhe cheshevvon veet-erets vog melekhe-havashan

Hebrew: וּבְנֵיהֶ֣ם הִרְבִּ֔יתָ כְּכֹכְבֵ֖י הַשָּׁמָ֑יִם וַתְּבִיאֵם֙ אֶל־הָאָ֔רֶץ אֲשֶׁר־אָמַ֥רְתָּ לַאֲבֹתֵיהֶ֖ם לָב֥וֹא לָרָֽשֶׁת׃
Translated: You made their children as numerous as the stars of heaven, and brought them to the land which You told their fathers to go and possess.
Transliteration: uveneyhem hireviyta khekhokhevey hashamayiim vateviyem el-haarets asher-amareta laavoteyhem lavvo larashet

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֤אוּ הַבָּנִים֙ וַיִּֽירְשׁ֣וּ אֶת־הָאָ֔רֶץ וַתַּכְנַ֨ע לִפְנֵיהֶ֜ם אֶת־יֹשְׁבֵ֤י הָאָ֙רֶץ֙ הַכְּנַ֣עֲנִ֔ים וַֽתִּתְּנֵ֖ם בְּיָדָ֑ם וְאֶת־מַלְכֵיהֶם֙ וְאֶת־עַֽמְמֵ֣י הָאָ֔רֶץ לַעֲשׂ֥וֹת בָּהֶ֖ם כִּרְצוֹנָֽם׃
Translated: The sons came and took possession of the land: You subdued the Canaanite inhabitants of the land before them; You delivered them into their power, both their kings and the peoples of the land, to do with them as they pleased.
Transliteration: vayavou havaniym vayiyreshu et-haarets vatakhena lifeneyhem et-yoshevey haarets hakhenaaniym vatitenem veyadam veet-malekheyhem veet-amemey haarets laashvot vahem khiretsvonam

Hebrew: וַֽיִּלְכְּד֞וּ עָרִ֣ים בְּצוּרֹת֮ וַאֲדָמָ֣ה שְׁמֵנָה֒ וַיִּֽירְשׁ֡וּ בָּתִּ֣ים מְלֵֽאִים־כׇּל־ט֠וּב בֹּר֨וֹת חֲצוּבִ֜ים כְּרָמִ֧ים וְזֵיתִ֛ים וְעֵ֥ץ מַאֲכָ֖ל לָרֹ֑ב וַיֹּאכְל֤וּ וַֽיִּשְׂבְּעוּ֙ וַיַּשְׁמִ֔ינוּ וַיִּֽתְעַדְּנ֖וּ בְּטוּבְךָ֥ הַגָּדֽוֹל׃
Translated: They captured fortified cities and rich lands; they took possession of houses filled with every good thing, of hewn cisterns, vineyards, olive trees, and fruit trees in abundance. They ate, they were filled, they grew fat; they luxuriated in Your great bounty.
Transliteration: vayilekhedu ariym vetsurot vaadamah shemenah vayiyreshu vatiym meleiym-khׇl-tuv vorvot chatsuviym kheramiym vezeytiym veets maakhal larov vayokhelu vayisheveu vayashemiynu vayiteadenu vetuvekha hagadvol

Hebrew: וַיַּמְר֨וּ וַֽיִּמְרְד֜וּ בָּ֗ךְ וַיַּשְׁלִ֤כוּ אֶת־תּוֹרָֽתְךָ֙ אַחֲרֵ֣י גַוָּ֔ם וְאֶת־נְבִיאֶ֣יךָ הָרָ֔גוּ אֲשֶׁר־הֵעִ֥ידוּ בָ֖ם לַהֲשִׁיבָ֣ם אֵלֶ֑יךָ וַֽיַּעֲשׂ֔וּ נֶאָצ֖וֹת גְּדוֹלֹֽת׃
Translated: Then, defying You, they rebelled; they cast Your Teaching behind their back. They killed Your prophets who admonished them to turn them back to You; they committed great impieties.
Transliteration: vayameru vayimeredu vakhe vayashelikhu et-tvoratekha acharey gavam veet-neviyeykha haragu asher-heiydu vam lahashiyvam eleykha vayaashu neatsvot gedvolot

Hebrew: וַֽתִּתְּנֵם֙ בְּיַ֣ד צָֽרֵיהֶ֔ם וַיָּצֵ֖רוּ לָהֶ֑ם וּבְעֵ֤ת צָֽרָתָם֙ יִצְעֲק֣וּ אֵלֶ֔יךָ וְאַתָּה֙ מִשָּׁמַ֣יִם תִּשְׁמָ֔ע וּֽכְרַחֲמֶ֣יךָ הָֽרַבִּ֗ים תִּתֵּ֤ן לָהֶם֙ מֽוֹשִׁיעִ֔ים וְיוֹשִׁיע֖וּם מִיַּ֥ד צָרֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: “You delivered them into the power of their adversaries who oppressed them. In their time of trouble they cried to You; You in heaven heard them, and in Your abundant compassion gave them saviors who saved them from the power of their adversaries.
Transliteration: vatitenem veyad tsareyhem vayatseru lahem uveet tsaratam yitseaku eleykha veatah mishamayiim tishema ukherachameykha haraviym titen lahem mvoshiyiym veyvoshiyum miyad tsareyhem

Hebrew: וּכְנ֣וֹחַ לָהֶ֔ם יָשׁ֕וּבוּ לַעֲשׂ֥וֹת רַ֖ע לְפָנֶ֑יךָ וַתַּֽעַזְבֵ֞ם בְּיַ֤ד אֹֽיְבֵיהֶם֙ וַיִּרְדּ֣וּ בָהֶ֔ם וַיָּשׁ֙וּבוּ֙ וַיִּזְעָק֔וּךָ וְאַתָּ֞ה מִשָּׁמַ֧יִם תִּשְׁמַ֛ע וְתַצִּילֵ֥ם כְּֽרַחֲמֶ֖יךָ רַבּ֥וֹת עִתִּֽים׃
Translated: But when they had relief, they again did what was evil in Your sight, so You abandoned them to the power of their enemies, who subjugated them. Again they cried to You, and You in heaven heard and rescued them in Your compassion, time after time.
Transliteration: ukhenvocha lahem yashuvu laashvot ra lefaneykha vataazevem veyad oyeveyhem vayiredu vahem vayashuvu vayizeakukha veatah mishamayiim tishema vetatsiylem kherachameykha ravvot itiym

Hebrew: וַתָּ֨עַד בָּהֶ֜ם לַהֲשִׁיבָ֣ם אֶל־תּוֹרָתֶ֗ךָ וְהֵ֨מָּה הֵזִ֜ידוּ וְלֹא־שָׁמְע֤וּ לְמִצְוֺתֶ֙יךָ֙ וּבְמִשְׁפָּטֶ֣יךָ חָֽטְאוּ־בָ֔ם אֲשֶׁר־יַעֲשֶׂ֥ה אָדָ֖ם וְחָיָ֣ה בָהֶ֑ם וַיִּתְּנ֤וּ כָתֵף֙ סוֹרֶ֔רֶת וְעׇרְפָּ֥ם הִקְשׁ֖וּ וְלֹ֥א שָׁמֵֽעוּ׃
Translated: You admonished them in order to turn them back to Your Teaching, but they acted presumptuously and disobeyed Your commandments, and sinned against Your rules, by following which a man shall live. They turned a defiant shoulder, stiffened their neck, and would not obey.
Transliteration: vataad vahem lahashiyvam el-tvoratekha vehemah heziydu velo-shameu lemitsevoteykha uvemishefateykha chateu-vam asher-yaasheh adam vechayah vahem vayitenu khatef svoreret veׇrefam hikeshu velo shameu

Hebrew: וַתִּמְשֹׁ֤ךְ עֲלֵיהֶם֙ שָׁנִ֣ים רַבּ֔וֹת וַתָּ֨עַד בָּ֧ם בְּרוּחֲךָ֛ בְּיַד־נְבִיאֶ֖יךָ וְלֹ֣א הֶאֱזִ֑ינוּ וַֽתִּתְּנֵ֔ם בְּיַ֖ד עַמֵּ֥י הָאֲרָצֹֽת׃
Translated: You bore with them for many years, admonished them by Your spirit through Your prophets, but they would not give ear, so You delivered them into the power of the peoples of the lands.
Transliteration: vatimeshokhe aleyhem shaniym ravvot vataad vam veruchakha veyad-neviyeykha velo heeziynu vatitenem veyad amey haaratsot

Hebrew: וּֽבְרַחֲמֶ֧יךָ הָרַבִּ֛ים לֹֽא־עֲשִׂיתָ֥ם כָּלָ֖ה וְלֹ֣א עֲזַבְתָּ֑ם כִּ֛י אֵֽל־חַנּ֥וּן וְרַח֖וּם אָֽתָּה׃
Translated: Still, in Your great compassion You did not make an end of them or abandon them, for You are a gracious and compassionate God.
Transliteration: uverachameykha haraviym lo-ashiytam khalah velo azavetam khiy el-chanun verachum atah

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֣ה אֱ֠לֹהֵ֠ינוּ הָאֵ֨ל הַגָּד֜וֹל הַגִּבּ֣וֹר וְהַנּוֹרָא֮ שׁוֹמֵ֣ר הַבְּרִ֣ית וְהַחֶ֒סֶד֒ אַל־יִמְעַ֣ט לְפָנֶ֡יךָ אֵ֣ת כׇּל־הַתְּלָאָ֣ה אֲֽשֶׁר־מְ֠צָאַ֠תְנוּ לִמְלָכֵ֨ינוּ לְשָׂרֵ֧ינוּ וּלְכֹהֲנֵ֛ינוּ וְלִנְבִיאֵ֥ינוּ וְלַאֲבֹתֵ֖ינוּ וּלְכׇל־עַמֶּ֑ךָ מִימֵי֙ מַלְכֵ֣י אַשּׁ֔וּר עַ֖ד הַיּ֥וֹם הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: “And now, our God, great, mighty, and awesome God, who stays faithful to His covenant, do not treat lightly all the suffering that has overtaken us—our kings, our officers, our priests, our prophets, our fathers, and all Your people—from the time of the Assyrian kings to this day.
Transliteration: veatah eloheynu hael hagadvol hagivvor vehanvora shvomer haveriyt vehachesed al-yimeat lefaneykha et khׇl-hatelaah asher-metsaatenu limelakheynu leshareynu ulekhohaneynu velineviyeynu velaavoteynu ulekhׇl-amekha miymey malekhey ashur ad hayyvom hazeh

Hebrew: וְאַתָּ֣ה צַדִּ֔יק עַ֖ל כׇּל־הַבָּ֣א עָלֵ֑ינוּ כִּֽי־אֱמֶ֥ת עָשִׂ֖יתָ וַאֲנַ֥חְנוּ הִרְשָֽׁעְנוּ׃
Translated: Surely You are in the right with respect to all that has come upon us, for You have acted faithfully, and we have been wicked.
Transliteration: veatah tsadiyk al khׇl-hava aleynu khiy-emet ashiyta vaanachenu hireshaenu

Hebrew: וְאֶת־מְלָכֵ֤ינוּ שָׂרֵ֙ינוּ֙ כֹּהֲנֵ֣ינוּ וַאֲבֹתֵ֔ינוּ לֹ֥א עָשׂ֖וּ תּוֹרָתֶ֑ךָ וְלֹ֤א הִקְשִׁ֙יבוּ֙ אֶל־מִצְוֺתֶ֔יךָ וּלְעֵ֣דְוֺתֶ֔יךָ אֲשֶׁ֥ר הַעִידֹ֖תָ בָּהֶֽם׃
Translated: Our kings, officers, priests, and fathers did not follow Your Teaching, and did not listen to Your commandments or to the warnings that You gave them.
Transliteration: veet-melakheynu shareynu khohaneynu vaavoteynu lo ashu tvoratekha velo hikeshiyvu el-mitsevoteykha uleedevoteykha asher haiydota vahem

Hebrew: וְהֵ֣ם בְּמַלְכוּתָם֩ וּבְטוּבְךָ֨ הָרָ֜ב אֲשֶׁר־נָתַ֣תָּ לָהֶ֗ם וּבְאֶ֨רֶץ הָרְחָבָ֧ה וְהַשְּׁמֵנָ֛ה אֲשֶׁר־נָתַ֥תָּ לִפְנֵיהֶ֖ם לֹ֣א עֲבָד֑וּךָ וְֽלֹא־שָׁ֔בוּ מִמַּֽעַלְלֵיהֶ֖ם הָרָעִֽים׃
Translated: When they had their own kings and enjoyed the good that You lavished upon them, and the broad and rich land that You put at their disposal, they would not serve You, and did not turn from their wicked deeds.
Transliteration: vehem vemalekhutam uvetuvekha harav asher-natata lahem uveerets harechavah vehashemenah asher-natata lifeneyhem lo avadukha velo-shavu mimaaleleyhem haraiym

Hebrew: הִנֵּ֛ה אֲנַ֥חְנוּ הַיּ֖וֹם עֲבָדִ֑ים וְהָאָ֜רֶץ אֲשֶׁר־נָתַ֣תָּה לַאֲבֹתֵ֗ינוּ לֶאֱכֹ֤ל אֶת־פִּרְיָהּ֙ וְאֶת־טוּבָ֔הּ הִנֵּ֛ה אֲנַ֥חְנוּ עֲבָדִ֖ים עָלֶֽיהָ׃
Translated: Today we are slaves, and the land that You gave our fathers to enjoy its fruit and bounty—here we are slaves on it!
Transliteration: hineh anachenu hayyvom avadiym vehaarets asher-natatah laavoteynu leekhol et-fireyah veet-tuvah hineh anachenu avadiym aleyha

Hebrew: וּתְבוּאָתָ֣הּ מַרְבָּ֗ה לַמְּלָכִ֛ים אֲשֶׁר־נָתַ֥תָּה עָלֵ֖ינוּ בְּחַטֹּאותֵ֑ינוּ וְעַ֣ל גְּ֠וִיֹּתֵ֠ינוּ מֹשְׁלִ֤ים וּבִבְהֶמְתֵּ֙נוּ֙ כִּרְצוֹנָ֔ם וּבְצָרָ֥ה גְדֹלָ֖ה אֲנָֽחְנוּ׃ {פ}
Translated: On account of our sins it yields its abundant crops to kings whom You have set over us. They rule over our bodies and our beasts as they please, and we are in great distress.
Transliteration: utevuatah marevah lamelakhiym asher-natatah aleynu vechatovteynu veal geviyoteynu mosheliym uvivehemetenu khiretsvonam uvetsarah gedolah anachenu {f}

Hebrew: וּבְכׇל־זֹ֕את אֲנַ֛חְנוּ כֹּרְתִ֥ים אֲמָנָ֖ה וְכֹתְבִ֑ים וְעַל֙ הֶֽחָת֔וּם שָׂרֵ֥ינוּ לְוִיֵּ֖נוּ כֹּהֲנֵֽינוּ׃
Translated: “In view of all this, we make this pledge and put it in writing; and on the sealed copy [are subscribed] our officials, our Levites, and our priests.
Transliteration: uvekhׇl-zot anachenu khoretiym amanah vekhoteviym veal hechatum shareynu leviyenu khohaneynu

Hebrew: וְעַ֖ל הַחֲתוּמִ֑ים נְחֶמְיָ֧ה הַתִּרְשָׁ֛תָא בֶּן־חֲכַלְיָ֖ה וְצִדְקִיָּֽה׃
Translated: “On the sealed copy [are subscribed]: Nehemiah the Tirshatha son of Hacaliah and Zedekiah,
Transliteration: veal hachatumiym nechemeyah hatireshata ven-chakhaleyah vetsidekiyah

Hebrew: שְׂרָיָ֥ה עֲזַרְיָ֖ה יִרְמְיָֽה׃
Translated: Seraiah, Azariah, Jeremiah,
Transliteration: sherayah azareyah yiremeyah

Hebrew: פַּשְׁח֥וּר אֲמַרְיָ֖ה מַלְכִּיָּֽה׃
Translated: Pashhur, Amariah, Malchijah,
Transliteration: fashechur amareyah malekhiyah

Hebrew: חַטּ֥וּשׁ שְׁבַנְיָ֖ה מַלּֽוּךְ׃
Translated: Hattush, Shebaniah, Malluch,
Transliteration: chatush shevaneyah malukhe

Hebrew: חָרִ֥ם מְרֵמ֖וֹת עֹֽבַדְיָֽה׃
Translated: Harim, Meremoth, Obadiah,
Transliteration: charim meremvot ovadeyah

Hebrew: דָּנִיֵּ֥אל גִּנְּת֖וֹן בָּרֽוּךְ׃
Translated: Daniel, Ginnethon, Baruch,
Transliteration: daniyel ginetvon varukhe

Hebrew: מְשֻׁלָּ֥ם אֲבִיָּ֖ה מִיָּמִֽן׃
Translated: Meshullam, Abijah, Mijamin,
Transliteration: meshulam aviyah miyamin

Hebrew: מַֽעַזְיָ֥ה בִלְגַּ֖י שְׁמַֽעְיָ֑ה אֵ֖לֶּה הַכֹּהֲנִֽים׃
Translated: Maaziah, Bilgai, Shemaiah; these are the priests.
Transliteration: maazeyah vilegay shemaeyah eleh hakhohaniym

Hebrew: וְֽהַלְוִיִּ֑ם וְיֵשׁ֙וּעַ֙ בֶּן־אֲזַנְיָ֔ה בִּנּ֕וּי מִבְּנֵ֥י חֵנָדָ֖ד קַדְמִיאֵֽל׃
Translated: “And the Levites: Jeshua son of Azaniah, Binnui of the sons of Henadad, and Kadmiel.
Transliteration: vehaleviyim veeishua ven-azaneyah vinuy miveney chenadad kademiyel

Hebrew: וַאֲחֵיהֶ֑ם שְׁבַנְיָ֧ה הֽוֹדִיָּ֛ה קְלִיטָ֖א פְּלָאיָ֥ה חָנָֽן׃
Translated: And their brothers: Shebaniah, Hodiah, Kelita, Pelaiah, Hanan,
Transliteration: vaacheyhem shevaneyah hvodiyah keliyta felayah chanan

Hebrew: מִיכָ֥א רְח֖וֹב חֲשַׁבְיָֽה׃
Translated: Mica, Rehob, Hashabiah,
Transliteration: miykha rechvov chashaveyah

Hebrew: זַכּ֥וּר שֵׁרֵֽבְיָ֖ה שְׁבַנְיָֽה׃
Translated: Zaccur, Sherebiah, Shebaniah,
Transliteration: zakhur shereveyah shevaneyah

Hebrew: הוֹדִיָּ֥ה בָנִ֖י בְּנִֽינוּ׃ {ס}
Translated: Hodiah, Bani, and Beninu.
Transliteration: hvodiyah vaniy veniynu {s}

Hebrew: רָאשֵׁ֖י הָעָ֑ם פַּרְעֹשׁ֙ פַּחַ֣ת מוֹאָ֔ב עֵילָ֥ם זַתּ֖וּא בָּנִֽי׃
Translated: “The heads of the people: Parosh, Pahath-moab, Elam, Zattu, Bani,
Transliteration: rashey haam fareosh fachat mvoav eylam zatu vaniy

Hebrew: בֻּנִּ֥י עַזְגָּ֖ד בֵּבָֽי׃
Translated: Bunni, Azgad, Bebai,
Transliteration: vuniy azegad vevay

Hebrew: אֲדֹנִיָּ֥ה בִגְוַ֖י עָדִֽין׃
Translated: Adonijah, Bigvai, Adin,
Transliteration: adoniyah vigevay adiyn

Hebrew: אָטֵ֥ר חִזְקִיָּ֖ה עַזּֽוּר׃
Translated: Ater, Hezekiah, Azzur,
Transliteration: ater chizekiyah azur

Hebrew: הוֹדִיָּ֥ה חָשֻׁ֖ם בֵּצָֽי׃
Translated: Hodiah, Hashum, Bezai,
Transliteration: hvodiyah chashum vetsay

Hebrew: חָרִ֥יף עֲנָת֖וֹת (נובי) [נֵיבָֽי]׃
Translated: Hariph, Anathoth, Nebai,
Transliteration: chariyf anatvot (nvvy) [neyvay]

Hebrew: מַגְפִּיעָ֥שׁ מְשֻׁלָּ֖ם חֵזִֽיר׃
Translated: Magpiash, Meshullam, Hezir,
Transliteration: magefiyash meshulam cheziyr

Hebrew: מְשֵׁיזַבְאֵ֥ל צָד֖וֹק יַדּֽוּעַ׃
Translated: Meshezabel, Zadok, Jaddua,
Transliteration: mesheyzaveel tsadvok yadua

Hebrew: פְּלַטְיָ֥ה חָנָ֖ן עֲנָיָֽה׃
Translated: Pelatiah, Hanan, Anaiah,
Transliteration: felateyah chanan anayah

Hebrew: הוֹשֵׁ֥עַ חֲנַנְיָ֖ה חַשּֽׁוּב׃
Translated: Hoshea, Hananiah, Hasshub,
Transliteration: hvoshea chananeyah chashuv

Hebrew: הַלּוֹחֵ֥שׁ פִּלְחָ֖א שׁוֹבֵֽק׃
Translated: Hallohesh, Pilha, Shobek,
Transliteration: halvochesh filecha shvovek

Hebrew: רְח֥וּם חֲשַׁבְנָ֖ה מַעֲשֵׂיָֽה׃
Translated: Rehum, Hashabnah, Maaseiah,
Transliteration: rechum chashavenah maasheyah

Hebrew: וַאֲחִיָּ֥ה חָנָ֖ן עָנָֽן׃
Translated: and Ahiah, Hanan, Anan,
Transliteration: vaachiyah chanan anan

Hebrew: מַלּ֥וּךְ חָרִ֖ם בַּעֲנָֽה׃
Translated: Malluch, Harim, Baanah.
Transliteration: malukhe charim vaanah

Hebrew: וּשְׁאָ֣ר הָעָ֡ם הַכֹּהֲנִ֣ים הַ֠לְוִיִּ֠ם הַשּׁוֹעֲרִ֨ים הַמְשֹׁרְרִ֜ים הַנְּתִינִ֗ים וְֽכׇל־הַנִּבְדָּ֞ל מֵעַמֵּ֤י הָאֲרָצוֹת֙ אֶל־תּוֹרַ֣ת הָאֱלֹהִ֔ים נְשֵׁיהֶ֖ם בְּנֵיהֶ֣ם וּבְנֹתֵיהֶ֑ם כֹּ֖ל יוֹדֵ֥עַ מֵבִֽין׃
Translated: “And the rest of the people, the priests, the Levites, the gatekeepers, the singers, the temple servants, and all who separated themselves from the peoples of the lands to [follow] the Teaching of God, their wives, sons and daughters, all who know enough to understand,
Transliteration: ushear haam hakhohaniym haleviyim hashvoariym hameshoreriym hanetiyniym vekhׇl-hanivedal meamey haaratsvot el-tvorat haElohim nesheyhem veneyhem uvenoteyhem khol yvodea meviyn

Hebrew: מַחֲזִיקִ֣ים עַל־אֲחֵיהֶם֮ אַדִּירֵיהֶם֒ וּבָאִ֞ים בְּאָלָ֣ה וּבִשְׁבוּעָ֗ה לָלֶ֙כֶת֙ בְּתוֹרַ֣ת הָאֱלֹהִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֣ר נִתְּנָ֔ה בְּיַ֖ד מֹשֶׁ֣ה עֶֽבֶד־הָֽאֱלֹהִ֑ים וְלִשְׁמ֣וֹר וְלַעֲשׂ֗וֹת אֶת־כׇּל־מִצְוֺת֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֲדֹנֵ֔ינוּ וּמִשְׁפָּטָ֖יו וְחֻקָּֽיו׃
Translated: join with their noble brothers, and take an oath with sanctions to follow the Teaching of God, given through Moses the servant of God, and to observe carefully all the commandments of the L<small>ORD</small> our Lord, His rules and laws.
Transliteration: machaziykiym al-acheyhem adiyreyhem uvaiym vealah uvishevuah lalekhet vetvorat haElohim asher nitenah veyad mosheh eved-haElohimm velishemvor velaashvot et-khׇl-mitsevot yehovah adoneynu umishefatayv vechukayv

Hebrew: וַאֲשֶׁ֛ר לֹא־נִתֵּ֥ן בְּנֹתֵ֖ינוּ לְעַמֵּ֣י הָאָ֑רֶץ וְאֶת־בְּנֹ֣תֵיהֶ֔ם לֹ֥א נִקַּ֖ח לְבָנֵֽינוּ׃
Translated: “Namely: We will not give our daughters in marriage to the peoples of the land, or take their daughters for our sons.
Transliteration: vaasher lo-niten venoteynu leamey haarets veet-venoteyhem lo nikach levaneynu

Hebrew: וְעַמֵּ֣י הָאָ֡רֶץ הַֽמְבִיאִים֩ אֶת־הַמַּקָּח֨וֹת וְכׇל־שֶׁ֜בֶר בְּי֤וֹם הַשַּׁבָּת֙ לִמְכּ֔וֹר לֹא־נִקַּ֥ח מֵהֶ֛ם בַּשַּׁבָּ֖ת וּבְי֣וֹם קֹ֑דֶשׁ וְנִטֹּ֛שׁ אֶת־הַשָּׁנָ֥ה הַשְּׁבִיעִ֖ית וּמַשָּׁ֥א כׇל־יָֽד׃
Translated:
“The peoples of the land who bring their wares and all sorts of foodstuff for sale on the sabbath day—we will not buy from them on the sabbath or a holy day.
“We will forgo [the produce of] the seventh year, and every outstanding debt.
Transliteration: veamey haarets hameviyiym et-hamakachvot vekhׇl-shever veyvom hashavat limekhvor lo-nikach mehem vashavat uveyvom kodesh venitosh et-hashanah hasheviyiyt umasha khׇl-yad

Hebrew: וְהֶעֱמַ֤דְנוּ עָלֵ֙ינוּ֙ מִצְוֺ֔ת לָתֵ֥ת עָלֵ֛ינוּ שְׁלִישִׁ֥ית הַשֶּׁ֖קֶל בַּשָּׁנָ֑ה לַעֲבֹדַ֖ת בֵּ֥ית אֱלֹהֵֽינוּ׃
Translated: “We have laid upon ourselves obligations: To charge ourselves one-third of a shekel yearly for the service of the House of our God—
Transliteration: veheemadenu aleynu mitsevot latet aleynu sheliyshiyt hashekel vashanah laavodat veyt eloheynu

Hebrew: לְלֶ֣חֶם הַֽמַּעֲרֶ֡כֶת וּמִנְחַ֣ת הַתָּמִ֣יד וּלְעוֹלַ֣ת הַ֠תָּמִ֠יד הַשַּׁבָּת֨וֹת הֶחֳדָשִׁ֜ים לַמּוֹעֲדִ֗ים וְלַקֳּדָשִׁים֙ וְלַ֣חַטָּא֔וֹת לְכַפֵּ֖ר עַל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וְכֹ֖ל מְלֶ֥אכֶת בֵּית־אֱלֹהֵֽינוּ׃ {ס}
Translated: for the rows of bread, for the regular meal offering and for the regular burnt offering, [for those of the] sabbaths, new moons, festivals, for consecrations, for sin offerings to atone for Israel, and for all the work in the House of our God.
Transliteration: lelechem hamaarekhet uminechat hatamiyd ulevolat hatamiyd hashavatvot hechodashiym lamvoadiym velakodashiym velachatavot lekhafer al-yisherael vekhol melekhet veyt-eloheynu {s}

Hebrew: וְהַגּוֹרָל֨וֹת הִפַּ֜לְנוּ עַל־קֻרְבַּ֣ן הָעֵצִ֗ים הַכֹּהֲנִ֣ים הַלְוִיִּם֮ וְהָעָם֒ לְ֠הָבִ֠יא לְבֵ֨ית אֱלֹהֵ֧ינוּ לְבֵית־אֲבֹתֵ֛ינוּ לְעִתִּ֥ים מְזֻמָּנִ֖ים שָׁנָ֣ה בְשָׁנָ֑ה לְבַעֵ֗ר עַל־מִזְבַּח֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֵ֔ינוּ כַּכָּת֖וּב בַּתּוֹרָֽה׃
Translated: “We have cast lots [among] the priests, the Levites, and the people, to bring the wood offering to the House of our God by clans annually at set times in order to provide fuel for the altar of the L<small>ORD</small> our God, as is written in the Teaching.
Transliteration: vehagvoralvot hifalenu al-kurevan haetsiym hakhohaniym haleviyim vehaam lehaviy leveyt eloheynu leveyt-avoteynu leitiym mezumaniym shanah veshanah levaer al-mizevach yehovah eloheynu khakhatuv vatvorah

Hebrew: וּלְהָבִ֞יא אֶת־בִּכּוּרֵ֣י אַדְמָתֵ֗נוּ וּבִכּוּרֵ֛י כׇּל־פְּרִ֥י כׇל־עֵ֖ץ שָׁנָ֣ה בְשָׁנָ֑ה לְבֵ֖ית יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: “And [we undertake] to bring to the House of the L<small>ORD</small> annually the first fruits of our soil, and of every fruit of every tree;
Transliteration: ulehaviy et-vikhurey adematenu uvikhurey khׇl-feriy khׇl-ets shanah veshanah leveyt yehovah

Hebrew: וְאֶת־בְּכֹר֤וֹת בָּנֵ֙ינוּ֙ וּבְהֶמְתֵּ֔נוּ כַּכָּת֖וּב בַּתּוֹרָ֑ה וְאֶת־בְּכוֹרֵ֨י בְקָרֵ֜ינוּ וְצֹאנֵ֗ינוּ לְהָבִיא֙ לְבֵ֣ית אֱלֹהֵ֔ינוּ לַכֹּ֣הֲנִ֔ים הַמְשָׁרְתִ֖ים בְּבֵ֥ית אֱלֹהֵֽינוּ׃
Translated: also, the first-born of our sons and our beasts, as is written in the Teaching; and to bring the firstlings of our cattle and flocks to the House of our God for the priests who minister in the House of our God.
Transliteration: veet-vekhorvot vaneynu uvehemetenu khakhatuv vatvorah veet-vekhvorey vekareynu vetsoneynu lehaviy leveyt eloheynu lakhohaniym hamesharetiym veveyt eloheynu

Hebrew: וְאֶת־רֵאשִׁ֣ית עֲרִיסֹתֵ֣ינוּ וּ֠תְרוּמֹתֵ֠ינוּ וּפְרִ֨י כׇל־עֵ֜ץ תִּיר֣וֹשׁ וְיִצְהָ֗ר נָבִ֤יא לַכֹּהֲנִים֙ אֶל־לִשְׁכ֣וֹת בֵּית־אֱלֹהֵ֔ינוּ וּמַעְשַׂ֥ר אַדְמָתֵ֖נוּ לַלְוִיִּ֑ם וְהֵם֙ הַלְוִיִּ֔ם הַֽמְעַשְּׂרִ֔ים בְּכֹ֖ל עָרֵ֥י עֲבֹדָתֵֽנוּ׃
Translated: “We will bring to the storerooms of the House of our God the first part of our dough, and our gifts [of grain], and of the fruit of every tree, wine and oil for the priests, and the tithes of our land for the Levites—the Levites who collect the tithe in all our towns subject to royal service.
Transliteration: veet-reshiyt ariysoteynu uterumoteynu uferiy khׇl-ets tiyrvosh veyitsehar naviy lakhohaniym el-lishekhvot veyt-eloheynu umaeshar adematenu laleviyim vehem haleviyim hameasheriym vekhol arey avodatenu

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֨ה הַכֹּהֵ֧ן בֶּֽן־אַהֲרֹ֛ן עִם־הַלְוִיִּ֖ם בַּעְשֵׂ֣ר הַלְוִיִּ֑ם וְהַלְוִיִּ֞ם יַעֲל֨וּ אֶת־מַעֲשַׂ֤ר הַֽמַּעֲשֵׂר֙ לְבֵ֣ית אֱלֹהֵ֔ינוּ אֶל־הַלְּשָׁכ֖וֹת לְבֵ֥ית הָאוֹצָֽר׃
Translated: An Aaronite priest must be with the Levites when they collect the tithe, and the Levites must bring up a tithe of the tithe to the House of our God, to the storerooms of the treasury.
Transliteration: vehayah hakhohen ven-aharon im-haleviyim vaesher haleviyim vehaleviyim yaalu et-maashar hamaasher leveyt eloheynu el-haleshakhvot leveyt havotsar

Hebrew: כִּ֣י אֶל־הַ֠לְּשָׁכ֠וֹת יָבִ֨יאוּ בְנֵי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֜ל וּבְנֵ֣י הַלֵּוִ֗י אֶת־תְּרוּמַ֣ת הַדָּגָן֮ הַתִּיר֣וֹשׁ וְהַיִּצְהָר֒ וְשָׁם֙ כְּלֵ֣י הַמִּקְדָּ֔שׁ וְהַכֹּהֲנִים֙ הַמְשָׁ֣רְתִ֔ים וְהַשּׁוֹעֲרִ֖ים וְהַמְשֹׁרְרִ֑ים וְלֹ֥א נַעֲזֹ֖ב אֶת־בֵּ֥ית אֱלֹהֵֽינוּ׃
Translated:
For it is to the storerooms that the Israelites and the Levites must bring the gifts of grain, wine, and oil. The equipment of the sanctuary and of the ministering priests and the gatekeepers and the singers is also there.
“We will not neglect the House of our God.”
Transliteration: khiy el-haleshakhvot yaviyu veney-yisherael uveney haleviy et-terumat hadagan hatiyrvosh vehayitsehar vesham kheley hamikedash vehakhohaniym hamesharetiym vehashvoariym vehameshoreriym velo naazov et-veyt eloheynu

Hebrew: וַיֵּשְׁב֥וּ שָׂרֵֽי־הָעָ֖ם בִּירוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם וּשְׁאָ֣ר הָ֠עָ֠ם הִפִּ֨ילוּ גוֹרָל֜וֹת לְהָבִ֣יא ׀ אֶחָ֣ד מִן־הָעֲשָׂרָ֗ה לָשֶׁ֙בֶת֙ בִּֽירוּשָׁלַ֙͏ִם֙ עִ֣יר הַקֹּ֔דֶשׁ וְתֵ֥שַׁע הַיָּד֖וֹת בֶּעָרִֽים׃
Translated: The officers of the people settled in Jerusalem; the rest of the people cast lots for one out of ten to come and settle in the holy city of Jerusalem, and the other nine-tenths to stay in the towns.
Transliteration: vayeshevu sharey-haam viyrushala͏im ushear haam hifiylu gvoralvot lehaviy echad min-haasharah lashevet viyrushala͏im iyr hakodesh vetesha hayadvot veariym

Hebrew: וַֽיְבָרְכ֖וּ הָעָ֑ם לְכֹל֙ הָֽאֲנָשִׁ֔ים הַמִּֽתְנַדְּבִ֔ים לָשֶׁ֖בֶת בִּירוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃ {פ}
Translated: The people gave their blessing to all the men who willingly settled in Jerusalem.
Transliteration: vayevarekhu haam lekhol haanashiym hamitenadeviym lashevet viyrushala͏im {f}

Hebrew: וְאֵ֙לֶּה֙ רָאשֵׁ֣י הַמְּדִינָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר יָשְׁב֖וּ בִּירוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם וּבְעָרֵ֣י יְהוּדָ֗ה יָֽשְׁב֞וּ אִ֤ישׁ בַּאֲחֻזָּתוֹ֙ בְּעָ֣רֵיהֶ֔ם יִשְׂרָאֵ֤ל הַכֹּהֲנִים֙ וְהַלְוִיִּ֣ם וְהַנְּתִינִ֔ים וּבְנֵ֖י עַבְדֵ֥י שְׁלֹמֹֽה׃
Translated: These are the heads of the province who lived in Jerusalem—in the countryside of Judah, the people lived in their towns, each on his own property, Israelites, priests, Levites, temple servants, and the sons of Solomon’s servants,
Transliteration: veeleh rashey hamediynah asher yashevu viyrushala͏im uvearey yehudah yashevu iysh vaachuzatvo veareyhem yisherael hakhohaniym vehaleviyim vehanetiyniym uveney avedey shelomoh

Hebrew: וּבִֽירוּשָׁלַ֙͏ִם֙ יָֽשְׁב֔וּ מִבְּנֵ֥י יְהוּדָ֖ה וּמִבְּנֵ֣י בִנְיָמִ֑ן מִבְּנֵ֣י יְ֠הוּדָ֠ה עֲתָיָ֨ה בֶן־עֻזִּיָּ֜ה בֶּן־זְכַרְיָ֧ה בֶן־אֲמַרְיָ֛ה בֶּן־שְׁפַטְיָ֥ה בֶן־מַהֲלַלְאֵ֖ל מִבְּנֵי־פָֽרֶץ׃
Translated:
while in Jerusalem some of the Judahites and some of the Benjaminites lived:
Of the Judahites: Athaiah son of Uzziah son of Zechariah son of Amariah son of Shephatiah son of Mahalalel, of the clan of Periz,
Transliteration: uviyrushala͏im yashevu miveney yehudah umiveney vineyamin miveney yehudah atayah ven-uziyah ven-zekhareyah ven-amareyah ven-shefateyah ven-mahalaleel miveney-farets

Hebrew: וּמַעֲשֵׂיָ֣ה בֶן־בָּר֣וּךְ בֶּן־כׇּל־חֹ֠זֶ֠ה בֶּן־חֲזָיָ֨ה בֶן־עֲדָיָ֧ה בֶן־יוֹיָרִ֛יב בֶּן־זְכַרְיָ֖ה בֶּן־הַשִּׁלֹנִֽי׃
Translated: and Maaseiah son of Baruch son of Col-hozeh son of Hazaiah son of Adaiah son of Joiarib son of Zechariah son of the Shilohite.
Transliteration: umaasheyah ven-varukhe ven-khׇl-chozeh ven-chazayah ven-adayah ven-yvoyariyv ven-zekhareyah ven-hashiloniy

Hebrew: כׇּל־בְּנֵי־פֶ֕רֶץ הַיֹּשְׁבִ֖ים בִּירוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם אַרְבַּ֥ע מֵא֛וֹת שִׁשִּׁ֥ים וּשְׁמֹנָ֖ה אַנְשֵׁי־חָֽיִל׃ {פ}
Translated: All the clan of Periz who were living in Jerusalem—468 valorous men.
Transliteration: khׇl-veney-ferets hayosheviym viyrushala͏im areva mevot shishiym ushemonah aneshey-chayiil {f}

Hebrew: וְאֵ֖לֶּה בְּנֵ֣י בִנְיָמִ֑ן סַלֻּ֡א בֶּן־מְשֻׁלָּ֡ם בֶּן־יוֹעֵ֡ד בֶּן־פְּדָיָה֩ בֶן־ק֨וֹלָיָ֧ה בֶן־מַעֲשֵׂיָ֛ה בֶּן־אִֽיתִיאֵ֖ל בֶּן־יְשַֽׁעְיָֽה׃
Translated: These are the Benjaminites: Sallu son of Meshullam son of Joed son of Pedaiah son of Kolaiah son of Maaseiah son of Ithiel son of Jesaiah.
Transliteration: veeleh veney vineyamin salu ven-meshulam ven-yvoed ven-fedayah ven-kvolayah ven-maasheyah ven-iytiyel ven-yeshaeyah

Hebrew: וְאַחֲרָ֖יו גַּבַּ֣י סַלָּ֑י תְּשַׁ֥ע מֵא֖וֹת עֶשְׂרִ֥ים וּשְׁמֹנָֽה׃
Translated: After him, Gabbai and Sallai—928.
Transliteration: veacharayv gavay salay tesha mevot esheriym ushemonah

Hebrew: וְיוֹאֵ֥ל בֶּן־זִכְרִ֖י פָּקִ֣יד עֲלֵיהֶ֑ם וִיהוּדָ֧ה בֶן־הַסְּנוּאָ֛ה עַל־הָעִ֖יר מִשְׁנֶֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: Joel son of Zichri was the official in charge of them, and Judah son of Hassenuah was the second-in-command of the city.
Transliteration: veyvoel ven-zikheriy fakiyd aleyhem viyhudah ven-hasenuah al-haiyr misheneh {f}

Hebrew: מִן־הַֽכֹּהֲנִ֑ים יְדַֽעְיָ֥ה בֶן־יוֹיָרִ֖יב יָכִֽין׃
Translated: Of the priests: Jedaiah son of Joiarib, Jachin,
Transliteration: min-hakhohaniym yedaeyah ven-yvoyariyv yakhiyn

Hebrew: שְׂרָיָ֨ה בֶן־חִלְקִיָּ֜ה בֶּן־מְשֻׁלָּ֣ם בֶּן־צָד֗וֹק בֶּן־מְרָיוֹת֙ בֶּן־אֲחִיט֔וּב נְגִ֖ד בֵּ֥ית הָאֱלֹהִֽים׃
Translated: Seraiah son of Hilkiah son of Meshullam son of Zadok son of Meraioth son of Ahitub, chief officer of the House of God,
Transliteration: sherayah ven-chilekiyah ven-meshulam ven-tsadvok ven-merayvot ven-achiytuv negid veyt haElohim

Hebrew: וַאֲחֵיהֶ֗ם עֹשֵׂ֤ה הַמְּלָאכָה֙ לַבַּ֔יִת שְׁמֹנֶ֥ה מֵא֖וֹת עֶשְׂרִ֣ים וּשְׁנָ֑יִם וַ֠עֲדָיָ֠ה בֶּן־יְרֹחָ֤ם בֶּן־פְּלַלְיָה֙ בֶּן־אַמְצִ֣י בֶן־זְכַרְיָ֔ה בֶּן־פַּשְׁח֖וּר בֶּן־מַלְכִּיָּֽה׃
Translated: and their brothers, who did the work of the House—822; and Adaiah son of Jeroham son of Pelaliah son of Amzi son of Zechariah son of Pashhur son of Malchijah,
Transliteration: vaacheyhem osheh hamelakhah lavayiit shemoneh mevot esheriym ushenayiim vaadayah ven-yerocham ven-felaleyah ven-ametsiy ven-zekhareyah ven-fashechur ven-malekhiyah

Hebrew: וְאֶחָיו֙ רָאשִׁ֣ים לְאָב֔וֹת מָאתַ֖יִם אַרְבָּעִ֣ים וּשְׁנָ֑יִם וַעֲמַשְׁסַ֧י בֶּן־עֲזַרְאֵ֛ל בֶּן־אַחְזַ֥י בֶּן־מְשִׁלֵּמ֖וֹת בֶּן־אִמֵּֽר׃
Translated: and his brothers, heads of clans—242; and Amashsai son of Azarel son of Ahzai son of Meshillemoth son of Immer,
Transliteration: veechayv rashiym leavvot matayiim arevaiym ushenayiim vaamashesay ven-azareel ven-achezay ven-meshilemvot ven-imer

Hebrew: וַאֲחֵיהֶם֙ גִּבֹּ֣רֵי חַ֔יִל מֵאָ֖ה עֶשְׂרִ֣ים וּשְׁמֹנָ֑ה וּפָקִ֣יד עֲלֵיהֶ֔ם זַבְדִּיאֵ֖ל בֶּן־הַגְּדוֹלִֽים׃ {ס}
Translated: and their brothers, valorous warriors—128. Zabdiel son of Haggedolim was the official in charge of them.
Transliteration: vaacheyhem givorey chayiil meah esheriym ushemonah ufakiyd aleyhem zavediyel ven-hagedvoliym {s}

Hebrew: וּמִֽן־הַלְוִיִּ֑ם שְׁמַעְיָ֧ה בֶן־חַשּׁ֛וּב בֶּן־עַזְרִיקָ֥ם בֶּן־חֲשַׁבְיָ֖ה בֶּן־בּוּנִּֽי׃
Translated: Of the Levites: Shemaiah son of Hasshub son of Azrikam son of Hashabiah son of Bunni,
Transliteration: umin-haleviyim shemaeyah ven-chashuv ven-azeriykam ven-chashaveyah ven-vuniy

Hebrew: וְשַׁבְּתַ֨י וְיוֹזָבָ֜ד עַל־הַמְּלָאכָ֤ה הַחִֽיצֹנָה֙ לְבֵ֣ית הָאֱלֹהִ֔ים מֵרָאשֵׁ֖י הַלְוִיִּֽם׃
Translated: and Shabbethai and Jozabad of the heads of the Levites were in charge of the external work of the House of God.
Transliteration: veshavetay veyvozavad al-hamelakhah hachiytsonah leveyt haElohim merashey haleviyim

Hebrew: וּמַתַּנְיָ֣ה בֶן־מִ֠יכָ֠א בֶּן־זַבְדִּ֨י בֶן־אָסָ֜ף רֹ֗אשׁ הַתְּחִלָּה֙ יְהוֹדֶ֣ה לַתְּפִלָּ֔ה וּבַקְבֻּקְיָ֖ה מִשְׁנֶ֣ה מֵאֶחָ֑יו וְעַבְדָּא֙ בֶּן־שַׁמּ֔וּעַ בֶּן־גָּלָ֖ל בֶּן־[יְדוּתֽוּן] (ידיתון)׃
Translated: Mattaniah son of Micha son of Zabdi son of Asaph was the head; at prayer, he would lead off with praise; and Bakbukiah, one of his brothers, was his second-in-command; and Abda son of Shammua son of Galal son of Jeduthun.
Transliteration: umataneyah ven-miykha ven-zavediy ven-asaf rosh hatechilah yehvodeh latefilah uvakevukeyah misheneh meechayv veaveda ven-shamua ven-galal ven-[yedutun] (ydytvn)

Hebrew: כׇּל־הַלְוִיִּם֙ בְּעִ֣יר הַקֹּ֔דֶשׁ מָאתַ֖יִם שְׁמֹנִ֥ים וְאַרְבָּעָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: All the Levites in the holy city—284.
Transliteration: khׇl-haleviyim veiyr hakodesh matayiim shemoniym vearevaah {f}

Hebrew: וְהַשּֽׁוֹעֲרִים֙ עַקּ֣וּב טַלְמ֔וֹן וַאֲחֵיהֶ֖ם הַשֹּׁמְרִ֣ים בַּשְּׁעָרִ֑ים מֵאָ֖ה שִׁבְעִ֥ים וּשְׁנָֽיִם׃
Translated: And the gatekeepers: Akkub, Talmon, and their brothers, who stood watch at the gates—172.
Transliteration: vehashvoariym akuv talemvon vaacheyhem hashomeriym vasheariym meah shiveiym ushenayiim

Hebrew: וּשְׁאָ֨ר יִשְׂרָאֵ֜ל הַכֹּהֲנִ֤ים הַלְוִיִּם֙ בְּכׇל־עָרֵ֣י יְהוּדָ֔ה אִ֖ישׁ בְּנַחֲלָתֽוֹ׃
Translated: And the rest of the Israelites, the priests, and the Levites in all the towns of Judah [lived] each on his estate.
Transliteration: ushear yisherael hakhohaniym haleviyim vekhׇl-arey yehudah iysh venachalatvo

Hebrew: וְהַנְּתִינִ֖ים יֹשְׁבִ֣ים בָּעֹ֑פֶל וְצִיחָ֥א וְגִשְׁפָּ֖א עַל־הַנְּתִינִֽים׃ {פ}
Translated: The temple servants lived on the Ophel; Ziha and Gishpa were in charge of the temple servants.
Transliteration: vehanetiyniym yosheviym vaofel vetsiycha vegishefa al-hanetiyniym {f}

Hebrew: וּפְקִ֤יד הַלְוִיִּם֙ בִּיר֣וּשָׁלַ֔͏ִם עֻזִּ֤י בֶן־בָּנִי֙ בֶּן־חֲשַׁבְיָ֔ה בֶּן־מַתַּנְיָ֖ה בֶּן־מִיכָ֑א מִבְּנֵ֤י אָסָף֙ הַמְשֹׁ֣רְרִ֔ים לְנֶ֖גֶד מְלֶ֥אכֶת בֵּית־הָאֱלֹהִֽים׃
Translated: The overseer of the Levites in Jerusalem was Uzzi son of Bani son of Hashabiah son of Mattaniah son of Micha, of the Asaphite singers, over the work of the House of God.
Transliteration: ufekiyd haleviyim viyrushala͏im uziy ven-vaniy ven-chashaveyah ven-mataneyah ven-miykha miveney asaf hameshoreriym leneged melekhet veyt-haElohim

Hebrew: כִּֽי־מִצְוַ֥ת הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ עֲלֵיהֶ֑ם וַאֲמָנָ֥ה עַל־הַמְשֹׁרְרִ֖ים דְּבַר־י֥וֹם בְּיוֹמֽוֹ׃
Translated: There was a royal order concerning them, a stipulation concerning the daily duties of the singers.
Transliteration: khiy-mitsevat hamelekhe aleyhem vaamanah al-hameshoreriym devar-yvom veyvomvo

Hebrew: וּפְתַֽחְיָ֨ה בֶן־מְשֵֽׁיזַבְאֵ֜ל מִבְּנֵי־זֶ֤רַח בֶּן־יְהוּדָה֙ לְיַ֣ד הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ לְכׇל־דָּבָ֖ר לָעָֽם׃
Translated: Petahiah son of Meshezabel, of the sons of Zerah son of Judah, advised the king concerning all the affairs of the people.
Transliteration: ufetacheyah ven-mesheyzaveel miveney-zerach ven-yehudah leyad hamelekhe lekhׇl-davar laam

Hebrew: וְאֶל־הַחֲצֵרִ֖ים בִּשְׂדֹתָ֑ם מִבְּנֵ֣י יְהוּדָ֗ה יָֽשְׁב֞וּ בְּקִרְיַ֤ת הָֽאַרְבַּע֙ וּבְנֹתֶ֔יהָ וּבְדִיבֹן֙ וּבְנֹתֶ֔יהָ וּבִֽיקַּבְצְאֵ֖ל וַחֲצֵרֶֽיהָ׃
Translated: As concerns the villages with their fields: Some of the Judahites lived in Kiriath-arba and its outlying hamlets, in Dibon and its outlying hamlets, and in Jekabzeel and its villages;
Transliteration: veel-hachatseriym vishedotam miveney yehudah yashevu vekireyat haareva uvenoteyha uvediyvon uvenoteyha uviykavetseel vachatsereyha

Hebrew: וּבְיֵשׁ֥וּעַ וּבְמֹלָדָ֖ה וּבְבֵ֥ית פָּֽלֶט׃
Translated: in Jeshua, in Moladah, and in Beth-pelet;
Transliteration: uveeishua uvemoladah uveveyt falet

Hebrew: וּבַחֲצַ֥ר שׁוּעָ֛ל וּבִבְאֵ֥ר שֶׁ֖בַע וּבְנֹתֶֽיהָ׃
Translated: in Hazar-shual, in Beer-sheba and its outlying hamlets;
Transliteration: uvachatsar shual uviveer sheva uvenoteyha

Hebrew: וּבְצִֽקְלַ֥ג וּבִמְכֹנָ֖ה וּבִבְנֹתֶֽיהָ׃
Translated: and in Ziklag and in Meconah and its outlying hamlets;
Transliteration: uvetsikelag uvimekhonah uvivenoteyha

Hebrew: וּבְעֵ֥ין רִמּ֛וֹן וּבְצׇרְעָ֖ה וּבְיַרְמֽוּת׃
Translated: in En-rimmon, in Zorah and in Jarmuth;
Transliteration: uveeyn rimvon uvetsׇreah uveyaremut

Hebrew: זָנֹ֤חַ עֲדֻלָּם֙ וְחַצְרֵיהֶ֔ם לָכִישׁ֙ וּשְׂדֹתֶ֔יהָ עֲזֵקָ֖ה וּבְנֹתֶ֑יהָ וַיַּחֲנ֥וּ מִבְּאֵֽר־שֶׁ֖בַע עַד־גֵּ֥יא הִנֹּֽם׃
Translated: Zanoah, Adullam, and their villages; Lachish and its fields; Azekah and its outlying hamlets. They settled from Beer-sheba to the Valley of Hinnom.
Transliteration: zanocha adulam vechatsereyhem lakhiysh ushedoteyha azekah uvenoteyha vayachanu miveer-sheva ad-gey hinom

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֥י בִנְיָמִ֖ן מִגָּ֑בַע מִכְמָ֣שׂ וְעַיָּ֔ה וּבֵֽית־אֵ֖ל וּבְנֹתֶֽיהָ׃
Translated: The Benjaminites: from Geba, Michmash, Aija, and Bethel and its outlying hamlets;
Transliteration: uveney vineyamin migava mikhemash veayah uveyt-el uvenoteyha

Hebrew: עֲנָת֥וֹת נֹ֖ב עֲנָֽנְיָֽה׃
Translated: Anathoth, Nob, Ananiah,
Transliteration: anatvot nov ananeyah

Hebrew: חָצ֥וֹר <small>׀</small> רָמָ֖ה גִּתָּֽיִם׃
Translated: Hazor, Ramah, Gittaim,
Transliteration: chatsvor <small></small> ramah gitayiim

Hebrew: חָדִ֥יד צְבֹעִ֖ים נְבַלָּֽט׃
Translated: Hadid, Zeboim, Neballat,
Transliteration: chadiyd tsevoiym nevalat

Hebrew: לֹ֥ד וְאוֹנ֖וֹ גֵּ֥י הַחֲרָשִֽׁים׃
Translated: Lod, Ono, Ge-harashim.
Transliteration: lod vevonvo gey hacharashiym

Hebrew: וּמִ֨ן־הַלְוִיִּ֔ם מַחְלְק֥וֹת יְהוּדָ֖ה לְבִנְיָמִֽין׃ {פ}
Translated: Some of the Judahite divisions of Levites were [shifted] to Benjamin.
Transliteration: umin-haleviyim machelekvot yehudah levineyamiyn {f}

Hebrew: וְאֵ֙לֶּה֙ הַכֹּהֲנִ֣ים וְהַלְוִיִּ֔ם אֲשֶׁ֥ר עָל֛וּ עִם־זְרֻבָּבֶ֥ל בֶּן־שְׁאַלְתִּיאֵ֖ל וְיֵשׁ֑וּעַ שְׂרָיָ֥ה יִרְמְיָ֖ה עֶזְרָֽא׃
Translated:
These are the priests and the Levites who came up with Zerubbabel son of Shealtiel and Jeshua:
Seraiah, Jeremiah, Ezra,
Transliteration: veeleh hakhohaniym vehaleviyim asher alu im-zeruvavel ven-shealetiyel veeishua sherayah yiremeyah ezera

Hebrew: אֲמַרְיָ֥ה מַלּ֖וּךְ חַטּֽוּשׁ׃
Translated: Amariah, Malluch, Hattush,
Transliteration: amareyah malukhe chatush

Hebrew: שְׁכַנְיָ֥ה רְחֻ֖ם מְרֵמֹֽת׃
Translated: Shecaniah, Rehum, Meramoth,
Transliteration: shekhaneyah rechum meremot

Hebrew: עִדּ֥וֹא גִנְּת֖וֹי אֲבִיָּֽה׃
Translated: Iddo, Ginnethoi, Abijah,
Transliteration: idvo ginetvoy aviyah

Hebrew: מִיָּמִ֥ין מַֽעַדְיָ֖ה בִּלְגָּֽה׃
Translated: Mijamin, Maadiah, Bilgah,
Transliteration: miyamiyn maadeyah vilegah

Hebrew: שְׁמַֽעְיָ֥ה וְיוֹיָרִ֖יב יְדַֽעְיָֽה׃
Translated: Shemaiah, Joiarib, Jedaiah,
Transliteration: shemaeyah veyvoyariyv yedaeyah

Hebrew: סַלּ֣וּ עָמ֔וֹק חִלְקִיָּ֖ה יְדַֽעְיָ֑ה אֵ֣לֶּה רָאשֵׁ֧י הַכֹּהֲנִ֛ים וַאֲחֵיהֶ֖ם בִּימֵ֥י יֵשֽׁוּעַ׃ {פ}
Translated: Sallu, Amok, Hilkiah, Jedaiah. These were the heads of the priests and their brothers in the time of Jeshua.
Transliteration: salu amvok chilekiyah yedaeyah eleh rashey hakhohaniym vaacheyhem viymey eishua {f}

Hebrew: וְהַלְוִיִּ֗ם יֵשׁ֧וּעַ בִּנּ֛וּי קַדְמִיאֵ֥ל שֵׁרֵבְיָ֖ה יְהוּדָ֣ה מַתַּנְיָ֑ה עַֽל־הֻיְּד֖וֹת ה֥וּא וְאֶחָֽיו׃
Translated: The Levites: Jeshua, Binnui, Kadmiel, Sherebiah, Judah, and Mattaniah, in charge of thanksgiving songs, he and his brothers;
Transliteration: vehaleviyim eishua vinuy kademiyel shereveyah yehudah mataneyah al-huyedvot hu veechayv

Hebrew: וּבַקְבֻּֽקְיָ֨ה (וענו) [וְעֻנִּ֧י] אֲחֵיהֶ֛ם לְנֶגְדָּ֖ם לְמִשְׁמָרֽוֹת׃
Translated: and Bakbukiah and Unni [and] their brothers served opposite them by shifts.
Transliteration: uvakevukeyah (vnv) [veuniy] acheyhem lenegedam lemishemarvot

Hebrew: וְיֵשׁ֖וּעַ הוֹלִ֣יד אֶת־יֽוֹיָקִ֑ים וְיֽוֹיָקִים֙ הוֹלִ֣יד אֶת־אֶלְיָשִׁ֔יב וְאֶלְיָשִׁ֖יב אֶת־יוֹיָדָֽע׃
Translated: Jeshua begot Joiakim; Joiakim begot Eliashib; Eliashib begot Joiada;
Transliteration: veeishua hvoliyd et-yvoyakiym veyvoyakiym hvoliyd et-eleyashiyv veeleyashiyv et-yvoyada

Hebrew: וְיוֹיָדָע֙ הוֹלִ֣יד אֶת־יוֹנָתָ֔ן וְיוֹנָתָ֖ן הוֹלִ֥יד אֶת־יַדּֽוּעַ׃
Translated: Joiada begot Jonathan; Jonathan begot Jaddua.
Transliteration: veyvoyada hvoliyd et-yvonatan veyvonatan hvoliyd et-yadua

Hebrew: וּבִימֵי֙ יֽוֹיָקִ֔ים הָי֥וּ כֹהֲנִ֖ים רָאשֵׁ֣י הָאָב֑וֹת לִשְׂרָיָ֣ה מְרָיָ֔ה לְיִרְמְיָ֖ה חֲנַנְיָֽה׃
Translated: In the time of Joiakim, the heads of the priestly clans were: Meriaiah—of the Seraiah clan; Hananiah—of the Jeremiah clan;
Transliteration: uviymey yvoyakiym hayu khohaniym rashey haavvot lisherayah merayah leyiremeyah chananeyah

Hebrew: לְעֶזְרָ֣א מְשֻׁלָּ֔ם לַאֲמַרְיָ֖ה יְהוֹחָנָֽן׃
Translated: Meshullam—of the Ezra clan; Jehohanan—of the Amariah clan;
Transliteration: leezera meshulam laamareyah yehvochanan

Hebrew: (למלוכי) [לִמְלִ֙יכוּ֙] יֽוֹנָתָ֔ן לִשְׁבַנְיָ֖ה יוֹסֵֽף׃
Translated: Jonathan—of the Melicu clan; Joseph—of the Shebaniah clan;
Transliteration: (lmlvkhy) [limeliykhu] yvonatan lishevaneyah yvosef

Hebrew: לְחָרִ֣ם עַדְנָ֔א לִמְרָי֖וֹת חֶלְקָֽי׃
Translated: Adna—of the Harim clan; Helkai—of the Meraioth clan;
Transliteration: lecharim adena limerayvot chelekay

Hebrew: (לעדיא) [לְעִדּ֥וֹא] זְכַרְיָ֖ה לְגִנְּת֥וֹן מְשֻׁלָּֽם׃
Translated: Zechariah—of the Iddo clan; Meshullam—of the Ginnethon clan;
Transliteration: (ldy) [leidvo] zekhareyah leginetvon meshulam

Hebrew: לַאֲבִיָּ֖ה זִכְרִ֑י לְמִ֨נְיָמִ֔ין לְמוֹעַדְיָ֖ה פִּלְטָֽי׃
Translated: Zichri—of the Abijah clan…of the Miniamin clan; Piltai—of the Moadiah clan;
Transliteration: laaviyah zikheriy lemineyamiyn lemvoadeyah filetay

Hebrew: לְבִלְגָּ֣ה שַׁמּ֔וּעַ לִֽשְׁמַעְיָ֖ה יְהוֹנָתָֽן׃
Translated: Shammua—of the Bilgah clan; Jehonathan—of the Shemaiah clan;
Transliteration: levilegah shamua lishemaeyah yehvonatan

Hebrew: וּלְיוֹיָרִ֣יב מַתְּנַ֔י לִֽידַֽעְיָ֖ה עֻזִּֽי׃
Translated: Mattenai—of the Joiarib clan; Uzzi—of the Jedaiah clan;
Transliteration: uleyvoyariyv matenay liydaeyah uziy

Hebrew: לְסַלַּ֥י קַלָּ֖י לְעָמ֥וֹק עֵֽבֶר׃
Translated: Kallai—of the Sallai clan; Eber—of the Amok clan;
Transliteration: lesalay kalay leamvok ever

Hebrew: לְחִלְקִיָּ֣ה חֲשַׁבְיָ֔ה לִֽידַֽעְיָ֖ה נְתַנְאֵֽל׃
Translated: Hashabiah—of the Hilkiah clan; Nethanel—of the Jedaiah clan.
Transliteration: lechilekiyah chashaveyah liydaeyah netaneel

Hebrew: הַלְוִיִּם֩ בִּימֵ֨י אֶלְיָשִׁ֜יב יוֹיָדָ֤ע וְיוֹחָנָן֙ וְיַדּ֔וּעַ כְּתוּבִ֖ים רָאשֵׁ֣י אָב֑וֹת וְהַכֹּ֣הֲנִ֔ים עַל־מַלְכ֖וּת דָּרְיָ֥וֶשׁ הַפָּֽרְסִֽי׃ {פ}
Translated: The Levites and the priests were listed by heads of clans in the days of Eliashib, Joiada, Johanan, and Jaddua, down to the reign of Darius the Persian.
Transliteration: haleviyim viymey eleyashiyv yvoyada veyvochanan veyadua khetuviym rashey avvot vehakhohaniym al-malekhut dareyavesh hafaresiy {f}

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֤י לֵוִי֙ רָאשֵׁ֣י הָֽאָב֔וֹת כְּתוּבִ֕ים עַל־סֵ֖פֶר דִּבְרֵ֣י הַיָּמִ֑ים וְעַד־יְמֵ֖י יֽוֹחָנָ֥ן בֶּן־אֶלְיָשִֽׁיב׃
Translated: But the Levite heads of clans are listed in the book of the chronicles to the time of Johanan son of Eliashib.
Transliteration: veney leviy rashey haavvot khetuviym al-sefer diverey hayamiym vead-yemey yvochanan ven-eleyashiyv

Hebrew: וְרָאשֵׁ֣י הַ֠לְוִיִּ֠ם חֲשַׁבְיָ֨ה שֵֽׁרֵבְיָ֜ה וְיֵשׁ֤וּעַ בֶּן־קַדְמִיאֵל֙ וַאֲחֵיהֶ֣ם לְנֶגְדָּ֔ם לְהַלֵּ֣ל לְהוֹד֔וֹת בְּמִצְוַ֖ת דָּוִ֣יד אִישׁ־הָאֱלֹהִ֑ים מִשְׁמָ֖ר לְעֻמַּ֥ת מִשְׁמָֽר׃
Translated: The heads of the Levites: Hashabiah, Sherebiah, Jeshua son of Kadmiel, and their brothers served opposite them, singing praise and thanksgiving hymns by the ordinance of David the man of God—served opposite them in shifts;
Transliteration: verashey haleviyim chashaveyah shereveyah veeishua ven-kademiyel vaacheyhem lenegedam lehalel lehvodvot vemitsevat daviyd iysh-haElohim mishemar leumat mishemar

Hebrew: מַתַּנְיָ֧ה וּבַקְבֻּֽקְיָ֛ה עֹבַדְיָ֥ה מְשֻׁלָּ֖ם טַלְמ֣וֹן עַקּ֑וּב שֹׁמְרִ֤ים שֽׁוֹעֲרִים֙ מִשְׁמָ֔ר בַּאֲסֻפֵּ֖י הַשְּׁעָרִֽים׃
Translated: Mattaniah, Bakbukiah, Obadiah, Meshullam, Talmon, and Akkub, guarding as gatekeepers by shifts at the vestibules of the gates.
Transliteration: mataneyah uvakevukeyah ovadeyah meshulam talemvon akuv shomeriym shvoariym mishemar vaasufey hasheariym

Hebrew: אֵ֕לֶּה בִּימֵ֛י יוֹיָקִ֥ים בֶּן־יֵשׁ֖וּעַ בֶּן־יוֹצָדָ֑ק וּבִימֵי֙ נְחֶמְיָ֣ה הַפֶּחָ֔ה וְעֶזְרָ֥א הַכֹּהֵ֖ן הַסּוֹפֵֽר׃ {פ}
Translated: These were in the time of Joiakim son of Jeshua son of Jozadak, and in the time of Nehemiah the governor, and of Ezra the priest, the scribe.
Transliteration: eleh viymey yvoyakiym ven-eishua ven-yvotsadak uviymey nechemeyah hafechah veezera hakhohen hasvofer {f}

Hebrew: וּבַחֲנֻכַּ֞ת חוֹמַ֣ת יְרוּשָׁלַ֗͏ִם בִּקְשׁ֤וּ אֶת־הַלְוִיִּם֙ מִכׇּל־מְק֣וֹמֹתָ֔ם לַהֲבִיאָ֖ם לִֽירוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם לַעֲשֹׂ֨ת חֲנֻכָּ֤ה וְשִׂמְחָה֙ וּבְתוֹד֣וֹת וּבְשִׁ֔יר מְצִלְתַּ֖יִם נְבָלִ֥ים וּבְכִנֹּרֽוֹת׃
Translated: At the dedication of the wall of Jerusalem, the Levites, wherever they lived, were sought out and brought to Jerusalem to celebrate a joyful dedication with thanksgiving and with song, accompanied by cymbals, harps, and lyres.
Transliteration: uvachanukhat chvomat yerushala͏im vikeshu et-haleviyim mikhׇl-mekvomotam lahaviyam liyrushala͏im laashot chanukhah veshimechah uvetvodvot uveshiyr metsiletayiim nevaliym uvekhinorvot

Hebrew: וַיֵּאָ֣סְפ֔וּ בְּנֵ֖י הַמְשֹׁרְרִ֑ים וּמִן־הַכִּכָּר֙ סְבִיב֣וֹת יְרוּשָׁלַ֔͏ִם וּמִן־חַצְרֵ֖י נְטֹפָתִֽי׃
Translated: The companies of singers assembled from the [Jordan] plain, the environs of Jerusalem, and from the Netophathite villages;
Transliteration: vayeasefu veney hameshoreriym umin-hakhikhar seviyvvot yerushala͏im umin-chatserey netofatiy

Hebrew: וּמִבֵּית֙ הַגִּלְגָּ֔ל וּמִשְּׂד֥וֹת גֶּ֖בַע וְעַזְמָ֑וֶת כִּ֣י חֲצֵרִ֗ים בָּנ֤וּ לָהֶם֙ הַמְשֹׁ֣רְרִ֔ים סְבִיב֖וֹת יְרוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃
Translated: from Beth-hagilgal, from the countryside of Geba and Azmaveth, for the singers built themselves villages in the environs of Jerusalem.
Transliteration: umiveyt hagilegal umishedvot geva veazemavet khiy chatseriym vanu lahem hameshoreriym seviyvvot yerushala͏im

Hebrew: וַיִּֽטַּהֲר֔וּ הַכֹּהֲנִ֖ים וְהַלְוִיִּ֑ם וַֽיְטַהֲרוּ֙ אֶת־הָעָ֔ם וְאֶת־הַשְּׁעָרִ֖ים וְאֶת־הַחוֹמָֽה׃
Translated: The priests and Levites purified themselves; then they purified the people, and the gates, and the wall.
Transliteration: vayitaharu hakhohaniym vehaleviyim vayetaharu et-haam veet-hasheariym veet-hachvomah

Hebrew: וָאַעֲלֶה֙ אֶת־שָׂרֵ֣י יְהוּדָ֔ה מֵעַ֖ל לַחוֹמָ֑ה וָאַעֲמִ֡ידָה שְׁתֵּ֣י תוֹדֹת֩ גְּדוֹלֹ֨ת וְתַהֲלֻכֹ֤ת לַיָּמִין֙ מֵעַ֣ל לַחוֹמָ֔ה לְשַׁ֖עַר הָאַשְׁפֹּֽת׃
Translated: I had the officers of Judah go up onto the wall, and I appointed two large thanksgiving [choirs] and processions. [One marched] south on the wall, to the Dung Gate;
Transliteration: vaaaleh et-sharey yehudah meal lachvomah vaaamiydah shetey tvodot gedvolot vetahalukhot layamiyn meal lachvomah leshaar haashefot

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֤לֶךְ אַחֲרֵיהֶם֙ הוֹשַׁ֣עְיָ֔ה וַחֲצִ֖י שָׂרֵ֥י יְהוּדָֽה׃
Translated: behind them were Hoshaiah and half the officers of Judah,
Transliteration: vayelekhe achareyhem hvoshaeyah vachatsiy sharey yehudah

Hebrew: וַעֲזַרְיָ֥ה עֶזְרָ֖א וּמְשֻׁלָּֽם׃
Translated: and Azariah, Ezra, Meshullam,
Transliteration: vaazareyah ezera umeshulam

Hebrew: יְהוּדָה֙ וּבִנְיָמִ֔ן וּֽשְׁמַֽעְיָ֖ה וְיִרְמְיָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: Judah, Benjamin, Shemaiah, and Jeremiah,
Transliteration: yehudah uvineyamin ushemaeyah veyiremeyah {f}

Hebrew: וּמִבְּנֵ֥י הַכֹּהֲנִ֖ים בַּחֲצֹצְר֑וֹת זְכַרְיָ֨ה בֶן־יֽוֹנָתָ֜ן בֶּן־שְׁמַֽעְיָ֗ה בֶּן־מַתַּנְיָה֙ בֶּן־מִ֣יכָיָ֔ה בֶּן־זַכּ֖וּר בֶּן־אָסָֽף׃
Translated: and some of the young priests, with trumpets; Zechariah son of Jonathan son of Shemaiah son of Mattaniah son of Micaiah son of Zaccur son of Asaph,
Transliteration: umiveney hakhohaniym vachatsotservot zekhareyah ven-yvonatan ven-shemaeyah ven-mataneyah ven-miykhayah ven-zakhur ven-asaf

Hebrew: וְֽאֶחָ֡יו שְֽׁמַעְיָ֡ה וַעֲזַרְאֵ֡ל מִֽלְלַ֡י גִּֽלְלַ֡י מָעַ֞י נְתַנְאֵ֤ל וִֽיהוּדָה֙ חֲנָ֔נִי בִּכְלֵי־שִׁ֥יר דָּוִ֖יד אִ֣ישׁ הָאֱלֹהִ֑ים וְעֶזְרָ֥א הַסּוֹפֵ֖ר לִפְנֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: and his brothers Shemaiah, and Azarel, Milalai, Gilalai, Maai, Nethanel, Judah, and Hanani, with the musical instruments of David, the man of God; and Ezra the scribe went ahead of them.
Transliteration: veechayv shemaeyah vaazareel milelay gilelay maay netaneel viyhudah chananiy vikheley-shiyr daviyd iysh haElohim veezera hasvofer lifeneyhem

Hebrew: וְעַל֩ שַׁ֨עַר הָעַ֜יִן וְנֶגְדָּ֗ם עָלוּ֙ עַֽל־מַעֲלוֹת֙ עִ֣יר דָּוִ֔יד בַּֽמַּעֲלֶ֖ה לַחוֹמָ֑ה מֵעַל֙ לְבֵ֣ית דָּוִ֔יד וְעַ֛ד שַׁ֥עַר הַמַּ֖יִם מִזְרָֽח׃
Translated: From there to the Fountain Gate, where they ascended the steps of the City of David directly before them, by the ascent on the wall, above the house of David, [and onward] to the Water Gate on the east.
Transliteration: veal shaar haayiin venegedam alu al-maalvot iyr daviyd vamaaleh lachvomah meal leveyt daviyd vead shaar hamayiim mizerach

Hebrew: וְהַתּוֹדָ֧ה הַשֵּׁנִ֛ית הַהוֹלֶ֥כֶת לְמ֖וֹאל וַאֲנִ֣י אַחֲרֶ֑יהָ וַחֲצִ֨י הָעָ֜ם מֵעַ֣ל לְהַחוֹמָ֗ה מֵעַל֙ לְמִגְדַּ֣ל הַתַּנּוּרִ֔ים וְעַ֖ד הַחוֹמָ֥ה הָרְחָבָֽה׃
Translated: The other thanksgiving [choir] marched on the wall in the opposite direction, with me and half the people behind it, above the Tower of Ovens to the Broad Wall;
Transliteration: vehatvodah hasheniyt hahvolekhet lemvol vaaniy achareyha vachatsiy haam meal lehachvomah meal lemigedal hatanuriym vead hachvomah harechavah

Hebrew: וּמֵעַ֣ל לְשַֽׁעַר־אֶ֠פְרַ֠יִם וְעַל־שַׁ֨עַר הַיְשָׁנָ֜ה וְעַל־שַׁ֣עַר הַדָּגִ֗ים וּמִגְדַּ֤ל חֲנַנְאֵל֙ וּמִגְדַּ֣ל הַמֵּאָ֔ה וְעַ֖ד שַׁ֣עַר הַצֹּ֑אן וְעָ֣מְד֔וּ בְּשַׁ֖עַר הַמַּטָּרָֽה׃
Translated: and above the Gate of Ephraim, the Jeshanah Gate, the Fish Gate, the Tower of Hananel, the Tower of the Hundred, to the Sheep Gate; and they halted at the Gate of the Prison Compound.
Transliteration: umeal leshaar-eferayiim veal-shaar hayeshanah veal-shaar hadagiym umigedal chananeel umigedal hameah vead shaar hatson veamedu veshaar hamatarah

Hebrew: וַֽתַּעֲמֹ֛דְנָה שְׁתֵּ֥י הַתּוֹדֹ֖ת בְּבֵ֣ית הָאֱלֹהִ֑ים וַאֲנִ֕י וַחֲצִ֥י הַסְּגָנִ֖ים עִמִּֽי׃
Translated: Both thanksgiving choirs halted at the House of God, and I and half the prefects with me,
Transliteration: vataamodenah shetey hatvodot veveyt haElohim vaaniy vachatsiy haseganiym imiy

Hebrew: וְהַכֹּהֲנִ֡ים אֶלְיָקִ֡ים מַעֲשֵׂיָ֡ה מִ֠נְיָמִ֠ין מִיכָיָ֧ה אֶלְיוֹעֵינַ֛י זְכַרְיָ֥ה חֲנַנְיָ֖ה בַּחֲצֹצְרֽוֹת׃
Translated: and the priests Eliakim, Maaseiah, Miniamin, Micaiah, Elioenai, Zechariah, Hananiah, with trumpets,
Transliteration: vehakhohaniym eleyakiym maasheyah mineyamiyn miykhayah eleyvoeynay zekhareyah chananeyah vachatsotservot

Hebrew: וּמַעֲשֵׂיָ֨ה וּֽשְׁמַֽעְיָ֜ה וְאֶלְעָזָ֧ר וְעֻזִּ֛י וִֽיהוֹחָנָ֥ן וּמַלְכִּיָּ֖ה וְעֵילָ֣ם וָעָ֑זֶר וַיַּשְׁמִ֙יעוּ֙ הַמְשֹׁ֣רְרִ֔ים וְיִֽזְרַחְיָ֖ה הַפָּקִֽיד׃
Translated: and Maaseiah and Shemaiah, Eleazar, Uzzi, Jehohanan, Malchijah, Elam, and Ezer. Then the singers sounded forth, with Jezrahiah in charge.
Transliteration: umaasheyah ushemaeyah veeleazar veuziy viyhvochanan umalekhiyah veeylam vaazer vayashemiyu hameshoreriym veyizeracheyah hafakiyd

Hebrew: וַיִּזְבְּח֣וּ בַיּוֹם־הַ֠ה֠וּא זְבָחִ֨ים גְּדוֹלִ֜ים וַיִּשְׂמָ֗חוּ כִּ֤י הָאֱלֹהִים֙ שִׂמְּחָם֙ שִׂמְחָ֣ה גְדוֹלָ֔ה וְגַ֧ם הַנָּשִׁ֛ים וְהַיְלָדִ֖ים שָׂמֵ֑חוּ וַתִּשָּׁמַ֛ע שִׂמְחַ֥ת יְרוּשָׁלַ֖͏ִם מֵרָחֽוֹק׃
Translated: On that day, they offered great sacrifices and rejoiced, for God made them rejoice greatly; the women and children also rejoiced, and the rejoicing in Jerusalem could be heard from afar.
Transliteration: vayizevechu vayyvom-hahu zevachiym gedvoliym vayishemachu khiy haElohim shimecham shimechah gedvolah vegam hanashiym vehayeladiym shamechu vatishama shimechat yerushala͏im merachvok

Hebrew: וַיִּפָּקְד֣וּ בַיּוֹם֩ הַה֨וּא אֲנָשִׁ֜ים עַל־הַנְּשָׁכ֗וֹת לָא֨וֹצָר֥וֹת לַתְּרוּמוֹת֮ לָרֵאשִׁ֣ית וְלַמַּֽעַשְׂרוֹת֒ לִכְנ֨וֹס בָּהֶ֜ם לִשְׂדֵ֤י הֶעָרִים֙ מְנָא֣וֹת הַתּוֹרָ֔ה לַכֹּהֲנִ֖ים וְלַלְוִיִּ֑ם כִּ֚י שִׂמְחַ֣ת יְהוּדָ֔ה עַל־הַכֹּהֲנִ֥ים וְעַל־הַלְוִיִּ֖ם הָעֹמְדִֽים׃
Translated: At that time men were appointed over the chambers that served as treasuries for the gifts, the first fruits, and the tithes, into which the portions prescribed by the Teaching for the priests and Levites were gathered from the fields of the towns; for the people of Judah were grateful to the priests and Levites who were in attendance,
Transliteration: vayifakedu vayyvom hahu anashiym al-haneshakhvot lavotsarvot laterumvot lareshiyt velamaashervot likhenvos vahem lishedey heariym menavot hatvorah lakhohaniym velaleviyim khiy shimechat yehudah al-hakhohaniym veal-haleviyim haomediym

Hebrew: וַֽיִּשְׁמְר֞וּ מִשְׁמֶ֤רֶת אֱלֹֽהֵיהֶם֙ וּמִשְׁמֶ֣רֶת הַֽטׇּהֳרָ֔ה וְהַמְשֹׁרְרִ֖ים וְהַשֹּׁעֲרִ֑ים כְּמִצְוַ֥ת דָּוִ֖יד שְׁלֹמֹ֥ה בְנֽוֹ׃
Translated: who kept the charge of their God and the charge of purity, as well as to the singers and gatekeepers [serving] in accord with the ordinance of David and Solomon his son—
Transliteration: vayishemeru mishemeret eloheyhem umishemeret hatׇhorah vehameshoreriym vehashoariym khemitsevat daviyd shelomoh venvo

Hebrew: כִּֽי־בִימֵ֥י דָוִ֛יד וְאָסָ֖ף מִקֶּ֑דֶם (ראש) [רָאשֵׁי֙] הַמְשֹׁ֣רְרִ֔ים וְשִׁיר־תְּהִלָּ֥ה וְהֹד֖וֹת לֵֽאלֹהִֽים׃
Translated: for the chiefs of the singers and songs of praise and thanksgiving to God already existed in the time of David and Asaph.
Transliteration: khiy-viymey daviyd veasaf mikedem (rsh) [rashey] hameshoreriym veshiyr-tehilah vehodvot lelohiym

Hebrew: וְכׇל־יִשְׂרָאֵל֩ בִּימֵ֨י זְרֻבָּבֶ֜ל וּבִימֵ֣י נְחֶמְיָ֗ה נֹ֥תְנִ֛ים מְנָי֛וֹת הַמְשֹׁרְרִ֥ים וְהַשֹּׁעֲרִ֖ים דְּבַר־י֣וֹם בְּיוֹמ֑וֹ וּמַקְדִּשִׁים֙ לַלְוִיִּ֔ם וְהַ֨לְוִיִּ֔ם מַקְדִּשִׁ֖ים לִבְנֵ֥י אַהֲרֹֽן׃ {פ}
Translated: And in the time of Zerubbabel, and in the time of Nehemiah, all Israel contributed the daily portions of the singers and the gatekeepers, and made sacred contributions for the Levites, and the Levites made sacred contributions for the Aaronites.
Transliteration: vekhׇl-yisherael viymey zeruvavel uviymey nechemeyah noteniym menayvot hameshoreriym vehashoariym devar-yvom veyvomvo umakedishiym laleviyim vehaleviyim makedishiym liveney aharon {f}

Hebrew: בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֗וּא נִקְרָ֛א בְּסֵ֥פֶר מֹשֶׁ֖ה בְּאׇזְנֵ֣י הָעָ֑ם וְנִמְצָא֙ כָּת֣וּב בּ֔וֹ אֲ֠שֶׁ֠ר לֹא־יָב֨וֹא עַמֹּנִ֧י וּמוֹאָבִ֛י בִּקְהַ֥ל הָאֱלֹהִ֖ים עַד־עוֹלָֽם׃
Translated: At that time they read to the people from the Book of Moses, and it was found written that no Ammonite or Moabite might ever enter the congregation of God,
Transliteration: vayyvom hahu nikera vesefer mosheh veׇzeney haam venimetsa khatuv vvo asher lo-yavvo amoniy umvoaviy vikehal haElohim ad-volam

Hebrew: כִּ֣י לֹ֧א קִדְּמ֛וּ אֶת־בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל בַּלֶּ֣חֶם וּבַמָּ֑יִם וַיִּשְׂכֹּ֨ר עָלָ֤יו אֶת־בִּלְעָם֙ לְקַֽלְל֔וֹ וַיַּהֲפֹ֧ךְ אֱלֹהֵ֛ינוּ הַקְּלָלָ֖ה לִבְרָכָֽה׃
Translated: since they did not meet Israel with bread and water, and hired Balaam against them to curse them; but our God turned the curse into a blessing.
Transliteration: khiy lo kidemu et-veney yisherael valechem uvamayiim vayishekhor alayv et-vileam lekalelvo vayahafokhe eloheynu hakelalah liverakhah

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֖י כְּשׇׁמְעָ֣ם אֶת־הַתּוֹרָ֑ה וַיַּבְדִּ֥ילוּ כׇל־עֵ֖רֶב מִיִּשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: When they heard the Teaching, they separated all the alien admixture from Israel.
Transliteration: vayehiy kheshׇmeam et-hatvorah vayavediylu khׇl-erev miyisherael

Hebrew: וְלִפְנֵ֣י מִזֶּ֔ה אֶלְיָשִׁיב֙ הַכֹּהֵ֔ן נָת֖וּן בְּלִשְׁכַּ֣ת בֵּית־אֱלֹהֵ֑ינוּ קָר֖וֹב לְטוֹבִיָּֽה׃
Translated: Earlier, the priest Eliashib, a relative of Tobiah, who had been appointed over the rooms in the House of our God,
Transliteration: velifeney mizeh eleyashiyv hakhohen natun velishekhat veyt-eloheynu karvov letvoviyah

Hebrew: וַיַּ֨עַשׂ ל֜וֹ לִשְׁכָּ֣ה גְדוֹלָ֗ה וְשָׁ֣ם הָי֪וּ לְפָנִ֟ים נֹ֠תְנִ֠ים אֶת־הַמִּנְחָ֨ה הַלְּבוֹנָ֜ה וְהַכֵּלִ֗ים וּמַעְשַׂ֤ר הַדָּגָן֙ הַתִּיר֣וֹשׁ וְהַיִּצְהָ֔ר מִצְוַת֙ הַלְוִיִּ֔ם וְהַמְשֹׁרְרִ֖ים וְהַשּׁוֹעֲרִ֑ים וּתְרוּמַ֖ת הַכֹּהֲנִֽים׃
Translated: had assigned to him a large room where they used to store the meal offering, the frankincense, the equipment, the tithes of grain, wine, and oil, the dues of the Levites, singers and gatekeepers, and the gifts for the priests.
Transliteration: vayaash lvo lishekhah gedvolah vesham hayu lefaniym noteniym et-haminechah halevvonah vehakheliym umaeshar hadagan hatiyrvosh vehayitsehar mitsevat haleviyim vehameshoreriym vehashvoariym uterumat hakhohaniym

Hebrew: וּבְכׇל־זֶ֕ה לֹ֥א הָיִ֖יתִי בִּֽירוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם כִּ֡י בִּשְׁנַת֩ שְׁלֹשִׁ֨ים וּשְׁתַּ֜יִם לְאַרְתַּחְשַׁ֤סְתְּא מֶֽלֶךְ־בָּבֶל֙ בָּ֣אתִי אֶל־הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ וּלְקֵ֥ץ יָמִ֖ים נִשְׁאַ֥לְתִּי מִן־הַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃
Translated: During all this time, I was not in Jerusalem, for in the thirty-second year of King Artaxerxes of Babylon, I went to the king, and only after a while did I ask leave of the king [to return].
Transliteration: uvekhׇl-zeh lo hayiytiy viyrushala͏im khiy vishenat sheloshiym ushetayiim learetacheshasete melekhe-vavel vatiy el-hamelekhe ulekets yamiym nishealetiy min-hamelekhe

Hebrew: וָאָב֖וֹא לִֽירוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם וָאָבִ֣ינָה בָרָעָ֗ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר עָשָׂ֤ה אֶלְיָשִׁיב֙ לְט֣וֹבִיָּ֔ה לַעֲשׂ֥וֹת לוֹ֙ נִשְׁכָּ֔ה בְּחַצְרֵ֖י בֵּ֥ית הָאֱלֹהִֽים׃
Translated: When I arrived in Jerusalem, I learned of the outrage perpetrated by Eliashib on behalf of Tobiah in assigning him a room in the courts of the House of God.
Transliteration: vaavvo liyrushala͏im vaaviynah varaah asher ashah eleyashiyv letvoviyah laashvot lvo nishekhah vechatserey veyt haElohim

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֥רַֽע לִ֖י מְאֹ֑ד וָֽאַשְׁלִ֜יכָה אֶֽת־כׇּל־כְּלֵ֧י בֵית־טוֹבִיָּ֛ה הַח֖וּץ מִן־הַלִּשְׁכָּֽה׃
Translated: I was greatly displeased, and had all the household gear of Tobiah thrown out of the room;
Transliteration: vayera liy meod vaasheliykhah et-khׇl-kheley veyt-tvoviyah hachuts min-halishekhah

Hebrew: וָאֹ֣מְרָ֔ה וַֽיְטַהֲר֖וּ הַלְּשָׁכ֑וֹת וָאָשִׁ֣יבָה שָּׁ֗ם כְּלֵי֙ בֵּ֣ית הָאֱלֹהִ֔ים אֶת־הַמִּנְחָ֖ה וְהַלְּבוֹנָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: I gave orders to purify the rooms, and had the equipment of the House of God and the meal offering and the frankincense put back.
Transliteration: vaomerah vayetaharu haleshakhvot vaashiyvah sham kheley veyt haElohim et-haminechah vehalevvonah {f}

Hebrew: וָאֵ֣דְעָ֔ה כִּֽי־מְנָי֥וֹת הַלְוִיִּ֖ם לֹ֣א נִתָּ֑נָה וַיִּבְרְח֧וּ אִישׁ־לְשָׂדֵ֛הוּ הַלְוִיִּ֥ם וְהַמְשֹׁרְרִ֖ים עֹשֵׂ֥י הַמְּלָאכָֽה׃
Translated: I then discovered that the portions of the Levites had not been contributed, and that the Levites and the singers who performed the [temple] service had made off, each to his fields.
Transliteration: vaedeah khiy-menayvot haleviyim lo nitanah vayiverechu iysh-leshadehu haleviyim vehameshoreriym oshey hamelakhah

Hebrew: וָאָרִ֙יבָה֙ אֶת־הַסְּגָנִ֔ים וָאֹ֣מְרָ֔ה מַדּ֖וּעַ נֶעֱזַ֣ב בֵּית־הָאֱלֹהִ֑ים וָֽאֶקְבְּצֵ֔ם וָֽאַעֲמִדֵ֖ם עַל־עׇמְדָֽם׃
Translated: I censured the prefects, saying, “How is it that the House of God has been neglected?” Then I recalled [the Levites] and installed them again in their posts;
Transliteration: vaariyvah et-haseganiym vaomerah madua neezav veyt-haElohim vaekevetsem vaaamidem al-ׇmedam

Hebrew: וְכׇל־יְהוּדָ֗ה הֵבִ֜יאוּ מַעְשַׂ֧ר הַדָּגָ֛ן וְהַתִּיר֥וֹשׁ וְהַיִּצְהָ֖ר לָאוֹצָרֽוֹת׃
Translated: and all Judah brought the tithes of grain, wine, and oil into the treasuries.
Transliteration: vekhׇl-yehudah heviyu maeshar hadagan vehatiyrvosh vehayitsehar lavotsarvot

Hebrew: וָאוֹצְרָ֣ה עַל־א֠וֹצָר֠וֹת שֶׁלֶמְיָ֨ה הַכֹּהֵ֜ן וְצָד֣וֹק הַסּוֹפֵ֗ר וּפְדָיָה֙ מִן־הַלְוִיִּ֔ם וְעַ֨ל־יָדָ֔ם חָנָ֥ן בֶּן־זַכּ֖וּר בֶּן־מַתַּנְיָ֑ה כִּ֤י נֶאֱמָנִים֙ נֶחְשָׁ֔בוּ וַעֲלֵיהֶ֖ם לַחֲלֹ֥ק לַאֲחֵיהֶֽם׃ {פ}
Translated: I put the treasuries in the charge of the priest Shelemiah, the scribe Zadok, and Pedaiah of the Levites; and assisting them was Hanan son of Zaccur son of Mattaniah—for they were regarded as trustworthy persons, and it was their duty to distribute the portions to their brothers.
Transliteration: vavotserah al-votsarvot shelemeyah hakhohen vetsadvok hasvofer ufedayah min-haleviyim veal-yadam chanan ven-zakhur ven-mataneyah khiy neemaniym necheshavu vaaleyhem lachalok laacheyhem {f}

Hebrew: זׇכְרָה־לִּ֥י אֱלֹהַ֖י עַל־זֹ֑את וְאַל־תֶּ֣מַח חֲסָדַ֗י אֲשֶׁ֥ר עָשִׂ֛יתִי בְּבֵ֥ית אֱלֹהַ֖י וּבְמִשְׁמָרָֽיו׃
Translated: O my God, remember me favorably for this, and do not blot out the devotion I showed toward the House of my God and its attendants.
Transliteration: zׇkherah-liy elohay al-zot veal-temach chasaday asher ashiytiy veveyt elohay uvemishemarayv

Hebrew: בַּיָּמִ֣ים הָהֵ֡מָּה רָאִ֣יתִי בִֽיהוּדָ֣ה <small>׀</small> דֹּֽרְכִֽים־גִּתּ֣וֹת <small>׀</small> בַּשַּׁבָּ֡ת וּמְבִיאִ֣ים הָעֲרֵמ֣וֹת וְֽעֹמְסִ֪ים עַל־הַחֲמֹרִ֟ים וְאַף־יַ֜יִן עֲנָבִ֤ים וּתְאֵנִים֙ וְכׇל־מַשָּׂ֔א וּמְבִיאִ֥ים יְרוּשָׁלַ֖͏ִם בְּי֣וֹם הַשַּׁבָּ֑ת וָאָעִ֕יד בְּי֖וֹם מִכְרָ֥ם צָֽיִד׃
Translated: At that time I saw men in Judah treading winepresses on the sabbath, and others bringing heaps of grain and loading them onto asses, also wine, grapes, figs, and all sorts of goods, and bringing them into Jerusalem on the sabbath. I admonished them there and then for selling provisions.
Transliteration: vayamiym hahemah raiytiy viyhudah <small></small> dorekhiym-gitvot <small></small> vashavat umeviyiym haaremvot veomesiym al-hachamoriym veaf-yayiin anaviym uteeniym vekhׇl-masha umeviyiym yerushala͏im veyvom hashavat vaaiyd veyvom mikheram tsayiid

Hebrew: וְהַצֹּרִים֙ יָ֣שְׁבוּ בָ֔הּ מְבִיאִ֥ים דָּ֖אג וְכׇל־מֶ֑כֶר וּמוֹכְרִ֧ים בַּשַּׁבָּ֛ת לִבְנֵ֥י יְהוּדָ֖ה וּבִירוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃
Translated: Tyrians who lived there brought fish and all sorts of wares and sold them on the sabbath to the Judahites in Jerusalem.
Transliteration: vehatsoriym yashevu vah meviyiym dag vekhׇl-mekher umvokheriym vashavat liveney yehudah uviyrushala͏im

Hebrew: וָאָרִ֕יבָה אֵ֖ת חֹרֵ֣י יְהוּדָ֑ה וָאֹמְרָ֣ה לָהֶ֗ם מָֽה־הַדָּבָ֨ר הָרָ֤ע הַזֶּה֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר אַתֶּ֣ם עֹשִׂ֔ים וּֽמְחַלְּלִ֖ים אֶת־י֥וֹם הַשַּׁבָּֽת׃
Translated: I censured the nobles of Judah, saying to them, “What evil thing is this that you are doing, profaning the sabbath day!
Transliteration: vaariyvah et chorey yehudah vaomerah lahem mah-hadavar hara hazeh asher atem oshiym umechaleliym et-yvom hashavat

Hebrew: הֲל֨וֹא כֹ֤ה עָשׂוּ֙ אֲבֹ֣תֵיכֶ֔ם וַיָּבֵ֨א אֱלֹהֵ֜ינוּ עָלֵ֗ינוּ אֵ֚ת כׇּל־הָרָעָ֣ה הַזֹּ֔את וְעַ֖ל הָעִ֣יר הַזֹּ֑את וְאַתֶּ֞ם מוֹסִיפִ֤ים חָרוֹן֙ עַל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל לְחַלֵּ֖ל אֶת־הַשַּׁבָּֽת׃ {פ}
Translated: This is just what your ancestors did, and for it God brought all this misfortune on this city; and now you give cause for further wrath against Israel by profaning the sabbath!”
Transliteration: halvo khoh ashu avoteykhem vayave eloheynu aleynu et khׇl-haraah hazot veal haiyr hazot veatem mvosiyfiym charvon al-yisherael lechalel et-hashavat {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֡י כַּאֲשֶׁ֣ר צָֽלְלוּ֩ שַׁעֲרֵ֨י יְרוּשָׁלַ֜͏ִם לִפְנֵ֣י הַשַּׁבָּ֗ת וָאֹֽמְרָה֙ וַיִּסָּגְר֣וּ הַדְּלָת֔וֹת וָאֹ֣מְרָ֔ה אֲשֶׁר֙ לֹ֣א יִפְתָּח֔וּם עַ֖ד אַחַ֣ר הַשַּׁבָּ֑ת וּמִנְּעָרַ֗י הֶֽעֱמַ֙דְתִּי֙ עַל־הַשְּׁעָרִ֔ים לֹא־יָב֥וֹא מַשָּׂ֖א בְּי֥וֹם הַשַּׁבָּֽת׃
Translated: When shadows filled the gateways of Jerusalem at the approach of the sabbath, I gave orders that the doors be closed, and ordered them not to be opened until after the sabbath. I stationed some of my servants at the gates, so that no goods should enter on the sabbath.
Transliteration: vayehiy khaasher tsalelu shaarey yerushala͏im lifeney hashavat vaomerah vayisageru hadelatvot vaomerah asher lo yifetachum ad achar hashavat uminearay heemadetiy al-hasheariym lo-yavvo masha veyvom hashavat

Hebrew: וַיָּלִ֨ינוּ הָרֹכְלִ֜ים וּמֹכְרֵ֧י כׇל־מִמְכָּ֛ר מִח֥וּץ לִירוּשָׁלָ֖͏ִם פַּ֥עַם וּשְׁתָּֽיִם׃
Translated: Once or twice the merchants and the vendors of all sorts of wares spent the night outside Jerusalem,
Transliteration: vayaliynu harokheliym umokherey khׇl-mimekhar michuts liyrushala͏im faam ushetayiim

Hebrew: וָאָעִ֣ידָה בָהֶ֗ם וָאֹמְרָ֤ה אֲלֵיהֶם֙ מַדּ֜וּעַ אַתֶּ֤ם לֵנִים֙ נֶ֣גֶד הַחוֹמָ֔ה אִם־תִּשְׁנ֕וּ יָ֖ד אֶשְׁלַ֣ח בָּכֶ֑ם מִן־הָעֵ֣ת הַהִ֔יא לֹא־בָ֖אוּ בַּשַּׁבָּֽת׃ {פ}
Translated: but I warned them, saying, “What do you mean by spending the night alongside the wall? If you do so again, I will lay hands upon you!” From then on they did not come on the sabbath.
Transliteration: vaaiydah vahem vaomerah aleyhem madua atem leniym neged hachvomah im-tishenu yad eshelach vakhem min-haet hahiy lo-vau vashavat {f}

Hebrew: וָאֹמְרָ֣ה לַלְוִיִּ֗ם אֲשֶׁ֨ר יִֽהְי֤וּ מִֽטַּהֲרִים֙ וּבָאִים֙ שֹׁמְרִ֣ים הַשְּׁעָרִ֔ים לְקַדֵּ֖שׁ אֶת־י֣וֹם הַשַּׁבָּ֑ת גַּם־זֹאת֙ זׇכְרָה־לִּ֣י אֱלֹהַ֔י וְח֥וּסָה עָלַ֖י כְּרֹ֥ב חַסְדֶּֽךָ׃ {פ}
Translated:
I gave orders to the Levites to purify themselves and come and guard the gates, to preserve the sanctity of the sabbath.
This too, O my God, remember to my credit, and spare me in accord with your abundant faithfulness.
Transliteration: vaomerah laleviyim asher yiheyu mitahariym uvaiym shomeriym hasheariym lekadesh et-yvom hashavat gam-zot zׇkherah-liy elohay vechusah alay kherov chasedekha {f}

Hebrew: גַּ֣ם ׀ בַּיָּמִ֣ים הָהֵ֗ם רָאִ֤יתִי אֶת־הַיְּהוּדִים֙ הֹשִׁ֗יבוּ נָשִׁים֙ (אשדודיות) [אַשְׁדֳּדִיּ֔וֹת] (עמוניות) [עַמֳּנִיּ֖וֹת] מוֹאֲבִיּֽוֹת׃
Translated: Also at that time, I saw that Jews had married Ashdodite, Ammonite, and Moabite women;
Transliteration: gam vayamiym hahem raiytiy et-hayehudiym hoshiyvu nashiym (shdvdyvt) [ashedodiyyvot] (mvnyvt) [amoniyyvot] mvoaviyyvot

Hebrew: וּבְנֵיהֶ֗ם חֲצִי֙ מְדַבֵּ֣ר אַשְׁדּוֹדִ֔ית וְאֵינָ֥ם מַכִּירִ֖ים לְדַבֵּ֣ר יְהוּדִ֑ית וְכִלְשׁ֖וֹן עַ֥ם וָעָֽם׃
Translated: a good number of their children spoke the language of Ashdod and the language of those various peoples, and did not know how to speak Judean.
Transliteration: uveneyhem chatsiy medaver ashedvodiyt veeynam makhiyriym ledaver yehudiyt vekhileshvon am vaam

Hebrew: וָאָרִ֤יב עִמָּם֙ וָאֲקַֽלְלֵ֔ם וָאַכֶּ֥ה מֵהֶ֛ם אֲנָשִׁ֖ים וָֽאֶמְרְטֵ֑ם וָאַשְׁבִּיעֵ֣ם בֵּֽאלֹהִ֗ים אִם־תִּתְּנ֤וּ בְנֹֽתֵיכֶם֙ לִבְנֵיהֶ֔ם וְאִם־תִּשְׂאוּ֙ מִבְּנֹ֣תֵיהֶ֔ם לִבְנֵיכֶ֖ם וְלָכֶֽם׃
Translated: I censured them, cursed them, flogged them, tore out their hair, and adjured them by God, saying, “You shall not give your daughters in marriage to their sons, or take any of their daughters for your sons or yourselves.
Transliteration: vaariyv imam vaakalelem vaakheh mehem anashiym vaemeretem vaasheviyem velohiym im-titenu venoteykhem liveneyhem veim-tisheu mivenoteyhem liveneykhem velakhem

Hebrew: הֲל֣וֹא עַל־אֵ֣לֶּה חָטָֽא־שְׁלֹמֹ֣ה מֶ֣לֶךְ יִשְׂרָאֵ֡ל וּבַגּוֹיִ֣ם הָרַבִּים֩ לֹֽא־הָיָ֨ה מֶ֜לֶךְ כָּמֹ֗הוּ וְאָה֤וּב לֵֽאלֹהָיו֙ הָיָ֔ה וַיִּתְּנֵ֣הוּ אֱלֹהִ֔ים מֶ֖לֶךְ עַל־כׇּל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל גַּם־אוֹת֣וֹ הֶחֱטִ֔יאוּ הַנָּשִׁ֖ים הַנׇּכְרִיּֽוֹת׃
Translated: It was just in such things that King Solomon of Israel sinned! Among the many nations there was not a king like him, and so well loved was he by his God that God made him king of all Israel, yet foreign wives caused even him to sin.
Transliteration: halvo al-eleh chata-shelomoh melekhe yisherael uvagvoyim haraviym lo-hayah melekhe khamohu veahuv lelohayv hayah vayitenehu Elohim melekhe al-khׇl-yisherael gam-votvo hechetiyu hanashiym hanׇkheriyyvot

Hebrew: וְלָכֶ֣ם הֲנִשְׁמַ֗ע לַעֲשֹׂת֙ אֵ֣ת כׇּל־הָרָעָ֤ה הַגְּדוֹלָה֙ הַזֹּ֔את לִמְעֹ֖ל בֵּֽאלֹהֵ֑ינוּ לְהֹשִׁ֖יב נָשִׁ֥ים נׇכְרִיּֽוֹת׃
Translated: How, then, can we acquiesce in your doing this great wrong, breaking faith with our God by marrying foreign women?”
Transliteration: velakhem hanishema laashot et khׇl-haraah hagedvolah hazot limeol veloheynu lehoshiyv nashiym nׇkheriyyvot

Hebrew: וּמִבְּנֵ֨י יוֹיָדָ֤ע בֶּן־אֶלְיָשִׁיב֙ הַכֹּהֵ֣ן הַגָּד֔וֹל חָתָ֖ן לְסַנְבַלַּ֣ט הַחֹרֹנִ֑י וָאַבְרִיחֵ֖הוּ מֵעָלָֽי׃
Translated: One of the sons of Joiada son of the high priest Eliashib was a son-in-law of Sanballat the Horonite; I drove him away from me.
Transliteration: umiveney yvoyada ven-eleyashiyv hakhohen hagadvol chatan lesanevalat hachoroniy vaaveriychehu mealay

Hebrew: זׇכְרָ֥ה לָהֶ֖ם אֱלֹהָ֑י עַ֚ל גׇּאֳלֵ֣י הַכְּהֻנָּ֔ה וּבְרִ֥ית הַכְּהֻנָּ֖ה וְהַלְוִיִּֽם׃
Translated: Remember to their discredit, O my God, how they polluted the priesthood, the covenant of the priests and Levites.
Transliteration: zׇkherah lahem elohay al gׇoley hakhehunah uveriyt hakhehunah vehaleviyim

Hebrew:
וְטִֽהַרְתִּ֖ים מִכׇּל־נֵכָ֑ר {פ}
וָאַעֲמִ֧ידָה מִשְׁמָר֛וֹת לַכֹּהֲנִ֥ים וְלַלְוִיִּ֖ם אִ֥ישׁ בִּמְלַאכְתּֽוֹ׃
Translated: I purged them of every foreign element, and arranged for the priests and the Levites to work each at his task by shifts,
Transliteration:
vetiharetiym mikhׇl-nekhar {f}
vaaamiydah mishemarvot lakhohaniym velaleviyim iysh vimelakhetvo

Hebrew: וּלְקֻרְבַּ֧ן הָעֵצִ֛ים בְּעִתִּ֥ים מְזֻמָּנ֖וֹת וְלַבִּכּוּרִ֑ים זׇכְרָה־לִּ֥י אֱלֹהַ֖י לְטוֹבָֽה׃
Translated:
and for the wood offering [to be brought] at fixed times and for the first fruits.
O my God, remember it to my credit!
Transliteration: ulekurevan haetsiym veitiym mezumanvot velavikhuriym zׇkherah-liy elohay letvovah
